AI.eng_def: abbreviation for artificial intelligence  or  artificial insemination
AI.chi_def: 人工智慧（artificial intelligence的縮寫）；人工授精（artificial insemination的縮寫）

Antarctic.eng_def: the very cold area around the South Pole that includes Antarctica and the surrounding seas
Antarctic.eg: The protection of the Antarctic from commercial exploitation is an important goal of environmentalists.

Antarctic.eng_def: belonging or relating to Antarctica or the Antarctic

April.eng_def: the fourth month of the year, after March and before May

Arctic.eng_def: the very cold area around the North Pole
Arctic.eg: Polar bears live in the Arctic.

Arctic.eng_def: belonging or relating to the Arctic
Arctic.eg: No trees grow in the Arctic regions.
The North of England has been experiencing Arctic conditions these past few days.

August.eng_def: having great importance and especially of the highest social class
August.chi_def: （尤指因社會地位高而）威嚴的，令人敬畏的
August.eg: the society's august patron, the Duke of Norfolk

August.eng_def: the eighth month of the year, after July and before September
August.eg: They usually go to their holiday home in August.

Bible.eng_def: (a copy of) the holy book of the Christian religion consisting of the Old and New Testaments, or the holy book of the Jewish religion consisting of the Law, the Prophets, and the Writings
Bible.chi_def: 基督教《聖經》（包括《舊約》和《新約》）；猶太教《聖經》（包括《律法書》、《先知書》以及《聖錄》）
Bible.eg: In the Bible it says that Adam and Eve were the first human beings.

Bible.eng_def: a book, magazine, etc. that gives important advice and information about a particular subject
Bible.eg: Vogue magazine quickly became the bible of fashionable women.

CD.eng_def: abbreviation for compact disc : a small plastic disk with a shiny surface on which information, especially high-quality sound, is recorded
CD.chi_def: 雷射唱片，光碟（compact disc的縮寫）

China.eng_def: clay of a high quality that is shaped and then heated to make it permanently hard, or objects made from this, such as cups and plates

Christmas.eng_def: (the period just before and after) 25 December, a Christian holy day that celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ
Christmas.eg: We're going to my mother's for Christmas.

Coke.eng_def: a solid, grey substance that is burned as a fuel, left after coal is heated and the gas and tar removed

Confucius.eng_def: a Chinese philosopher, politician, and teacher, who lived from 551 - 479 BCE
Confucius.chi_def: 孔子（西元前551-479年，中國哲學家、政治家和教育家）

December.eng_def: the twelfth and last month of the year, after November and before January
December.eg: My parents got married in December.

English.eng_def: the language that is spoken in the UK, the US, and in many other countries
in or relating to the English language

FALSE.eng_def: not real, but made to look or seem real
not true, but made to seem true in order to deceive people
FALSE.eg: She was charged with giving false evidence in court.

FALSE.eng_def: If you do something under false pretences, you lie about who you are, what you are doing, or what you intend to do, in order to get something.
FALSE.chi_def: 靠欺詐手段；以虛假的藉口
FALSE.eg: He was deported for entering the country under false pretences.
"Three plus three is seven. True or false?" "False."

FALSE.eng_def: not sincere or expressing real emotions
A false friend is not loyal or cannot be trusted.

Fahrenheit.eng_def: (of) a measurement of temperature on a standard in which 32° is the temperature at which water freezes and 212° that at which it boils
Fahrenheit.chi_def: 華氏的；華氏溫標（冰點為32度，沸點為212度）
Fahrenheit.eg: Shall I give you the temperature in Celsius or in Fahrenheit?

February.eng_def: the second month of the year, after January and before March
February.eg: Construction is expected to start in February.

Friday.eng_def: the day of the week after Thursday and before Saturday
Friday.eg: Shall we go to the theatre on Friday?

Internet.eng_def: the large system of connected computers around the world that allows people to share information and communicate with each other
Internet.eg: I found out about the bombings from/on the internet.

January.eng_def: the first month of the year, after December and before February

July.eng_def: the seventh month of the year, after June and before August
July.eg: The film festival is in July.

June.eng_def: the sixth month of the year, after May and before July
June.eg: A lot of people get married in June.

Mandarin.eng_def: a small, sweet type of orange that has a thinner, looser skin
a person who has a very important job in the government, and who is sometimes considered to be too powerful
Mandarin.eg: It often seems that true power lies with the Civil Service mandarins, rather than MPs and cabinet ministers.

Mandarin.eng_def: a Chinese language that is the official language of China, and an official language of Singapore

March.eng_def: an event in which a large number of people walk through a public place to express their support for something, or their disagreement with or disapproval of something
March.eg: She's going on a march on Saturday in protest over the closure of the hospital.

March.eng_def: a piece of music with a strong, regular beat, written for marching to
a walk, especially by a group of soldiers all walking with the same movement and speed
March.eg: It had been a long march and the soldiers were weary.

March.eng_def: If soldiers are on the march, they have started marching to a place.
the continuous development of a state, activity, or idea
March.eg: It is impossible to stop the forward march of progress/time.

March.eng_def: to walk somewhere quickly and in a determined way, often because you are angry
March.eg: She marched into my office and demanded to know why I hadn't written my report.

March.eng_def: to walk through a public place as part of a public event to express support for something, or disagreement with or disapproval of something
March.eg: Over four thousand people marched through London today to protest against the proposed new law.

March.eng_def: to walk with regular steps and keeping the body stiff, usually in a formal group of people who are all walking in the same way
March.eg: The band marched through the streets.

March.eng_def: to forcefully make someone go somewhere by taking hold of that person and pulling them there or going there together
March.eg: Without saying a word, she took hold of my arm and marched me off to the headmaster's office.

March.eng_def: the third month of the year, after February and before April
March.eg: The next meeting will be in March.

May.eg: There may be other problems that we don't know about.

May.eng_def: used to ask or give permission
May.chi_def: （用於請求許可或表示允許）可以
May.eg: A reader may borrow up to six books at any one time.

May.eng_def: used to introduce a wish or a hope
May.eg: May you have a long and fruitful marriage.

May.eng_def: the flowers of the hawthorn tree
the fifth month of the year, after April and before June
May.eg: My mother's birthday is in May.

Monday.eng_def: the day of the week after Sunday and before Tuesday
Monday.eg: I start my new job on Monday.

November.eng_def: the eleventh month of the year, after October and before December
November.eg: He's starting his new job in November.

O.K..eng_def: used to show that you agree with something or agree to do something
O.K..chi_def: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
O.K..eg: "I'll pay you back tomorrow." "OK, no problem."

O.K..eng_def: used to check that someone understands something or that they agree to something
O.K..chi_def: （用於確認某人是否明白或同意某事）明白嗎？好嗎？
O.K..eg: You need to add more vinegar, OK?

O.K..eng_def: used as a way of showing that you are going to take action or start something new
O.K..chi_def: （用於表示打算行動或開始新的活動）行，好吧

O.K..eng_def: used in the middle of a sentence as a way of pausing
O.K..eg: We saw these guys, okay, so we went up to them and started talking.

O.K..chi_def: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
O.K..eg: Is it okay if I bring a friend to the party?

O.K..eng_def: in a satisfactory state or of a satisfactory quality
O.K..chi_def: 令人滿意的；可以的；不錯的
O.K..eg: How's Paula? Is she okay after her fall yesterday?

O.K..eng_def: not bad but certainly not good
O.K..chi_def: 還可以的，還行的，湊合的
O.K..eg: "Did you have a good dinner out last night?" "It was okay - I've definitely had better."
Everything was going OK until the printer stopped working.
Have the committee OK'd your proposal?
He got the OK to go ahead with his project.

O.K..eng_def: written abbreviation for the US state of Oklahoma: used in addresses
O.K..chi_def: （美國）奧克拉荷馬州，奧克拉何馬州（寫地址時Oklahoma的縮寫）

OK.eng_def: used to show that you agree with something or agree to do something
OK.chi_def: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
OK.eg: "I'll pay you back tomorrow." "OK, no problem."

OK.eng_def: used to check that someone understands something or that they agree to something
OK.chi_def: （用於確認某人是否明白或同意某事）明白嗎？好嗎？
OK.eg: You need to add more vinegar, OK?

OK.eng_def: used as a way of showing that you are going to take action or start something new
OK.chi_def: （用於表示打算行動或開始新的活動）行，好吧

OK.eng_def: used in the middle of a sentence as a way of pausing
OK.eg: We saw these guys, okay, so we went up to them and started talking.

OK.chi_def: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
OK.eg: Is it okay if I bring a friend to the party?

OK.eng_def: in a satisfactory state or of a satisfactory quality
OK.chi_def: 令人滿意的；可以的；不錯的
OK.eg: How's Paula? Is she okay after her fall yesterday?

OK.eng_def: not bad but certainly not good
OK.chi_def: 還可以的，還行的，湊合的
OK.eg: "Did you have a good dinner out last night?" "It was okay - I've definitely had better."
Everything was going OK until the printer stopped working.
Have the committee OK'd your proposal?
He got the OK to go ahead with his project.

OK.eng_def: written abbreviation for the US state of Oklahoma: used in addresses
OK.chi_def: （美國）奧克拉荷馬州，奧克拉何馬州（寫地址時Oklahoma的縮寫）

October.eng_def: the tenth month of the year, after September and before November
October.eg: We have a meeting in October that you are welcome to attend.

Saturday.eng_def: the day of the week after Friday and before Sunday

September.eng_def: the ninth month of the year, after August and before October
September.eg: My mother's birthday is in September.

Sunday.eng_def: the day of the week after Saturday and before Monday, when most people in Western countries do not go to work
Sunday.eg: We're going to visit my aunt and uncle on Sunday.

T-shirt.eng_def: a simple piece of clothing, usually with short sleeves and no collar, that covers the top part of the body
T-shirt.chi_def: T恤衫，短袖圓領汗衫，短袖圓領運動衫
T-shirt.eg: She was wearing jeans and a T-shirt.

TRUE.eng_def: (especially of facts or statements) right and not wrong; correct
TRUE.chi_def: （尤指事實或陳述）正確的，真實的，確實的；如實的
TRUE.eg: Is it true that Mariana and Mark are getting married?

TRUE.eng_def: correct or accurate but not completely explaining something
TRUE.chi_def: （雖然是正確或準確的，但是不足以解釋某事）沒錯
TRUE.eg: It's true enough that he had doubts about the project, but we have to look further to understand why he resigned.

TRUE.eng_def: being what exists, rather than what was thought, intended, or stated
If a hope, wish, or dream comes true, it happens although it was unlikely that it would.
TRUE.eg: I'd always dreamed of owning my own house, but I never thought it would come true.

TRUE.eng_def: sincere or loyal, and likely to continue to be so in difficult situations
TRUE.eg: There are few true believers in communism left in the party.

TRUE.eng_def: to behave according to your beliefs and do what you think is right
TRUE.chi_def: 堅持自己的信念；對得起自己

TRUE.eng_def: Someone who does something true to form or type behaves as other people would have expected from previous experience.
TRUE.eg: True to form, when it came to his turn to buy the drinks, he said he'd left his wallet at home.

TRUE.eng_def: having all the characteristics necessary to be accurately described as something
TRUE.chi_def: 真正的，純正的；名副其實的；典型的
位於正確位置的；端正的
TRUE.eg: None of the drawers were true.

TRUE.eng_def: to not be in the correct position or to be slightly bent out of the correct shape
TRUE.eg: This door won't shut. I think the frame must be out of true.

TRUE.eng_def: straight and without moving to either side
TRUE.eg: Make sure you hit the nails in true.

Thursday.eng_def: the day of the week after Wednesday and before Friday
Thursday.eg: I'm getting my hair cut after work on Thursday.

Tuesday.eng_def: the day of the week after Monday and before Wednesday
Tuesday.eg: We'll meet at eight on Tuesday.

Wednesday.eng_def: the day of the week after Tuesday and before Thursday
Wednesday.eg: Did you say the meeting is on Wednesday?

X-ray.eng_def: a type of radiation that can go through many solid substances, allowing hidden objects such as bones and organs in the body to be photographed
a photograph of a part of the body made using X-rays
X-ray.eg: The X-ray showed a slight irregularity in one lung.

X-ray.eng_def: an examination of a part of the body by taking and studying an X-ray photograph
X-ray.eg: She had an X-ray to see if any of her ribs were broken.

Xerox.eng_def: a brand name for a copy of a document or other piece of paper with writing or printing on it, made by a machine that uses a photographic process, or the machine or process itself
Xerox.chi_def: 靜電複印件；靜電複印機

Xerox.eng_def: to make a copy of a document using a Xerox or other copying machine

Xmas.eg: Merry Xmas to all our customers.

abandon.eng_def: to leave a place, thing, or person, usually for ever
abandon.eg: We had to abandon the car.

abandon.eng_def: to stop doing an activity before you have finished it
abandon.eg: The game was abandoned at half-time because of the poor weather conditions.

abandon.eng_def: to allow yourself to be controlled completely by a feeling or way of living
abandon.eg: He abandoned himself to his emotions.

abbreviate.eng_def: to make a word or phrase shorter by using only the first letters of each word

abbreviation.eng_def: a short form of a word or phrase

abdomen.eng_def: the lower part of a person's or animal's body, containing the stomach, bowels, and other organs, or the end of an insect's body
abdomen.chi_def: （人或動物的）腹（部）；（昆蟲的）腹部

abide.eng_def: If you can't abide someone or something, you dislike them very much.
abide.chi_def: （因為厭惡而）不能忍受，無法容忍

abide.eg: He abided in the wilderness for forty days.

ability.eng_def: the physical or mental power or skill needed to do something
ability.chi_def: （體力或智力方面的）能力；才能，才智

ability.eng_def: used to form nouns from adjectives ending in "-able" to mean the quality of being the stated adjective
ability.chi_def: （用於把以 -able 或 -ible 結尾的形容詞轉化為名詞，表示這些形容詞具有的特性）…性

able.eng_def: to have the necessary physical strength, mental power, skill, time, money, or opportunity to do something
able.eg: Will she be able to cope with the work?

able.eng_def: to find it easier to do something
able.eg: Get a good night's sleep and you'll feel better able to cope.

able.eng_def: intelligent or good at what you do
added to verbs to form adjectives that mean able to receive the action of the stated verb
able.chi_def: （加在某些動詞後構成形容詞，表示可接受這些動詞所表示行為的）可…的，能…的

able.eng_def: added to verbs to form adjectives that mean worth receiving the action of the stated verb
able.chi_def: （加在某些動詞後構成形容詞，表示值得接受這些動詞所表示行為的）值得…的；應…的

abnormal.eng_def: different from what is usual or average, especially in a way that is bad
abnormal.chi_def: 反常的；異常的；變態的（尤指不好的）

aboard.eng_def: on or onto a ship, aircraft, bus, or train
aboard.chi_def: 上船（或飛機、公共汽車、火車等）；在船（或飛機、公共汽車、火車等）上
aboard.eg: The flight attendant welcomed us aboard.

abolish.eng_def: to end an activity or custom officially
abolish.eg: I think bullfighting should be abolished.

aboriginal.eng_def: used to refer to a person or living thing that has existed in a country or continent since the earliest time known to people

aborigine.eng_def: a word for a member of one of the groups of people who were the first people to live in Australia, which was used officially in the past, but is now offensive
aborigine.chi_def: 对澳大利亚土著居民的侮辱性称呼

abortion.eng_def: the intentional ending of a pregnancy
abortion.chi_def: （通常指透過手術進行的）墮胎，人工流產
abortion.eg: She decided to have/get an abortion.
This project is a complete abortion.

abound.eg: Theories abound about how the universe began.

about.eng_def: on the subject of, or connected with
positioned around a place, often without a clear purpose or order
about.eg: Their belongings were flung about the room.
Do you have such a thing as a pen about you/your person? (= Do you have a pen?)

about.eng_def: a little more or less than the stated number or amount

about.eg: They heard someone moving about outside.

about.eng_def: positioned around a place, often without a clear purpose or order
about.eg: She always leaves her clothes lying about on the floor.

about.eng_def: to be going to do something very soon
about.eg: I was about to leave when Mark arrived.

above.eng_def: in or to a higher position than something else
above.chi_def: 在（或向）…上面；在（或向）…較高處
above.eg: There's a mirror above the sink.

above.eng_def: more than an amount or level
above.eg: It says on the box it's for children aged three and above.

above.chi_def: 最重要的是；尤其是；首先
above.eg: Above all, I'd like to thank my family.

above.eng_def: in a more important or advanced position than someone else
too good or important for something
above.eg: No one is above suspicion in this matter.

above.eng_def: When used in a piece of writing, "above" means higher on the page, or on a previous page.
above.chi_def: （同頁中）上面提到的（地）；上文（的），前文（的）
above.eg: Please send the articles to the address given above.

above.eng_def: all the people or things listed earlier
above.chi_def: 前面列出的所有人（或事物）
above.eg: All of the above should be invited.

abroad.eng_def: in or to a foreign country or countries

abroad.eg: Not a soul was abroad that morning.

abroad.eng_def: used to say that ideas, feelings, and opinions are shared by many people
abroad.eg: There's a rumour abroad that she intends to leave the company.

abrupt.eng_def: sudden and unexpected, and often unpleasant
using too few words when talking, in a way that seems rude and unfriendly

absence.eng_def: the fact of not being where you are usually expected to be
absence.eg: A new manager was appointed during/in her absence.
He drew attention to the absence of concrete evidence against the defendant.

absent.eng_def: not in the place where you are expected to be, especially at school or work
absent.chi_def: （尤指上課或工作）缺勤的；缺席的；不在場的
absent.eg: John has been absent from school/work for three days now.
Any sign of remorse was completely absent from her face.

absent.eng_def: used to describe a person or the expression on a person's face when they are thinking about other things and are not paying attention to what is happening near them

absent.eg: Absent a detailed plan, the project was doomed from the start.

absent.eng_def: to not go to a place where you are expected to be, especially a school or place of work
absent.chi_def: （尤指上課或工作時）缺席，缺勤，不在場
absent.eg: You cannot choose to absent yourself (from work/school) on a whim.

absolute.eng_def: very great or to the largest degree possible
absolute.chi_def: 完全的；全部的；絕對的；毋庸置疑的

absolute.eng_def: used when expressing a strong opinion
absolute.chi_def: （用於強調觀點）道地的，十足的

absolute.eng_def: true, right, or the same in all situations and not depending on anything else
absolute.chi_def: 絕對的；不會更改的；獨立的；不受制於外部條件的

absolute.eng_def: An absolute ruler has unlimited power.
absolute.chi_def: 不受任何限制（或約束）的；專制獨裁的

absorb.eng_def: to take something in, especially gradually
to reduce the effect of a physical force, shock, or change
absorb.chi_def: 消減；緩解（衝力、震動、改變等）
absorb.eg: The barrier absorbed the main impact of the crash.

absorb.eng_def: to understand facts or ideas completely and remember them
absorb.eg: It's hard to absorb so much information.

absorb.eng_def: to take up someone's attention completely
absorb.chi_def: （使）完全吸引住；（使）全神貫注於…
absorb.eg: The project has absorbed her for several years.

absorb.eng_def: if a business absorbs the cost of something, it pays that cost easily
absorb.eg: The school has absorbed most of the expenses so far, but it may have to offer fewer places next year to reduce costs.

absorb.eng_def: if one company absorbs another company, it takes control of it and they become one company
absorb.eg: Telecorp Holdings absorbed its Spanish subsidiary into its British headquarters.

abstract.eng_def: existing as an idea, feeling, or quality, not as a material object
abstract.chi_def: 抽象的；純理論的；純概念的
abstract.eg: Truth and beauty are abstract concepts.

abstract.eng_def: An abstract argument or discussion is general and not based on particular examples.
abstract.chi_def: （辯論或討論）抽象的；空泛的；空洞的
abstract.eg: This debate is becoming too abstract - let's have some hard facts!
I have difficulty dealing with the abstract - let's discuss particular cases.

abstract.eng_def: used to refer to a type of painting, drawing, or sculpture that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things
a short form of a speech, article, book, etc., giving only the most important facts or ideas
abstract.eg: There is a section at the end of the magazine that includes abstracts of recent articles/books.

abstract.eng_def: a painting that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things
abstract.chi_def: 抽象畫；抽象派藝術作品

abstraction.eng_def: the situation in which a subject is very general and not based on real situations

absurd.eng_def: stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way
absurd.chi_def: 荒謬的，荒唐的；愚蠢的；可笑的
absurd.eg: What an absurd thing to say!

absurd.eng_def: things that happen that are stupid or unreasonable
absurd.eg: The whole situation borders on the absurd.

abundance.eng_def: the situation in which there is more than enough of something
abundance.eg: There was an abundance of food at the wedding.

abuse.eng_def: to use something for the wrong purpose in a way that is harmful or morally wrong
abuse.chi_def: （尤指為個人私利而）濫用；妄用
abuse.eg: She is continually abusing her position/authority by getting other people to do things for her.

abuse.eng_def: to treat someone cruelly or violently
abuse.eg: Several of the children had been sexually/physically/emotionally abused.

abuse.eng_def: to speak to someone rudely or cruelly
abuse.eg: The crowd started abusing him after he failed to save a goal.

abuse.eng_def: the use of something in a way that is harmful or morally wrong
abuse.chi_def: （尤指出於個人私利的）濫用；妄用
abuse.eg: an abuse (= wrong use) of privilege/power/someone's kindness

abuse.eng_def: cruel, violent, or unfair treatment of someone
abuse.eg: She claimed to have been a victim of child abuse .

abuse.eng_def: rude and offensive words said to another person
abuse.eg: He had apparently experienced a lot of verbal abuse from his co-workers.

academic.eng_def: relating to schools, colleges, and universities, or connected with studying and thinking, not with practical skills
used to describe someone who is clever and enjoys studying
academic.eg: I was never a particularly academic child.

academic.eng_def: based on ideas and theories and not related to practical effects in real life
academic.chi_def: 純理論的；和實際無關的

academic.eng_def: someone who teaches at a college, or who studies as part of their job
the subjects that you study in high school or college

academy.eng_def: an organization intended to protect and develop an art, science, language, etc., or a school that teaches a particular subject or trains people for a particular job
the part of a football club that trains young players who might one day become part of the first team
academy.chi_def: （足球俱樂部的）青少年足球學校
academy.eg: The youth academy starts training talented young players from the age of eight.

academy.eng_def: a school in the UK that is not controlled by the local authority and receives its money directly from the central government
academy.chi_def: 英國的一種學校，不受地方政府管轄，經費直接來自中央政府

accelerate.eng_def: When a vehicle or its driver accelerates, the speed of the vehicle increases.
accelerate.eg: I accelerated to overtake the bus.

accelerate.eng_def: If a person or object accelerates, he, she, or it goes faster.
to happen or make something happen sooner or faster
accelerate.chi_def: （使）加快，（使）增速；促進；提前，（促使）早日發生
accelerate.eg: Inflation is likely to accelerate this year, adding further upward pressure on interest rates.

acceleration.eng_def: the increase in something's speed, or its ability to go faster
acceleration.eg: An older car will have poor acceleration.

acceleration.eng_def: the increase in the speed at which something happens
acceleration.eg: The acceleration in the decline of manufacturing industry began several years ago.

accent.eng_def: the way in which people in a particular area, country, or social group pronounce words
accent.eg: He's got a strong southern/Boston accent.

accent.eng_def: a mark written or printed over a letter to show you how to pronounce it
a special emphasis given to a particular syllable in a word, word in a sentence, or note in a set of musical notes
accent.eg: The accent falls on the final syllable.

accent.eng_def: great importance is given to a particular thing or quality
accent.eg: This season the accent is definitely on long, flowing, romantic clothes.
In any advertising campaign, you must accent the areas where your product is better than the competition.

accept.eng_def: to say yes to an offer or invitation
accept.eg: We've offered her the job, but I don't know whether she'll accept it.

accept.eng_def: to consider something or someone as satisfactory
accept.eg: The manuscript was accepted for publication last week.

accept.eng_def: to believe that something is true
accept.eg: The police refused to accept her version of the story.

acceptable.eng_def: satisfactory and able to be agreed to or approved of
acceptable.chi_def: 令人滿意的；可以接受的；可容許的；贊同的
acceptable.eg: Clearly we need to come to an arrangement that is acceptable to both parties.

acceptable.eng_def: just good enough, but not very good
acceptable.eg: Her performance was acceptable, but not stunning.

acceptance.eng_def: general agreement that something is satisfactory or right, or that someone should be included in a group
acceptance.eg: The idea rapidly gained acceptance (= became approved of) in political circles.

acceptance.eng_def: the act of agreeing to an offer, plan, or invitation
acceptance.eg: Her acceptance of the award was very controversial.

acceptance.eng_def: the fact of accepting a difficult or unpleasant situation
acceptance.eg: His attitude to his children's behaviour is one of resigned acceptance.

access.eng_def: the method or possibility of getting near to a place or person
access.chi_def: 通道；途徑；（接近某地或某人的）機會（或方法）；（使用某物的）權利
access.eg: The only access to the village is by boat.

access.eng_def: the right or opportunity to use or look at something
access.chi_def: 使用或看見某物的權利或機會
access.eg: The system has been designed to give the user quick and easy access to the required information.

access.eng_def: to open a computer file (= a collection of information stored on a computer) in order to look at or change information in it

accessible.eng_def: able to be reached or easily got
accessible.chi_def: 可進入的，可接近的；可得到的
accessible.eg: The resort is easily accessible by road, rail, and air.
Lea Anderson is a choreographer who believes in making dance accessible.

accessory.eng_def: something added to a machine or to clothing that has a useful or decorative purpose
accessory.chi_def: 附件，配件，附屬品；裝飾品，配飾
accessory.eg: She wore a green wool suit with matching accessories (= shoes, hat, bag, etc.).

accessory.eng_def: someone who helps another person to commit a crime but does not take part in it
someone who helps someone after that person has committed a crime, for example by hiding them from the police
accessory.chi_def: （隱匿或協助主犯的）事後從犯

accessory.eng_def: someone who helps in the preparation of a crime

accident.eng_def: something bad that happens that is not expected or intended and that often damages something or injures someone
accident.eg: Josh had an accident and spilled water all over his work.

accident.eng_def: without intending to, or without being intended
accident.eg: I deleted the file by accident.

accidental.eg: Reports suggest that eleven soldiers were killed by accidental fire from their own side.

accidental.eng_def: a sign showing that there is a temporary change from the key signature (= the set of musical notes that should normally be played for a particular piece of music)
accidental.chi_def: 臨時變音記號，臨時升降號

accidental.eng_def: a bird that is found in a place where birds of its type are not usually found
accidental.chi_def: 出現在非通常棲息地的鳥
accidental.eg: You may spot accidentals driven in by the stormy weather.

accommodate.eng_def: to provide with a place to live or to be stored in
accommodate.chi_def: 為…提供住宿；容納；為…提供空間
accommodate.eg: New students may be accommodated in halls of residence.

accommodate.eng_def: to give what is needed to someone
accommodate.chi_def: 為…提供方便；對…予以照顧性考慮
accommodate.eg: The new policies fail to accommodate people with disabilities.

accommodate.eng_def: to change yourself or your behaviour to suit another person or new conditions
accommodate.eg: Some find it hard to accommodate themselves to the new working conditions.

accommodation.eng_def: a place to live, work, stay, etc. in
accommodation.eg: There's a shortage of cheap accommodation (= places to live).

accompany.eng_def: to go with someone or to be provided or exist at the same time as something
accompany.chi_def: 陪同，陪伴；伴隨，和…一起發生（或存在）
accompany.eg: The course books are accompanied by four CDs.

accompany.eng_def: to show someone how to get to somewhere
accompany.eg: Would you like me to accompany you to your room?

accompany.eng_def: to go with someone to a social event or to an entertainment
accompany.chi_def: 陪同，陪伴（某人參加社交或文娛活動）
accompany.eg: "May I accompany you to the ball?" he asked her.

accompany.eng_def: to sing or play an instrument with another musician or singer
accompany.eg: Miss Jessop accompanied Mr Bentley on the piano.

accomplish.eng_def: to finish something successfully or to achieve something
accomplish.eg: The students accomplished the task in less than ten minutes.

accomplishment.eng_def: something that is successful, or that is achieved after a lot of work or effort
accomplishment.eg: Getting the two leaders to sign a peace treaty was his greatest accomplishment.
We celebrated the successful accomplishment of our task.
Cordon bleu cookery is just one of her many accomplishments.

accord.eg: On 31 May the two leaders signed a peace accord.

accord.eng_def: If you do something of your own accord, you do it without being asked to do it.
accord.eg: She came of her own accord. No one asked her to come.

accord.eng_def: If people do something with one accord, they do it together and in complete agreement.
accord.eg: With one accord, the delegates walked out of the conference.

accord.eng_def: to treat someone specially, usually by showing respect
accord.chi_def: （通常指恭敬地）給予（特殊待遇）；授予
accord.eg: The massed crowds of supporters accorded him a hero's welcome.

accordance.eng_def: following or obeying a rule, law, wish, etc.
accordance.eg: In accordance with her wishes, she was buried in France.

according to.eg: According to Sarah they're not getting on very well at the moment.

according to.eng_def: in a way that agrees with
according to.eg: Students are all put in different groups according to their ability.

according to.eng_def: Something that happens according to plan happens in the way it was intended to.
according to.chi_def: 按部就班；按照計劃進行
according to.eg: Did it all go according to plan?

accordingly.eng_def: in a way that is suitable or right for the situation
accordingly.eg: When we receive your instructions we will act accordingly.

account.eng_def: an arrangement with a bank to keep your money there and to allow you to take it out when you need to
account.eg: I've opened an account with a building society.

account.eng_def: a written or spoken description of an event
account.eg: She gave a thrilling account of her life in the jungle.

account.chi_def: 根據各方面所說；據說；大家都說
account.eg: By all accounts, San Francisco is a city that's easy to fall in love with.

account.eng_def: If something is true by your own account, what you say is true although you have not proved it.
account.eg: By his own account, he's quite wealthy.
He doesn't drink alcohol on account of his poor health.

account.eng_def: an agreement with a shop or business that allows you to buy things and pay for them later
account.eg: Could you put it on/charge it to my account (= can I pay for it later), please?

account.eng_def: a customer who does business with a company
account.eg: If the advertising agency loses this account, it will make a big dent in their profits.
It's of no account to me whether he comes or not.

account.eng_def: to think of someone or something in the stated way
account.eg: She was accounted a genius by all who knew her work.

accountable.eng_def: Someone who is accountable is completely responsible for what they do and must be able to give a satisfactory reason for it.
accountable.chi_def: 應負責任的；應作解釋的；應加以說明的
accountable.eg: She is accountable only to the managing director.

accountant.eng_def: someone who keeps or examines the records of money received, paid, and owed by a company or person

accounting.eng_def: the skill or activity of keeping records of the money a person or organization earns and spends
the job of being an accountant

accumulate.eng_def: to collect a large number of things over a long period of time
accumulate.eg: As people accumulate more wealth, they tend to spend a greater proportion of their incomes.

accumulate.eng_def: to gradually increase in number or amount
accumulate.eg: A thick layer of dust had accumulated in the room.

accumulation.eng_def: an amount of something that has been collected
accumulation.eg: Despite this accumulation of evidence, the government persisted in doing nothing.

accuracy.eng_def: the fact of being exact or correct
accuracy.eg: We can predict changes with a surprising degree of accuracy.

accuracy.eng_def: the ability to do something without making mistakes

accurate.eng_def: correct, exact, and without any mistakes

accusation.eng_def: a statement saying that someone has done something morally wrong, illegal, or unkind, or the fact of accusing someone
accusation.eg: You can't just make wild accusations like that!

accuse.eng_def: to say that someone has done something morally wrong, illegal, or unkind
accuse.eg: "It wasn't my fault." "Don't worry, I'm not accusing you."

accuse.eng_def: If you stand accused of doing something wrong, people say that you have done it.
accuse.eg: The government stands accused of eroding freedom of speech.

ace.eng_def: one of the four playing cards with a single mark or spot. The ace has the highest or lowest value in many card games.
a person who is very skilled at something
ace.chi_def: 擅長…的人，精通…的人；能手

ace.eng_def: in tennis, a serve (= a hit of the ball that starts play) that is so strong and fast that the other player cannot return the ball
ace.eg: That's the third ace Lawson has served this match.

ace.eng_def: to do very well in an exam
ace.eg: I was up all night studying, but it was worth it - I aced my chemistry final.

ache.eng_def: a continuous pain that is unpleasant but not very strong
ache.eg: As you get older, you have all sorts of aches and pains.

ache.eng_def: used in combinations with parts of the body to mean a continuous pain in the stated part
ache.chi_def: （與表示身體部位的詞一起構成合成詞，表示該部位的持續疼痛）

ache.eng_def: to have a continuous pain that is unpleasant but not very strong

achieve.eng_def: to succeed in finishing something or reaching an aim, especially after a lot of work or effort
achieve.chi_def: （尤指經過努力）完成；達到；實現
achieve.eg: The government's training policy, he claimed, was achieving its objectives.

achievement.eng_def: something very good and difficult that you have succeeded in doing
achievement.eg: An Olympic silver medal is a remarkable achievement for one so young.

acid.eng_def: any of various usually liquid substances that can react with and sometimes dissolve other materials
slang for LSD (= an illegal drug that makes people see things that do not exist)
containing acid, or having similar qualities to an acid
used to describe a remark or way of speaking that is cruel or criticizes something in an unkind way

acknowledge.eng_def: to accept, admit, or recognize something, or the truth or existence of something
acknowledge.eg: She acknowledged having been at fault.

acknowledge.eng_def: to tell someone, usually in a letter or email, that you have received something they sent you
acknowledge.chi_def: （通過信函或電子郵件等）確認收悉
acknowledge.eg: Please acknowledge receipt of this letter.

acknowledgement.eng_def: the fact of accepting that something is true or right
acknowledgement.chi_def: 承認；認可…的屬實或存在
acknowledgement.eg: All I want is some acknowledgment that his behaviour is unreasonable.

acknowledgement.eng_def: something given to thank someone for what they have done
acknowledgement.eg: We sent her a copy of the book in acknowledgment of her part in its creation.

acknowledgement.eng_def: a letter or email to say that something has been received
acknowledgement.eg: I applied for four jobs, but I've only had one acknowledgment so far.

acknowledgement.eng_def: a short text at the beginning or end of a book where the writer names people or other works that have helped in writing the book
acknowledgement.chi_def: （作者在卷首或卷末的）致謝，鳴謝，感謝

acne.eng_def: a skin disease common in young people, in which small, red spots appear on the face and neck
acne.eg: Acne is the curse of adolescence.

acquaintance.eng_def: a person that you have met but do not know well
acquaintance.chi_def: 相識的人，熟人；泛泛之交

acquaintance.eng_def: used in some expressions about knowing or meeting people
acquaintance.chi_def: （用在某些表達方式中表示）認識，結識

Sadly, my acquaintance with Spanish literature is rather limited.

acquisition.eg: The acquisition of huge amounts of data has helped our research enormously.

acquisition.eng_def: something that someone buys, often to add to a collection of things
acquisition.eg: The museum's latest acquisition is a four-million-dollar sculpture.

acquisition.eng_def: something such as a building, another company, or a piece of land that is bought by a company, or the act of buying it
acquisition.chi_def: 收購物（房屋、公司、土地等）；收購

acre.eng_def: a unit for measuring area, equal to 4,047 square metres or 4,840 square yards
acre.eg: He's got 400 acres of land in Russia.

across.eng_def: from one side to the other of something with clear limits, such as an area of land, a road, or a river
across.chi_def: 從一邊到另一邊；穿過；橫過

across.eg: The library is just across the road.

across.eng_def: in every part of a particular place or country
across.eg: Voting took place peacefully across most of the country.

act.eng_def: to behave in the stated way
act.eg: Don't be so silly - you're acting like a child!

act.eng_def: to do something for a particular purpose or to solve a problem
act.eg: Engineers acted quickly to repair the damaged pipes.

act.eng_def: to perform a part in a film, play, etc.
act.eg: Ellis Pike was chosen to act the part of the lawyer in the film.

act.eng_def: to behave in a particular, usually bad, way
act.chi_def: （通常指裝腔作勢地）裝傻（作出一副假聖人的樣子等）
act.eg: Why are you always acting the fool?

act.eng_def: behaviour that hides your real feelings or intentions
act.chi_def: 裝模作樣；裝腔作勢；假裝
act.eg: Was she really upset or was that just an act?

act.eng_def: a person or group that performs a short piece in a show, or the piece that they perform.
act.chi_def: 表演者（或表演組合）；一段表演

act.eng_def: a part of a play or opera
act.eg: Shakespeare's plays were written in five acts.

act.eng_def: a law or formal decision made by a parliament or other group of people who make the laws for their country

action.eng_def: the process of doing something, especially when dealing with a problem or difficulty
action.chi_def: （尤指應對問題或困難的）行動；行動過程；行為
action.eg: This problem calls for swift/prompt action from the government.
She has to accept the consequences of her actions.
I'll say the words and you can mime the actions.

action.eng_def: things that are happening, especially exciting or important things
action.chi_def: 發生的事情；（尤指）令人激動的事或大事
action.eg: I like movies with a lot of action.

action.eng_def: at the place where something important or interesting is happening
action.chi_def: 大事（或趣事）發生的地方
action.eg: A journalist has to be where the action is.

action.eng_def: the effect something has on another thing
action.eg: They recorded the action of the drug on the nervous system.
Her younger son was killed in action.

action.eng_def: the way something moves or works
action.eg: We studied the action of the digestive system.

action.eng_def: a legal process that is decided in a law court
to do something to deal with a particular problem or matter
action.chi_def: 對…採取行動；就…採取措施
action.eg: I'll just run through the minutes of the last meeting, raising those points that still have to be actioned.

active.eg: Enemy forces remain active in the mountainous areas around the city.

active.eng_def: An active volcano is one that might erupt (= throw out hot liquid rock or other matter) at any time.
An active verb or sentence is one in which the subject is the person or thing that performs the stated action.
active.eg: "Catrin told me" is an active sentence, and "I was told by Catrin" is passive.

active.chi_def: 主動語態（同 the active voice）

activist.eng_def: a person who believes strongly in political or social change and takes part in activities such as public protests to try to make this happen
activist.chi_def: 激進主義分子，行動主義分子；積極分子
activist.eg: He's been a trade union/party activist for many years.

activity.eng_def: the situation in which a lot of things are happening or people are moving around
activity.eg: There was a lot of activity in preparation for the Queen's visit.

activity.eng_def: the work of a group or organization to achieve an aim
activity.eg: He was found guilty of terrorist activity.

activity.eng_def: something that is done for enjoyment, especially an organized event
activity.eg: His spare-time activities include cooking, tennis, and windsurfing.

actor.eng_def: someone who pretends to be someone else while performing in a film, play, or television or radio programme

actress.eg: She's the highest-paid actress in Hollywood.

actual.chi_def: 現實的，實際的；真實的，真正的
actual.eg: We had estimated about 300 visitors, but the actual number was much higher.
I thought she was Portuguese, but in actual fact she's Brazilian.

acute.eng_def: If a bad situation is acute, it causes severe problems or damage.
acute.eg: She felt acute embarrassment/anxiety/concern at his behaviour.

acute.eng_def: An acute pain or illness is one that quickly becomes very severe.
used to describe intelligence, senses, etc. that are very good, accurate, and able to notice very small differences
acute.chi_def: （感官等）敏銳的，靈敏的；機敏的，有洞察力的

acute.eng_def: An acute angle is less than 90 degrees.
a sign that is written above a letter in some languages, showing you how to pronounce the letter
acute.eg: There's an acute accent on the e in "café".

ad.eg: I often prefer the ads on TV to the actual programmes.

ad.eng_def: abbreviation for  Anno Domini : a Latin phrase meaning "in the year of the Lord", which is used when referring to a year after Jesus Christ was born
ad.chi_def: 西元（拉丁語Anno Domini的縮寫）
阿茲海默症，失智症（Alzheimer's的縮寫）

adapt.eng_def: to change something to suit different conditions or uses
adapt.chi_def: 使適應不同情況（或用途）；改動；改造；改裝；改編
adapt.eg: Many software companies have adapted popular programs to the new operating system.

adapt.eng_def: to become familiar with a new situation
adapt.eg: The good thing about children is that they adapt very easily to new environments.

adaptation.eng_def: the process of changing to suit different conditions
adaptation.eg: Evolution occurs as a result of adaptation to new environments.

adaptation.eng_def: a film, book, play, etc. that has been made from another film, book, play, etc.
adaptation.eg: Last year he starred in the film adaptation of Bill Cronshaw's best-selling novel.

add.eng_def: to put two or more numbers or amounts together to get a total
add.eg: If you add (= calculate the total of) three and four you get seven.

add.eng_def: to put something with something else to increase the number or amount or to improve the whole
add.eg: Beat the butter and sugar together and slowly add the eggs.
She was sad, she said, but added (= said also) that she felt she had made the right decision.

add.eng_def: abbreviation for Attention Deficit Disorder: a condition in which someone, especially a child, is often in a state of activity or excitement and unable to direct their attention towards what they are doing
add.chi_def: （尤指兒童的）注意力缺失症（Attention Deficit Disorder的縮寫）

addict.eng_def: a person who cannot stop doing or using something, especially something harmful
addict.chi_def: （尤指對有害之物）有癮的人，入迷的人

addition.eng_def: the process of adding numbers or amounts together
addition.eg: Twice a week the children are tested in basic mathematical skills such as addition (= calculating the total of different numbers put together) and subtraction.
In addition to his apartment in Manhattan, he has a villa in Italy and a castle in Scotland.

addition.eng_def: something that has been added to something else
addition.eg: A secretary would be a welcome/useful addition to our staff.

addition.eng_def: the act of adding a substance or thing to something else
addition.eg: Most working environments are improved by the addition of (= by adding) a few plants and pictures.

addition.eng_def: a new part added to a house or other building
addition.eg: We're building an addition to our house.

additional.chi_def: 外加的，附加的；額外的；另外的

address.eng_def: the number of the house, name of the road, and name of the town where a person lives or works, and where letters can be sent
a series of letters and symbols that tell you where to find something on the internet or show where an email is sent to
the place where a piece of information is stored in a computer's memory
address.chi_def: （電腦記憶體儲存資訊的）位址

address.eg: She gave an address to the Royal Academy.

address.eng_def: to speak or write to someone
address.chi_def: 對…講話，對…發表演說，致辭；給…寫信，致函
address.eg: He addressed a few introductory remarks to the audience.

address.eng_def: to give attention to or deal with a matter or problem
address.eg: The issue of funding has yet to be addressed.

address.eng_def: to write a name or address on an envelope or parcel
address.chi_def: 在（信封或包裹）上寫上姓名（或地址）

adequate.eng_def: enough or satisfactory for a particular purpose
adequate.chi_def: 足夠的；合格的；合乎需要的
adequate.eg: Have we got adequate food for 20 guests?

adjective.eng_def: a word that describes a noun or pronoun

adjust.eng_def: to change something slightly, especially to make it more correct, effective, or suitable
adjust.chi_def: （尤指為了使某物更正確、有效或合適而）調整，調節
adjust.eg: If the chair is too high you can adjust it to suit you.

adjust.eng_def: to arrange your clothing to make yourself look tidy
adjust.eg: She adjusted her skirt, took a deep breath, and walked into the room.

adjust.eng_def: to become more familiar with a new situation
adjust.eg: I can't adjust to living on my own.

adjustment.eg: She made a few minor adjustments to the focus of her camera.

adjustment.eng_def: the ability to become more familiar with a new situation
adjustment.eg: He has so far failed to make the adjustment from school to work.

administer.eng_def: to control the operation or arrangement of something
administer.eg: The economy has been badly administered by the present government.

administer.eng_def: to govern a country, region, etc.
administer.eg: The economy has been badly administered by the present government.

administer.eng_def: to cause someone to receive something
to be present while someone says an oath (= a formal promise) officially

administrate.eng_def: to control the operation or arrangement of something
administrate.eg: The economy has been badly administered by the present government.

administrate.eng_def: to govern a country, region, etc.
administrate.eg: The economy has been badly administered by the present government.

administrate.eng_def: to cause someone to receive something
to be present while someone says an oath (= a formal promise) officially

administration.eng_def: the arrangements and tasks needed to control the operation of a plan or organization
administration.eg: Teachers complain that more of their time is taken up with administration than with teaching.

administration.eng_def: the people in an organization who manage its business and operations
administration.chi_def: （企業、機關等的）管理人員；行政人員；管理部門
administration.eg: The decision to cancel the trip was made by the school administration.

administration.eng_def: a period of government, or the people who are in government
administration.chi_def: 壹屆政府或政府人員（如總統及其內閣）
administration.eg: the Obama administration/the last Republican administration

administration.eng_def: the act of giving someone something
administration.eg: There are strict controls on the administration of drugs.

administration.eng_def: the process that takes place when a company cannot pay its debts and is allowed to make changes to its organization to try to avoid going into liquidation (= when a business is closed and the things it owns are sold)
administration.chi_def: 管理令程序，即公司資不抵債時的一種拯救程序，允許公司變更管理人以避免清算。
administration.eg: The company has gone into administration, in order for money to be returned to creditors.

administrative.eng_def: relating to the arrangements and work that is needed to control the operation of a plan or organization

administrator.eng_def: someone whose job is to control the operation of a business, organization, or plan
administrator.eg: From 1969 to 1971, he was administrator of the Illinois state drug abuse program.

admirable.chi_def: 可欽佩的；值得羨慕的；令人讚賞的
admirable.eg: I think you showed admirable tact/restraint/self-control in your answer.

admiral.eng_def: an officer of very high rank in the navy
admiral.chi_def: 海軍將軍；海軍上將；艦隊司令

admiration.eng_def: the feeling of admiring someone or something
admiration.eg: My admiration for that woman grows daily.

admire.eng_def: to find someone or something attractive and pleasant to look at
admire.eg: We stood for a few moments, admiring the view.

admire.eng_def: to respect and approve of someone or their behaviour
admire.eg: I admired him for his determination.

admission.eng_def: the act of agreeing that something is true, especially unwillingly
admission.chi_def: （尤指不情願的）承認；供認；招認
admission.eg: Her silence was taken as an admission of guilt/defeat.

admission.eng_def: the money that you pay to enter a place
admission.eg: How much do they charge for admission?
Admission to the exhibition will be by invitation only.

admission.eng_def: the people allowed into a college, hospital, or other place, or the process of allowing people in
admission.chi_def: （大學、醫院等）接收的人數；准許加入
admission.eg: Half of all hospital admissions are emergencies, and these are treated straight away.

admit.eng_def: to agree that something is true, especially unwillingly
admit.chi_def: （尤指不情願地）承認；供認；招認

admit.eng_def: to accept that you have failed and give up
admit.eg: After several attempts to untie the knot, I admitted defeat and cut through it with a knife.

admit.eng_def: to allow someone to enter a place
admit.eg: Each ticket admits one member and one guest.

admit.eng_def: to allow a person or country to join an organization
admit.eg: Spain was admitted to the European Community in 1986.

admit.eng_def: to allow someone to enter a hospital because they need medical care
admit.eg: She was admitted to hospital suffering from shock.

adolescence.eng_def: the period of time in a person's life when they are developing into an adult

adolescent.eng_def: a young person who is developing into an adult
being or relating to an adolescent
used to describe an adult or an adult's behaviour that is silly and like a child's
adolescent.chi_def: （成年人或其行為）孩子氣的，幼稚的

adopt.eng_def: to legally take another person's child into your own family and take care of him or her as your own child
to accept or start to use something new
adopt.eg: I think it's time to adopt a different strategy in my dealings with him.

adopt.eng_def: to choose someone or something or take something as your own
adopt.eg: Dr Kennedy has been adopted as the party's candidate for South Cambridge.

adopt.eng_def: to start behaving in a particular way, especially by choice
adopt.eg: Roz has adopted one or two funny mannerisms since she's been away.

adore.eng_def: to love someone very much, especially in a way that shows a lot of admiration or respect, or to like something very much
adore.chi_def: （尤指崇敬地）愛慕，熱愛；非常喜歡
adore.eg: She has one son and she adores him.
Let us adore God for all his works.

adult.eng_def: a person or animal that has grown to full size and strength
adult.eg: An adult under English law is someone over 18 years old.

adult.eng_def: grown to full size and strength
typical of or suitable for adults
adult.chi_def: 成熟的；成人的；適宜於成年人的
adult.eg: Let's try to be adult about this.

adult.eng_def: Adult films, magazines, and books show naked people and sexual acts and are not for children.
adult.chi_def: （電影、書刊等因有色情內容）僅限成人的，未成年人不宜的

adulthood.eng_def: the part of someone's life when they are an adult
adulthood.eg: People in England legally reach adulthood at 18.

advance.eng_def: to go or move something forward, or to develop or improve something
advance.chi_def: （使）前進；使進步，使進展；使發展；促進
advance.eg: The fire advanced steadily through the forest.

advance.eng_def: to pay someone some money before the regular time
advance.eg: Could you advance me £500 until Tuesday?

advance.eng_def: to suggest an idea or theory
advance.eg: the theory advanced in this article

advance.eng_def: If something such as a share price advances, it increases in value.
advance.eg: On the New York Stock Exchange 1,228 issues advanced and 1,157 declined .

advance.eng_def: the forward movement of something, or an improvement or development in something
advance.eg: Nothing could stop the advance of the floodwaters.

advance.eng_def: money paid to someone before the regular time
advance.eg: She asked for a £300 advance on her salary.

advance.eng_def: an attempt to start a sexual or romantic relationship with someone
something such as a share price that increases in value
advance.eg: Declining stocks easily defeated advances 413 to 302.

advance.eng_def: happening, done, or ready before an event

advanced.eg: This is the most advanced type of engine available.

advanced.eng_def: at a higher, more difficult level
a school class that is doing work of a higher standard than is usual for students at that stage in their education

advantage.eng_def: a condition giving a greater chance of success
advantage.chi_def: 有利條件，有利因素；優勢；好處
advantage.eg: The advantage of booking tickets in advance is that you get better seats.

advantage.eng_def: to use the good things in a situation
advantage.eg: I thought I'd take advantage of the sports facilities while I'm here.

advantage.eng_def: to treat someone badly in order to get something good from them
advantage.eg: I think she takes advantage of his good nature.

advantage.eng_def: the word used in tennis when a player has won the point after deuce
advantage.chi_def: （網球中的）局末平分後佔先，優勢分

advantage.eng_def: In games such as football, if a referee plays advantage, they do not stop the game when there is a foul because allowing play to continue gives an advantage to the team that has been fouled.
advantage.chi_def: （足球比賽中）裁判根據對被犯規方有利的原則允許比賽繼續進行
advantage.eg: The ref should have played advantage because Rooney would have been through on goal.

adventure.eng_def: an unusual, exciting, and possibly dangerous activity, such as a trip or experience, or the excitement produced by such an activity
adventure.eg: She had some exciting adventures in Egypt.

adverb.eng_def: a word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective, adverb, or phrase
adverb.eg: In the phrase "she smiled cheerfully", the word "cheerfully" is an adverb.

advertise.eng_def: to make something known generally or in public, especially in order to sell it

advertisement.eng_def: a picture, short film, song, etc. that tries to persuade people to buy a product or service, or a piece of text that tells people about a job, etc.
advertisement.eg: a television/newspaper advertisement for a new car

advertisement.eng_def: If you are an advertisement for something, you show its good effects.
advertisement.chi_def: 現身說法宣傳…的好處；是…的活廣告
advertisement.eg: I'm afraid I'm not a very good advertisement for the diet since I've actually put on weight!

advice.eng_def: an opinion that someone offers you about what you should do or how you should act in a particular situation

advise.chi_def: 勸告；忠告；向…提供意見，給…出主意

advise.eng_def: to give someone official information about something
advise.eg: They were advised of their rights.

adviser.eng_def: someone whose job is to give advice about a subject
adviser.eg: She is the party's main economic adviser.

advisor.eng_def: someone whose job is to give advice about a subject
advisor.eg: She is the party's main economic adviser.

advocate.eng_def: to publicly support or suggest an idea, development, or way of doing something
advocate.eg: She advocates taking a more long-term view.

advocate.eng_def: a lawyer who defends someone in a law court

advocate.chi_def: 主張人；擁護人；支持者；提倡者
advocate.eg: He's a strong advocate of state ownership of the railways.

affair.eng_def: a situation or subject that is being dealt with or considered
affair.eg: She organizes her financial affairs very efficiently.

affair.eng_def: a matter or situation that causes strong public feeling, usually of moral disapproval
affair.chi_def: （通常指在道德上被譴責的）事件

affair.eng_def: a sexual relationship, especially a secret one
affair.chi_def: （尤指秘密的）性關係；私通；風流韻事

affair.eng_def: an object of the type stated
affair.eg: She wore a long black velvet affair.

affect.eng_def: to have an influence on someone or something, or to cause a change in someone or something
affect.eg: Both buildings were badly affected by the fire.

affect.eng_def: to pretend to feel or think something
affect.eg: To all his problems she affected indifference.

affect.eng_def: to start to wear or do something in order to make people admire or respect you
affect.chi_def: （為引人注意或自抬身價而）刻意穿戴，故作
affect.eg: At university he affected an upper-class accent.

affection.eng_def: a feeling of liking for a person or place
affection.eg: She felt no affection for the child.

affection.eng_def: to succeed in persuading someone to love you

affectionate.eng_def: showing feelings of liking or love
affectionate.chi_def: 表示愛的；充滿深情的；有感情的

affirm.eg: The suspect affirmed (that) he had been at home all evening.

affirm.eng_def: to publicly show your support for an opinion or idea
affirm.eg: The government has affirmed its commitment to equal rights.

afford.eng_def: to be able to buy or do something because you have enough money or time
afford.eg: I don't know how he can afford a new car on his salary.

afford.eng_def: to allow someone to have something pleasant or necessary
afford.eg: The hut afforded little protection from the elements.

afraid.eng_def: feeling fear, or feeling worry about the possible results of a particular situation
afraid.chi_def: 畏懼的，害怕的；擔憂的，發愁的

afraid.eng_def: used to politely introduce bad news or disagreement
afraid.chi_def: （用來委婉地說出不好的消息或者反對意見）恐怕，很遺憾，對不起，抱歉

after.eng_def: following in time, place, or order

after.eng_def: to be looking for someone or something or trying to find or get him, her, or it

after.chi_def: （用於讓別人先走或先用飲食）你先請
after.eg: "Can I pour you some coffee?" "Oh no, after you."

after.eng_def: typical of or similar to the style of
used when giving someone or something the same name as another person or thing
after.eg: He was named Mark after his grandfather.

after.eng_def: later than someone or something else
after.eg: Hilary got here at midday and Nick arrived soon after.

after.eng_def: at a time that is later than another event
after.eg: Three months after they moved out, the house was still empty.

afternoon.eng_def: the period that starts at about twelve o'clock or after the meal in the middle of the day and ends at about six o'clock or when the sun goes down
a friendly way of greeting someone when you meet them in the afternoon

afterward.eg: We had tea, and afterwards we sat in the garden for a while.

afterwards.eg: We had tea, and afterwards we sat in the garden for a while.

again.eg: Could you spell your name again, please?

again.eng_def: back to the original place or condition

again.eng_def: If something happens once again, it has already happened several times before.
again.eg: You are reminded once again of the author's love of the sea.

again.eng_def: If you do something all over again, you start again from the beginning.

again.eng_def: in addition to the amount we know about or have mentioned already

against.eng_def: disagreeing with a plan or activity

against.eng_def: If you have something against someone, you dislike them for a reason.
against.chi_def: 因（某種原因）不喜歡（某人）

against.eng_def: next to and touching or being supported by (something)

against.eng_def: in front of or compared to

against.eng_def: as a protection or defence from the bad effects of

age.eng_def: the period of time someone has been alive or something has existed

age.eng_def: said to someone to tell them to stop behaving like someone who is much younger
the age at which someone is considered by the law to be old enough to agree to have sex with someone
the fact of being or getting older
age.eg: Her back was bent with age.

age.eng_def: If someone ages or something ages them, they look older.

age.eng_def: to develop in flavour or leave something to do this

age.eng_def: used to form nouns that refer to the action or result of something
used to form nouns that refer to a state or condition
used to form nouns that are names of places

agency.eng_def: a business that represents one group of people when dealing with another group

agency.chi_def: 政府專門機構；政府內的局，部，處

agency.eng_def: because of the actions of someone
agency.chi_def: 由於（某人）的作用；在（某人）的推動下

agenda.eng_def: a list of matters to be discussed at a meeting

agenda.eng_def: a list of aims or possible future achievements
agenda.eg: Women's rights have been put back on the agenda (= are being discussed publicly again).

agent.eng_def: a person who acts for or represents another

agent.eng_def: a person who represents an actor, artist, or writer
agent.chi_def: （演員、藝術家、作家等的）經紀人，代理人

agent.eng_def: someone who works secretly for the government or other organization
a person or thing that produces a particular effect or change

aggression.eng_def: spoken or physical behaviour that is threatening or involves harm to someone or something

aggression.eng_def: forceful playing in sport that is intended to win points

aggressive.eng_def: behaving in an angry and violent way towards another person
aggressive.chi_def: 好鬥的；富於攻擊性的；挑釁的

aggressive.eng_def: determined to win or succeed and using forceful action to win or to achieve success

ago.eng_def: back in time from the present

agony.eng_def: extreme physical or mental pain or suffering

agree.eg: Ann and I never seem to agree.

agree.chi_def: 對…一致同意；對…達成協議；批准；認可

agree.eng_def: to accept a suggestion or idea
agree.chi_def: （對建議或想法表示）同意，贊成，贊同

agree.eng_def: If two or more statements, ideas, sets of numbers, etc. agree, they are the same or very similar.
agree.eg: We have five accounts of what happened and none of them agree.

agree.eng_def: When two words agree, or one word agrees with another word, they have the same grammatical form. For example, the words may both be singular or plural, masculine or feminine, etc.
agree.chi_def: （在文法上的數、性等方面）呼應，一致

agreeable.chi_def: 令人愉悅的，愜意的，宜人的

agreeable.eng_def: able to be accepted by everyone

agreeable.eng_def: willing to do or accept something

agreement.eng_def: the situation in which people have the same opinion, or in which they approve of or accept something
agreement.eg: The whole family was in agreement with her about/on what they should do.

agreement.eng_def: a decision or arrangement, often formal and written, between two or more groups or people
agreement.eg: The dispute was settled by an agreement that satisfied both sides.

agreement.eng_def: the situation in which two words have the same grammatical form. For example, the words are both singular or plural, masculine or feminine, etc.
agreement.chi_def: 語法上的一致（如性數、人稱一致等）

agricultural.eng_def: used for farming or relating to farming
agricultural.eg: The world's supply of agricultural land is shrinking fast.

agriculture.eg: Agriculture is still largely based on traditional methods in some countries.

ahead.eg: The road ahead is very busy.

ahead.eng_def: having more points, votes, etc. than someone else in a competition, election, etc.
ahead.chi_def: （在比賽或競爭中）領先，佔優勢

ahead.eng_def: making more progress than someone else
ahead.eg: Sophie is way (= far) ahead of the other children in her class.
She has a difficult time ahead of her.

aid.eg: He gets about with the aid of a walking stick.

aid.eng_def: a piece of equipment that helps you to do something
aid.chi_def: 輔助物，輔助設施；輔助工具

aid.eng_def: help in the form of food, money, medical supplies, or weapons that is given by a richer country to a poorer country
aid.chi_def: （向貧弱國家提供的食品、金錢、醫療物資、武器等）援助，救助

aid.eng_def: in order to collect money for a group of people who need it

aid.eng_def: to help someone to do something illegal or wrong

aim.eng_def: a result that your plans or actions are intended to achieve

aim.eng_def: the act of pointing a weapon towards something

aim.eng_def: to point or direct a weapon towards someone or something that you want to hit
aim.eg: Aim (the arrow) a little above the target.

air.eng_def: the mixture of gases that surrounds the earth and that we breathe
air.eg: I went outside to get some fresh air.

air.eng_def: the space above the ground, especially high above the ground
air.eg: The air was filled with the scent of roses.
I don't travel much by air.
She has an air of confidence about her.

air.eng_def: If a programme or a person is on/off (the) air, they are/are not broadcasting on radio or television.
air.eg: The radio station is on air from 6 a.m.

air.eng_def: to make opinions or complaints known to other people

air.eng_def: to become dry and/or fresh, or to cause to become dry and/or fresh

aircraft.eng_def: any vehicle, with or without an engine, that can fly, such as a plane or helicopter

airline.eng_def: a business that operates regular services for carrying passengers and/or goods by aircraft

airmail.eng_def: a system of sending letters and parcels by aircraft

airplane.eng_def: a vehicle designed for air travel that has wings and one or more engines

airport.eng_def: a place where aircraft regularly take off and land, with buildings for passengers to wait in

airtight.eng_def: completely closed so that no air can get in or out

aisle.eng_def: a long, narrow space between rows of seats in an aircraft, cinema, or church

aisle.eng_def: a long, narrow space between the rows of shelves in a large shop
aisle.eg: You'll find the shampoo and the soap in the fourth aisle from the entrance.

alarm.eng_def: a warning of danger, usually a loud noise or flashing light

alarm.eng_def: a device that makes a loud noise to warn of danger
If an electronic device such as a watch or computer has an alarm, it can be set to make a noise at a particular time.
sudden worry and fear, especially that something dangerous or unpleasant might happen
alarm.eg: I didn't tell her that he was late because I didn't want to cause her any alarm.

alarm.eng_def: to make someone worried or frightened
alarm.eg: I didn't want to alarm him by telling him that she was ill.

album.eng_def: a collection of several pieces of music, made available as a single item on a CD, the internet, etc.
album.eg: Have you heard their new album?

album.eng_def: a book with plain pages, used for collecting together and protecting stamps, photographs, etc.

alcohol.eng_def: a clear liquid that can make you drunk, also used as a solvent (= a substance that dissolves another) and in fuel and medicines
alcohol.eg: Most wines contain around twelve percent alcohol.

alcoholic.eng_def: a person who is unable to give up the habit of drinking alcohol very often and in large amounts

alert.eng_def: quick to see, understand, and act in a particular situation
alert.eg: I'm not feeling very alert today - not enough sleep last night!

alert.eng_def: a warning to people to be prepared to deal with something dangerous
to warn someone of a possibly dangerous situation
alert.chi_def: 使警覺，使警惕；向…發出警報
alert.eg: An anonymous letter alerted police to the possibility of a terrorist attack at the airport.

algebra.eng_def: a part of mathematics in which signs and letters represent numbers

alien.eng_def: coming from a different country, race, or group

alien.chi_def: 怪異的；截然不同的；不熟悉的
alien.eg: When I first went to New York, it all felt very alien to me.

alien.eng_def: relating to creatures from another planet
someone who lives in a country of which they are not a legal citizen
alien.chi_def: （通常指不是所在國公民的）外國人，外僑，僑民
alien.eg: When war broke out the government rounded up thousands of aliens and put them in temporary camps.

alien.eng_def: a creature from a different planet

alienate.eng_def: to cause someone or a group of people to stop supporting and agreeing with you
alienate.eg: All these changes to the newspaper have alienated its traditional readers.

alienate.eng_def: to make someone feel that they are different and not part of a group

alike.eg: The children all look very alike.

alike.eng_def: used after referring to two groups of people or things to show that both groups are included
alike.eg: Friends and family alike were devastated by the news of her death.

alive.eg: He must be 90 if he's still alive.

alive.eng_def: If something is alive, it continues to exist.
alive.eg: Relatives of the missing sailors are struggling to keep their hopes alive.

all.eng_def: every one (of), or the complete amount or number (of), or the whole (of)

all.eng_def: considering all the different parts of the situation together
all.chi_def: 總的來說，從各方面來說；總之

all.eng_def: used when you make a comment or criticism, so that it seems less severe or is less likely to offend someone

The cake was all eaten last night.

all.eng_def: used after a number to mean that both teams or players in a game have equal points
all.eg: The score at half-time was still four all.
The game was all but over by the time we arrived.

all.eng_def: even or much better, stronger, more exciting, etc.

all.eng_def: used in front of many nouns to form adjectives meaning "every", "every type of", or "the whole of" that particular thing
all.chi_def: （用在很多名詞前，構成形容詞）每，各種，全部
all.eg: an all-night bar (= a bar that is open for the whole night)

all.eng_def: used in front of many adjectives and present participles to mean "everything" or "everyone"
all.chi_def: （用在很多形容詞和現在分詞前）所有，任何

all.eng_def: used in front of many nouns and adjectives to mean "completely"
all.chi_def: （用在很多名詞和形容詞前）完全，十分
all.eg: all-cotton socks (= socks that are made completely of cotton)

allergic.chi_def: 變應性的；過敏引起的；過敏性的

allergic.eng_def: having a strong dislike of something
allergic.eg: My dad's allergic to pop music.

allergy.eng_def: a condition that makes a person become sick or develop skin or breathing problems because they have eaten certain foods or been near certain substances
allergy.chi_def: 變應性；過敏反應；過敏性

alley.eng_def: a narrow road or path between buildings
a path in a park or garden, especially with trees or bushes on both sides
alley.chi_def: （尤指兩邊有樹或灌木的）小徑

alliance.eng_def: a group of countries, political parties, or people who have agreed to work together because of shared interests or aims
alliance.chi_def: 結盟國家（或團體），同盟國家（或團體）

alliance.eng_def: an agreement to work with someone else to try to achieve the same thing
alliance.eg: The three smaller parties have forged/formed an alliance against the government.

alligator.eng_def: a large reptile with a hard skin that lives in and near rivers and lakes in the hot, wet parts of America and China. It has a long nose that is slightly wider and shorter than that of a crocodile.

allocate.eng_def: to give something to someone as their share of a total amount, to use in a particular way
allocate.eg: The government is allocating £10 million for health education.

allow.eng_def: to give permission for someone to do something, or to not prevent something from happening
allow.chi_def: 使有可能；允許，准許；容許
allow.eg: Do you think Dad will allow you to go to Jamie's party?

allow.eng_def: a polite expression used when offering to help in some way
allow.eg: You can't carry all those bags yourself - please, allow me.

allow.eng_def: to admit or agree that something is true
allow.eg: She allowed that she might have been too suspicious.

allowance.eng_def: money that you are given regularly, especially to pay for a particular thing
allowance.chi_def: （尤指為特定事項支付的）定期補貼，津貼
allowance.eg: The perks of the job include a company pension and a generous travel allowance.

allowance.eng_def: an amount of something that you are allowed
allowance.eg: The baggage/luggage allowance for most flights is 20 kilos.

allowance.eng_def: an amount of money that parents regularly give to their child to spend as they choose
to prepare for the possibility of
allowance.chi_def: 顧及，考慮到；為…留出餘地
allowance.eg: We should make allowance for bad weather and have plenty of umbrellas available.

allowance.eng_def: To make allowances for someone is to think about their characteristics and not judge them too severely.
allowance.eg: You should make allowances for him - he's been quite ill recently.

ally.eng_def: a country that has agreed officially to give help and support to another one, especially during a war
ally.eg: The US is one of Britain's staunchest allies.

ally.eng_def: someone who helps and supports someone else
ally.eg: He is generally considered to be the prime minister's closest political ally.

almond.eng_def: an edible oval nut with a hard shell, or the tree that it grows on

almost.chi_def: 幾乎，差不多，差一點，將近

alone.chi_def: 單獨（的），獨自（的）；孤獨的（地），無伴的（地）
alone.eg: He likes being alone in the house.
She alone needs to decide what to do (= no one else can do it for her).

along.eng_def: from one part of a road, river, etc. to another
along.eg: a romantic walk along the beach/river

along.eng_def: in a line next to something long
along.chi_def: 沿著…的邊緣；沿著…成一行
along.eg: a row of houses along the river

along.eng_def: at a particular place on a road, river, etc.
along.eg: Somewhere along this road there's a garage.
We were just walking along, chatting.
Why don't you take him along with you when you go?

along.eng_def: in addition to someone or something else
along.eg: California, along with Florida and Hawaii, is among the most popular US tourist destinations.

aloud.eng_def: in a voice loud enough to be heard
aloud.eg: He read her letter aloud to the rest of the family.

alphabet.eng_def: a set of letters arranged in a fixed order, used for writing a language

already.eg: I asked him to come to the exhibition but he'd already seen it.
Are you buying Christmas cards already? It's only September!

also.eg: She's a photographer and also writes books.

alter.eng_def: to change something, usually slightly, or to cause the characteristics of something to change
alter.chi_def: （通常指輕微地）改動，修改；改變，（使）變化
alter.eg: We've had to alter some of our plans.

alter.eng_def: to change the size of clothes so that they fit better
alter.eg: I took the coat back to the shop to have it altered.

alter.eng_def: polite word for castrate  or  spay

alternate.eng_def: to happen or exist one after the other repeatedly
alternate.eg: She alternated between cheerfulness and deep despair.

alternate.eng_def: to make something happen or exist one after the other repeatedly
alternate.eg: He alternated working in the office with long tours overseas.

alternate.eng_def: with first one thing, then another thing, and then the first thing again
alternate.eg: a dessert with alternate layers of chocolate and cream

alternate.eng_def: If something happens on alternate days, it happens every second day.
alternate.eg: Private cars are banned from the city on alternate days.

alternate.eng_def: An alternate plan or method is one that you can use if you do not want to use another one.
a person or thing that can take the place of another
alternate.eg: David was too sick to attend, so Janet served as his alternate.

alternative.eng_def: An alternative plan or method is one that you can use if you do not want to use another one.
alternative.chi_def: （計劃或方法）可替代的；可供選擇的
alternative.eg: The opposition parties have so far failed to set out an alternative strategy.

alternative.eng_def: Alternative things are considered to be unusual and often have a small but enthusiastic group of people who support them.
something that is different from something else, especially from what is usual, and offering the possibility of choice
alternative.chi_def: （尤指不同於平常事物的）可供選擇的事物；可供選擇的解決辦法

although.eg: She walked home by herself, although she knew that it was dangerous.
He's rather shy, although he's not as bad as he used to be.

altitude.eg: We are currently flying at an altitude of 15,000 metres.

altogether.eg: The government ought to abolish the tax altogether.
He's bad-tempered, selfish, and altogether an unpleasant man.

aluminum.eng_def: a chemical element that is a light, silver-coloured metal, used especially for making cooking equipment and aircraft parts

always.eng_def: every time or all the time
always.eg: It's always cold in this room.

always.eng_def: at all times in the past
used with "can" or "could" to suggest another possibility
always.chi_def: （和 can 或 could 一起使用，表示另外的可能性）不論怎樣總還
always.eg: If you miss this train you can always catch the next one.

always.eng_def: again and again, usually in an annoying way

am.eng_def: used when referring to a time between twelve o'clock at night and twelve o'clock in the middle of the day
am.eg: The first election results are expected around 1 a.m.

am.eng_def: abbreviation for amplitude modulation: a type of radio broadcasting in which the strength of the signal changes, producing sound of a lower quality than FM
am.chi_def: 調幅（電臺的廣播方式之一，amplitude modulation的縮寫）
am.eg: You're listening to Radio Gold, broadcasting 24 hours a day on 909 AM.

am.eng_def: abbreviation for Assembly Member: a person who has been elected to the Welsh Assembly
am.chi_def: 威爾士議會議員（Assembly Member的縮寫）

amateur.eng_def: taking part in an activity for pleasure, not as a job
relating to an activity, especially a sport, where the people taking part do not receive money
amateur.chi_def: 業餘的；（尤指）業餘體育運動的

amateur.eng_def: a person who takes part in an activity for pleasure, not as a job
amateur.chi_def: 業餘愛好者；業餘運動員
amateur.eg: This tennis tournament is open to both amateurs and professionals.

amateur.eng_def: someone who does not have much skill in what they do
amateur.eg: I won't be giving them any more work - they're a bunch of amateurs.

amaze.eng_def: to cause someone to be extremely surprised
amaze.eg: I was amazed by how well he looked.
