ambassador.eng_def: an important official who works in a foreign country representing his or her own country there, and who is officially accepted in this position by that country
ambassador.eg: The UK's ambassador in Moscow has refused to comment.

ambiguity.eng_def: (an example of) the fact of something having more than one possible meaning and therefore possibly causing confusion
ambiguity.chi_def: 模稜兩可，意義含糊不清
ambiguity.eg: We wish to remove any ambiguity concerning our demands.

ambiguous.eng_def: having or expressing more than one possible meaning, sometimes intentionally
ambiguous.chi_def: 含糊不清的；引起歧義的，模棱兩可的；不明確的
ambiguous.eg: His reply to my question was somewhat ambiguous.

ambition.eng_def: a strong wish to achieve something
ambition.eg: His ambition is ultimately to run his own business.

ambition.eng_def: a strong wish to be successful, powerful, rich, etc.
ambition.eg: She has a lot of ambition.

ambitious.eng_def: having a strong wish to be successful, powerful, or rich
ambitious.chi_def: 有抱負的；志向遠大的；雄心勃勃的

ambitious.eng_def: If a plan or idea is ambitious, it needs a great amount of skill and effort to be successful or be achieved.
ambitious.chi_def: （計劃、想法）要求過高的；需要極大努力及才能的；費勁的
ambitious.eg: She has some ambitious plans for her business.

ambulance.eng_def: a special vehicle used to take sick or injured people to hospital

ambush.eng_def: to suddenly attack someone after hiding and waiting for them
ambush.eg: Five soldiers died after their bus was ambushed on a country road.

ambush.eng_def: an occasion when a person or group of people are ambushed
ambush.eg: Several passers-by were killed in the ambush.

ambush.eng_def: to hide and wait for someone in order to attack them.
ambush.chi_def: 埋伏下來等待發動襲擊

amiable.chi_def: 和藹可親的，親切的；令人愉悅的；友好的
amiable.eg: He seemed an amiable young man.

amid.eng_def: in the middle of or surrounded by
amid.eg: On the floor, amid mounds of books, were two small envelopes.

amidst.eng_def: in the middle of or surrounded by
amidst.eg: On the floor, amid mounds of books, were two small envelopes.

among.eng_def: in the middle of or surrounded by other things
among.eg: I saw a few familiar faces among the crowd.

among.eng_def: happening or being included as part of a group of people or things
among.eg: a decision that has caused a lot of anger among women

among.eng_def: to each one in a group of three or more people or things
among.chi_def: 在三者或以上數量的人或物之間
among.eg: He divided the country among his sons.

amount.eng_def: a collection or mass, especially of something that cannot be counted
amount.chi_def: （尤指不可數事物的）數量；數額；量；總數
amount.eg: They didn't deliver the right amount of sand.

ample.eg: You'll have ample opportunity to ask questions after the talk.

ample.eng_def: If the shape of someone's body or a part of their body is ample, it is large.

amplify.eng_def: to increase the size or effect of something
amplify.eg: A funeral can amplify the feelings of regret and loss for the relatives.

amuse.eng_def: to entertain someone, especially by humorous speech or action or by making them laugh or smile
amuse.chi_def: （尤指透過幽默的言行）逗樂，逗笑；給…提供消遣（或娛樂）
amuse.eg: I've brought an article from yesterday's paper that I thought might amuse you.

amuse.eng_def: to keep someone happy, especially for a short time
amuse.eg: We amused ourselves by watching the passers-by.

amusement.eng_def: the feeling of being entertained or made to laugh
amusement.eg: She looked at him with amusement.

amusement.eng_def: an activity that you can take part in for entertainment
amusement.eg: There was a range of fairground amusements, including rides, stalls, and competitions.

analogy.eng_def: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea
analogy.eg: He drew an analogy between the brain and a vast computer.

analysis.eg: Chemical analysis revealed a high content of copper.

analyst.eng_def: someone whose job is to study or examine something in detail

analyst.chi_def: 精神分析師，心理分析師（見 psychoanalyst）

analytical.eng_def: examining or liking to examine things very carefully
analytical.eg: He has a very analytical mind.

ancestor.eng_def: a person related to you who lived a long time ago
ancestor.eg: There were portraits of his ancestors on the walls of the room.

ancestor.eng_def: a plant, animal, or object that is related to one existing at a later point in time
ancestor.eg: This wooden instrument is the ancestor of the modern metal flute.

anchor.eng_def: a heavy metal object, usually shaped like a cross with curved arms, on a strong rope or chain, that is dropped from a boat into the water to prevent the boat from moving away
anchor.eg: We dropped anchor (= lowered the anchor into the water) and stopped.

anchor.eng_def: someone or something that gives support when needed
anchor.chi_def: 可以依靠的人（或物）；精神支柱；靠山
anchor.eg: She was my anchor when things were difficult for me.

anchor.eng_def: an  anchorman US  or  anchorwoman US
to lower an anchor into the water in order to stop a boat from moving away
to make something or someone stay in one position by fastening him, her, or it firmly
anchor.chi_def: 把…繫住（或紮牢）；使穩固，使固定
anchor.eg: We anchored ourselves to the rocks with a rope.

anchor.eng_def: to act as the anchorman or anchorwoman of a programme
anchor.eg: She will anchor the new morning news show.

anchorman.eng_def: a man who is the main news reader on a television or radio news programme
anchorman.eg: The late-night current affairs show has a new anchorman.

anchorwoman.eng_def: a woman who is the main news reader on a television or radio news programme

ancient.eng_def: of or from a long time ago, having lasted for a very long time
ancient.chi_def: 古代的；古老的；年代久遠的

ancient.eng_def: used to refer to the period in European history from the earliest known societies to the end of the Roman Empire
ancient.chi_def: （指歐洲歷史上羅馬帝國滅亡以前的）古代的

and.eng_def: used to join two words, phrases, parts of sentences, or related statements together
and.chi_def: （用於連接兩個詞、片語、句子成分或相關語句）和，及，又，並

and.eg: She bought the whole lot - house, farm, horses, and all.

and.eng_def: and everything related to the subject mentioned
and.chi_def: 同類的其他一切；以及諸如此類
and.eg: She likes grammar and all that.

and.eng_def: used to mean that either one of two things or both of them is possible
and.eg: Many pupils have extra classes in the evenings and/or at weekends.

and.eng_def: used to join two parts of a sentence, one part happening after the other part
and.eg: I got dressed and had my breakfast.
Bring the flowers into a warm room and they'll soon open.

and.eng_def: With certain verbs, "and" can mean "in order to".
and.chi_def: （和某些動詞連用，表示目的）為了
and.eg: I asked him to go and find my glasses.

and.eng_def: If "and" is used to join two words that are the same, it makes their meaning stronger.
and.chi_def: （連接兩個同樣的詞，用於加強意義）接連，又，越來越
and.eg: She spends hours and hours (= a very long time) on the phone.
You're a vegetarian and you eat fish?

anecdote.eng_def: a short, often funny story, especially about something someone has done
anecdote.eg: He told one or two amusing anecdotes about his years as a policeman.

angel.eng_def: a spiritual being in some religions who is believed to be a messenger of God, usually represented as having a human form with wings
angel.eg: According to the Bible, an angel told Mary that she would have God's son, Jesus.

angel.eng_def: someone who is very good, helpful, or kind
angel.chi_def: （善良、樂於助人的）安琪兒；善人；仁慈的人
angel.eg: Be an angel and help me with this.

angel.eng_def: used when speaking to someone you like very much and know very well
angel.chi_def: （用來稱呼非常喜愛和熟悉的人）小天使，寶貝，乖乖

angel.eng_def: a rich person who invests in a new company
angel.eg: Wealthy individual investors, known as angels, differ from lenders in that they want a stake in your business.

anger.eng_def: a strong feeling that makes you want to hurt someone or be unpleasant because of something unfair or unkind that has happened
anger.eg: I think he feels a lot of anger towards his father, who treated him very badly as a child.

angle.eng_def: the space between two lines or surfaces at the point at which they touch each other, measured in degrees
angle.eg: The interior angles of a square are right angles or angles of 90 degrees.

angle.eng_def: not horizontal or vertical, but sloping in one direction
angle.eg: The picture was hanging at an angle.

angle.eng_def: the corner of a building, table, or anything with straight sides
a position from which something is looked at
angle.eg: The tower is visible from every angle/all angles.

angle.eng_def: a way of considering, judging, or dealing with something
angle.eg: Try looking at the problem from another angle/from my angle.

angle.eng_def: to aim, turn, or position something in a direction that is not horizontal or vertical
angle.eg: The stage had been steeply angled (= was sloping very noticeably).

angle.eng_def: to direct information at a particular group of people
angle.chi_def: 向（特定人群）提供資訊；定位於
angle.eg: The magazine is angled at the 20 to 35-year-old women's market.

angry.eng_def: having a strong feeling against someone who has behaved badly, making you want to shout at them or hurt them
angry.eg: He's really angry at/with me for upsetting Sophie.

angry.eng_def: An angry sea or sky is one where there is a storm, or where it looks as if there will be a storm soon.
angry.chi_def: （大海）波濤洶湧的；（天空）狂風暴雨的

angry.eng_def: If an infected area of the body is angry, it is red and painful.
angry.eg: On her leg was an angry sore.

animal.eng_def: something that lives and moves but is not a human, bird, fish, or insect
animal.chi_def: （除人、鳥、魚和昆蟲之外的）動物；獸；牲畜

animal.eng_def: anything that lives and moves, including people, birds, etc.
animal.eg: Humans, insects, reptiles, birds, and mammals are all animals.

animal.eng_def: an unpleasant, cruel person or someone who behaves badly
animal.chi_def: 牲畜般的人；殘暴野蠻的人；豬狗不如的人
animal.eg: He's a real animal when he's had too much to drink.

animal.eng_def: used to describe what type of person or thing someone or something is
animal.eg: At heart she is a political animal.

animal.eng_def: made or obtained from an animal or animals
animal.chi_def: 取自動物的；以動物為原料的

animal.eng_def: relating to, or taking the form of, an animal or animals rather than a plant or human being
animal.eg: The island was devoid of all animal life (= there were no animals on the island).

animal.eng_def: relating to physical desires or needs, and not spiritual or mental ones
animal.eg: As an actor, he has a sort of animal magnetism.

animate.eng_def: to make someone seem more happy or active
animate.eg: A sparkle in his eyes animated his face whenever he smiled.

ankle.eng_def: the joint (= place where two bones are connected) between the foot and the leg, or the thin part of the leg just above the foot
ankle.eg: I fell over and sprained/twisted my ankle.

anniversary.eng_def: the day on which an important event happened in a previous year
anniversary.eg: We always celebrate our wedding anniversary with dinner in an expensive restaurant.

announce.eng_def: to make something known or tell people about something officially
announce.eg: They announced the death of their mother in the local paper.

announce.eng_def: to show that something is going to happen
announce.eg: The first few leaves in the gutter announced the beginning of autumn.

announcement.eng_def: something that someone says officially, giving information about something
announcement.eg: The president made an unexpected announcement this morning.
The announcement of the changes has been delayed.

annoy.eg: Tina really annoyed me in the meeting this morning.

annoyance.eng_def: the feeling or state of being annoyed
annoyance.eg: I can understand your annoyance - I'd be furious if she ever treated me like that.

annoyance.chi_def: 令人煩惱的事；令人不快的事
annoyance.eg: One of the greatest annoyances was being bitten by mosquitoes every night.

annual.eng_def: relating to a period of one year
a book or magazine published once a year, especially for children, with the same title and style but different contents
annual.chi_def: 年刊，年報；（尤指）兒童年冊
（學校或其他機構出版的）年刊，年鑒

annual.eng_def: a plant that grows, produces seeds, and dies within one year

anonymous.eng_def: made or done by someone whose name is not known or not made public
anonymous.chi_def: 匿名的；不知姓名的；名字不公開的
anonymous.eg: The money was donated by an anonymous benefactor.

anonymous.eng_def: having no unusual or interesting features
anonymous.chi_def: 無特色的，無個性特徵的
anonymous.eg: He has a rather anonymous face.

another.eng_def: one more person or thing or an extra amount
another.eg: I'm going to have another piece of cake.

another.eng_def: a lot of things, one after the other
another.eg: I'm not surprised he's feeling ill - he was eating one ice cream after another!

another.chi_def: 不同的（人或事物）；別的；另一
another.eg: She's finished with that boyfriend and found herself another (one).
They gave one another presents when they met at the airport.

another.eng_def: in some way that is not known yet
another.eg: We'll get out of this mess one way or another.

answer.eng_def: a reaction to a question, letter, phone call, etc.
answer.chi_def: 回答；作答；答應；答覆；答案
answer.eg: The minister promised to give a written answer to the MP's detailed question.
It's a difficult situation and I don't know what the answer is.

answer.eng_def: to say, write, or do something as a reaction to a question, letter, etc.
answer.chi_def: 回答；作答；答應；答覆；解答
answer.eg: I can't answer (you) without more detailed information.

answer.eng_def: to open the door to someone or pick up the phone
answer.eg: Someone's at the door - would you answer it, please?

answer.eng_def: to be suitable for and satisfy someone's needs
answer.eg: He showed me some software that answered my requirements exactly.
A woman who answers to the suspect's description was seen in the area on the night of the crime.

ant.eng_def: a very small insect that lives under the ground in large and well-organized social groups
(a person or thing) performing or causing the stated action
ant.chi_def: 進行…動作的人；起…作用的人（或物）；促進…作用的事物

antarctic.eng_def: the very cold area around the South Pole that includes Antarctica and the surrounding seas
antarctic.eg: The protection of the Antarctic from commercial exploitation is an important goal of environmentalists.

antarctic.eng_def: belonging or relating to Antarctica or the Antarctic

antenna.eng_def: either of a pair of long, thin organs that are found on the heads of insects and crustaceans (= animals with hard outer shells) and are used to feel with
the natural ability to notice things and understand their importance
antenna.eg: Her finely-tuned political antennae helped her to sense problems that less experienced politicians might not detect.

anthem.eng_def: a song that has special importance for a particular group of people, an organization, or a country, often sung on a special occasion
anthem.chi_def: 國歌；（團體組織的）頌歌，讚歌
anthem.eg: The national anthems of the teams are played at the beginning of international football matches.

anthem.eng_def: a religious song sung by a choir with organ music

antibiotic.eng_def: a medicine or chemical that can destroy harmful bacteria in the body or limit their growth
antibiotic.eg: I'm taking antibiotics for a throat infection.

antibody.eng_def: a protein produced in the blood that fights diseases by attacking and killing harmful bacteria
antibody.eg: Antibodies found in breast milk protect newborn babies against infection.

anticipate.eng_def: to imagine or expect that something will happen
to take action in preparation for something that you think will happen
anticipate.chi_def: 採取行動來防止；先發制人
anticipate.eg: It's always best to anticipate a problem before it arises.

anticipation.eng_def: a feeling of excitement about something that is going to happen in the near future
anticipation.eg: As with most pleasures, it's not so much the experience itself as the anticipation that is enjoyable.
She's even decorated the spare room in anticipation of your visit.

antique.eng_def: something made in an earlier period that is collected and considered to have value because it is beautiful, rare, old, or of high quality
antique.eg: You can't give away Granny's old bookcase - it's a valuable antique.

antique.eng_def: made in an earlier period and considered to have value because of being beautiful, rare, old, or of high quality
antique.chi_def: 古物的；古器的；古董的；古玩的
古玩的，古董的；從事古董買賣的

antonym.eng_def: a word that means the opposite of another word

anxiety.eng_def: an uncomfortable feeling of nervousness or worry about something that is happening or might happen in the future
anxiety.eg: Children normally feel a lot of anxiety about their first day at school.

anxiety.eng_def: something that causes a feeling of fear and worry
anxiety.chi_def: 令人焦慮的事；焦慮的原因

anxiety.eg: Peter's leaving at the end of this week - hence his anxiety to get his work finished.

anxiety.eng_def: a medical condition in which you always feel frightened and worried
anxiety.eg: He has helped patients suffering from anxiety, depression, and eating disorders.

anxious.eg: My mother always gets a bit anxious if we don't arrive when we say we will.
Developing countries that are anxious for hard currency can rarely afford to protect the environment.

any.eng_def: some, or even the smallest amount or number of
any.eg: Is there any of that lemon cake left?

any.eng_def: one of or each of a particular type of person or thing when it is not important which
any.eg: Any food would be better than nothing at all.

any.eng_def: at all or in the least

anyhow.eng_def: without care or interest or in an untidy way
anyhow.chi_def: 隨隨便便地；雜亂無章地
anyhow.eg: He looked a complete mess - dressed anyhow with his hair sticking up.

anyplace.eg: Oh just put it anyplace - it doesn't matter where.

anytime.eng_def: at a time that is not or does not need to be decided or agreed
anytime.eg: Call round to see me anytime.

anyway.eng_def: whatever else is happening, without considering other things
anyway.chi_def: 不管怎樣；無論如何；仍然
anyway.eg: Of course I don't mind taking you home - I'm going that way anyway.

anyway.eng_def: In conversation, anyway is also used to change the subject, return to an earlier subject, or get to the most interesting point.
anyway.chi_def: （用於談話中表示改變話題、回到原來說的話題或者即將談到最有趣的一點）對了，好吧，無論如何，反正
anyway.eg: Anyway, as I said, I'll be away next week.

anyway.eng_def: used to give a more important reason for something that you are saying
anyway.chi_def: （用於談話中表示強調正在說的話）而且，加之，到底
anyway.eg: I don't have time to go, and anyway it's too expensive.

anywhere.eng_def: in, to, or at any place
anywhere.chi_def: 在（或去）任何地方；隨便哪個地方
anywhere.eg: You won't find a better plumber anywhere in England.

anywhere.eng_def: used in questions or negatives to mean "a place"
anywhere.chi_def: （尤用於疑問句或否定句中）某個地方，任何地方
anywhere.eg: I can't find my keys anywhere.

anywhere.eng_def: used to say that a number or amount is in a certain range but that you cannot say exactly what it is
anywhere.eg: He charges anywhere from $20 to $50 for a haircut.

apart.eng_def: separated by a distance or by time
apart.eg: Stand with your feet wide apart.
My jacket is so old it's falling apart.
He works until nine o'clock every evening, and that's quite apart from the work he does over the weekend.

apart.eng_def: living or staying in a different place from the person that you are married to or have a close relationship with
apart.chi_def: （夫妻或親人）分離的，不住一起的
apart.eg: When you're apart you rely so heavily on the phone.

apartment.eng_def: a set of rooms for living in, especially on one floor of a building
apartment.eg: I'll give you the keys to my apartment.

apartment.eng_def: a set of large rooms with expensive furniture and decoration in, for example, a public building or castle
apartment.chi_def: （公共大樓、城堡等中大而豪華的）套間
apartment.eg: The Royal Apartments are open to the public.

ape.eng_def: an animal like a large monkey with no tail, that uses its arms to move through trees
ape.eg: Chimpanzees and gorillas are both apes.

ape.eng_def: to copy something or someone badly and unsuccessfully
ape.eg: He called the new building unoriginal and said that it merely aped the classical traditions.

apologize.eng_def: to tell someone that you are sorry for having done something that has caused problems or unhappiness for them
apologize.eg: I must apologize to Isobel for my lateness.

apology.eng_def: an act of saying that you are sorry for something wrong you have done
apology.eg: I have an apology to make to you - I'm afraid I opened your letter by mistake.

apology.eng_def: a message politely telling someone that you cannot be present at their meeting or party
apology.chi_def: （因不能出席會議或聚會的）致歉信
apology.eg: The vice chair has sent his apologies - he's abroad at present.

apology.eng_def: a formal explanation or defence of a belief or system, especially one that is unpopular
apology.chi_def: （尤指對不受歡迎的政治信仰或制度的）辯護，辯解

apparent.eng_def: able to be seen or understood
apparent.chi_def: 清晰可見的；顯而易見的；明白易懂的
apparent.eg: Her unhappiness was apparent to everyone.

apparent.eng_def: seeming to exist or be true
apparent.chi_def: 表面上的；貌似（真實）的；顯得…的
apparent.eg: There are one or two apparent discrepancies between the two reports.

appeal.eng_def: a request to the public for money, information, or help
appeal.chi_def: （尤指向公眾的）呼籲，籲請，求助，懇求
appeal.eg: They're launching (= starting) an appeal to raise money for famine victims.

appeal.eng_def: a request made to a court of law or to someone in authority to change a previous decision
appeal.chi_def: （尤指為了改變法律或官方裁決而提出的）訴請，異議，申訴
appeal.eg: The case went to the court of appeal/the appeal court.

appeal.eng_def: the quality in someone or something that makes him, her, or it attractive or interesting
to make a serious or formal request, especially to the public, for money, information, or help
appeal.chi_def: （尤指向公眾）呼籲，籲請，求助，懇求
appeal.eg: They're appealing for clothes and blankets to send to the devastated region.

appeal.eng_def: to request a higher court of law to consider again a decision made by a lower court, especially in order to reduce or prevent a punishment
appeal.chi_def: （尤指為尋求減輕處罰而向更高一級法院提出）上訴
appeal.eg: The teenager has been given leave (= allowed) by the High Court to appeal against her two-year sentence.

appeal.eng_def: to formally request that a legal or official decision be changed
appeal.chi_def: （尤指為了改變法律或官方裁決而）訴請裁決，提出異議，申訴
appeal.eg: The parents appealed against the school's decision not to admit the child.

appeal.chi_def: 對…有吸引力；對…有感染力；引起興趣
appeal.eg: It's a programme designed to appeal mainly to 16 to 25-year-olds.

appear.eng_def: to start to be seen or to be present
appear.eg: He suddenly appeared in the doorway.

appear.eng_def: If you appear in court, you are there officially because you are involved in a trial.
appear.eg: Both women will be appearing before magistrates later this week.
You've got to appear (to be) calm in an interview even if you're terrified underneath.

appear.eng_def: to perform publicly in a play, film, or show
appear.eg: She will be appearing in the latest adaptation of "Bleak House".

appear.eng_def: to start to exist or become available
appear.eg: I've noticed that smaller cars are starting to appear (= be produced or sold) again.
If she hasn't appeared by ten o'clock I'm going without her.

appearance.eng_def: an occasion when someone appears in public
appearance.eg: It was his first appearance on television/television appearance as president.

appearance.eng_def: an occasion when someone goes to court to be officially involved in a trial
appearance.eg: This was the defendant's third court appearance for the same offence.

appearance.eng_def: a public performance by an entertainer
appearance.eg: He made his first stage/TV appearance at the age of six.

appearance.eng_def: to be present somewhere for a short time
appearance.chi_def: 露一下麵；到場稍作停留
appearance.eg: I didn't really want to go to the party, but I thought I'd better put in an appearance.

appearance.eng_def: the way a person or thing looks to other people
appearance.eg: a middle-aged man of smart appearance

appearance.eng_def: what things look like or seem to be rather than what they actually are
appearance.eg: He was a far more complicated man than outward appearances suggested.

appearance.eng_def: judging from what can be seen
appearance.eg: To all appearances their marriage is fine, but I think she gives him a bad time in private.

appetite.eng_def: the feeling that you want to eat food
appetite.eg: All that walking has given me an appetite.

appetite.eng_def: the feeling of wanting or needing something

applaud.eng_def: to show enjoyment or approval of something such as a performance or speech by clapping the hands repeatedly to make a noise
applaud.eg: You should have heard the audience applaud - the noise was fantastic.

applaud.eng_def: to say that you admire and agree with a person's action or decision
applaud.eg: We applaud the family's decision to remain silent over the issue.

applause.eng_def: the sound of people clapping their hands repeatedly to show enjoyment or approval of something such as a performance or speech
applause.eg: His speech met with (= received) loud applause.

apple.eng_def: a round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green, red, or yellow skin

appliance.eng_def: a device, machine, or piece of equipment, especially an electrical one that is used in the house, such as a cooker or washing machine
appliance.chi_def: 裝置，器械；（尤指）家用電器

applicable.eng_def: affecting or relating to a person or thing
applicable.eg: This part of the law is only applicable to companies employing more than five people.

applicant.eng_def: a person who formally requests something, especially a job, or to study at a college or university
applicant.chi_def: （尤指求職於或考大學的）申請人
applicant.eg: How many applicants did you have for the job?

application.eng_def: an official request for something, usually in writing
a computer program that is designed for a particular purpose
a way in which something can be used for a particular purpose
the determination to work hard over a period of time in order to succeed at something
application.eg: Joshua clearly has ability in this subject but lacks application.

application.eng_def: the act of spreading or rubbing a substance such as cream or paint on a surface, or a layer of cream or paint
application.eg: Leave the paint to dry between applications.

application.eng_def: a way in which a rule or law, etc. relates to or is important for someone or something
application.eg: The new laws have (a) particular application to the self-employed.

apply.eng_def: to request something, usually officially, especially in writing or by sending in a form
apply.chi_def: （尤指透過書面或表格形式）申請，請求
apply.eg: By the time I saw the job advertised it was already too late to apply.

apply.eng_def: (especially of rules or laws) to have a connection or be important
apply.chi_def: （尤指規章法律）適用，有關，涉及
apply.eg: That part of the form is for UK citizens - it doesn't apply to you.

apply.eng_def: to make use of something or use it for a practical purpose
apply.eg: He wants a job in which he can apply his foreign languages.

apply.eng_def: to spread or rub a substance such as cream or paint on a surface
apply.eg: Apply the cream liberally to exposed areas every three hours and after swimming.

apply.eng_def: If you apply yourself to something, you work hard at it, directing your abilities and efforts in a determined way so that you succeed.
apply.eg: You can solve any problem if you apply yourself.

appoint.eng_def: to choose someone officially for a job or responsibility
appoint.eg: We've appointed three new teachers this year.

appoint.eng_def: to arrange a date or time when a meeting or other event will happen
appoint.eg: A date has been appointed for the election.

appointment.eng_def: a formal arrangement to meet or visit someone at a particular time and place
appointment.eg: I'd like to make an appointment with Dr Evans, please.

appointment.chi_def: 按約定；按事先預定的時間
appointment.eg: House for sale, two bedrooms. Viewing by appointment only.

appointment.eng_def: the act of officially choosing someone for a job, or the job itself
in the UK, used by businesses to show that their goods and services are sold to a member of the royal family
appointment.chi_def: 經女王禦准（英國商家用來表示其商品或服務可提供給皇室，因而品質很好）
appointment.eg: Carter's Ltd, confectioners by appointment to the Queen

appreciate.eng_def: to recognize how good someone or something is and to value him, her, or it
appreciate.eg: There's no point buying him expensive wines - he doesn't appreciate them.

appreciate.eng_def: to understand a situation and realize that it is important
appreciate.eg: We appreciate the need for immediate action.

appreciate.eng_def: used when you are thanking someone or showing that you are grateful
appreciate.eg: We really appreciate all the help you gave us last weekend.

appreciate.eng_def: used when you are politely asking for something
appreciate.chi_def: （用於禮貌地請求某事）（如果…）將不勝感激
appreciate.eg: I would appreciate it if you could let me know (= please let me know) in advance whether or not you will be coming.
The value of our house has appreciated by 50 percent in the last two years.

appreciation.eng_def: the act of recognizing or understanding that something is valuable, important, or as described
appreciation.eg: Max has no appreciation of the finer things in life.
There has been little appreciation in the value of property recently.

apprentice.eng_def: someone who has agreed to work for a skilled person for a particular period of time and often for low payment, in order to learn that person's skills
apprentice.eg: Most of the work was done by apprentices.
Michelangelo was apprenticed to Ghirlandaio in Florence for three years.

approach.eng_def: to come near or nearer to something or someone in space, time, quality, or amount
approach.eg: We could just see the train approaching in the distance.
I'm not sure how to approach the problem.

approach.eng_def: to speak to, write to, or visit someone in order to do something such as make a request or business agreement
approach.eg: We've just approached the bank for/about a loan.

approach.eng_def: a way of considering or doing something
approach.eg: Since our research so far has not produced any answers to this problem, we need to adopt a different approach to it.

approach.eng_def: the fact of getting nearer in distance or time
approach.eg: The siren signalled the approach of an ambulance.

approach.eng_def: a route that leads to a place
approach.eg: There is a very steep approach to the house.

approach.eng_def: the most similar thing to something else that is mentioned
approach.chi_def: 與…最近似（或相似）的事物
approach.eg: That's the nearest approach to an apology you're going to get from Paula.

approach.eng_def: an act of communicating with another person or group in order to ask for something
approach.eg: The hospital is making approaches to local businesses (= asking them to help) in their bid to raise money.

appropriate.eng_def: suitable or right for a particular situation or occasion
to take something for your own use, usually without permission
appropriate.eg: He lost his job when he was found to have appropriated some of the company's money.

appropriate.eng_def: to keep an amount of money to use for a particular purpose
appropriate.eg: The government have appropriated millions of pounds for the project.

approval.eng_def: the feeling of having a positive opinion of someone or something
approval.eg: He showed his approval by smiling broadly.

approval.eng_def: If you buy something on approval, you can return it without payment if it is not satisfactory.

approval.eg: The project has now received approval from the government.

approve.eng_def: to have a positive opinion of someone or something
approve.eg: She doesn't approve of my friends.

approve.eng_def: to accept, allow, or officially agree to something
approve.eg: We had to wait months for the council to approve our plans to extend the house.

approximate.eg: The train's approximate time of arrival is 10.30.

approximate.eng_def: to be almost the same as
approximate.eg: The newspaper reports of the discussion only roughly approximated to (= were not exactly the same as) what was actually said.

apron.eng_def: a piece of clothing that you wear over the front of other clothes to keep the clothes clean while you are doing something dirty, such as cooking or cleaning
the part of an airport in which aircraft are turned around or goods are put onto them
part of a stage in a theatre that is in front of the curtain

apt.eng_def: suitable or right for a particular situation
to be likely to do something or to often do something
apt.eg: The kitchen roof is apt to (= likely to) leak when it rains.

apt.eng_def: having a natural ability or skill
apt.chi_def: 天資聰明的，有天賦的；聰明的
apt.eg: We have some particularly apt students in the class this year.

aptitude.eg: My son has no/little aptitude for sport.

aquarium.eng_def: a glass container in which fish and other water creatures can be kept
aquarium.chi_def: 養魚缸；水族玻璃槽；水族箱

aquarium.eng_def: a building, usually open to the public, that holds many aquariums
aquarium.chi_def: （通常指對公眾開放的）水族館

arch.eng_def: a structure, consisting of a curved top on two supports, that holds the weight of something above it
arch.chi_def: 拱；拱形結構；拱門（或窗、頂、洞等）
arch.eg: In many churches the side aisles are separated from the central aisle by a row of arches.

arch.eng_def: something that has the shape of an arch, often used for decoration
arch.eg: The boat floated through the arch of the trees towards the bridge.

arch.eng_def: the raised curve on the bottom of your foot
any organ or part of the body that is curved in shape
arch.chi_def: 弓（身體中曲線形或弧形的結構）
arch.eg: The premature loss of primary teeth causes shrinking of the dental arch.

arch.eng_def: to make the shape of an arch
showing that you think it is amusing that you know more about something than someone else does
greater or especially worse than others of the same type
arch.chi_def: 極度的；為首的；（尤指）極惡劣的

architect.eng_def: a person whose job is to design new buildings and make certain that they are built correctly
a person responsible for achieving a particular plan or aim
architect.eg: Bevan was the architect of the British National Health Service.

architecture.eng_def: the art and practice of designing and making buildings
the style in which buildings are made

arctic.eng_def: the very cold area around the North Pole
arctic.eg: Polar bears live in the Arctic.

arctic.eng_def: belonging or relating to the Arctic
arctic.eg: No trees grow in the Arctic regions.
The North of England has been experiencing Arctic conditions these past few days.

area.eng_def: a particular part of a place, piece of land, or country
area.eg: All areas of the country will have some rain tonight.

area.eng_def: a subject or activity, or a part of it
the size of a flat surface calculated by multiplying its length by its width

area.chi_def: （足球場上的）罰球區（同 penalty area）

arena.eng_def: a large, flat area surrounded by seats used for sports or entertainment
arena.chi_def: （體育比賽或表演用的）場地，競技場，劇場

arena.eng_def: an activity that involves argument and discussion
arena.chi_def: 活動場所；鬥爭場所；競爭舞臺
arena.eg: After 30 years in the political arena, our local member of parliament is retiring next year.

argue.eng_def: to speak angrily to someone, telling that person that you disagree with them
to give the reasons for your opinion, idea, belief, etc.
argue.eg: The senator argued for/in favour of/against making cuts in military spending.

argue.eng_def: to show that something is true or exists
argue.eg: The evidence argues a change in policy.

argument.eng_def: a disagreement, or the process of disagreeing
argument.eg: The children had an argument about/over what game to play.

argument.eng_def: a reason or reasons why you support or oppose an idea or suggestion, or the process of explaining these reasons
argument.chi_def: 理由，論據，論點；論證，說理
argument.eg: Now that we've heard all the arguments for and against the proposal, let's vote on it.

arise.eg: Should the opportunity arise, I'd love to go to China.
We arose early on Christmas morning.

arithmetic.eng_def: the part of mathematics that involves the adding and multiplying, etc. of numbers
arithmetic.eg: I've never been very good at arithmetic.

arithmetic.eng_def: calculations involving adding and multiplying, etc. numbers
arithmetic.eg: I did some quick mental arithmetic and decided it was going to cost too much.

arm.eng_def: either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end
arm.eg: My arms ache from carrying this bag.

arm.eng_def: The arm of a piece of clothing or furniture is a part of it that you put your arm in or on.
arm.chi_def: （衣服）袖子；（椅子等傢俱的）扶手，靠手

arm.eng_def: When two people are arm in arm, they both have one arm bent at the elbow and passing around and supporting, or being supported by, the arm of the other person.
arm.eg: We walked arm in arm along the river bank.

arm.eng_def: weapons and equipment used to kill and injure people
arm.eg: They have been charged with supplying arms to the guerrillas.

arm.eng_def: An arm of land or water is a long, thin part of it that is joined to a larger area.
An arm of an organization is a part of it that is responsible for a particular activity or place.
arm.chi_def: 職能部門；分支機構，分部
arm.eg: The British company is one arm of a large multinational.

arm.eng_def: to provide yourself or others with a weapon or weapons
arm.eg: Nobody knows who is arming the terrorists.

arm.eng_def: to provide yourself or others with equipment or knowledge in order to complete a particular task
arm.eg: She armed herself for the interview by finding out all she could about the company in advance.

armchair.eng_def: a comfortable chair with sides that support your arms
armchair.eg: She sat in an armchair by the fire, reading a newspaper.

armchair.eng_def: used to refer to a person who knows, or says they know, a lot about a subject without having direct experience of it
armchair.chi_def: 無實際經驗的；不切實際的；空談的

army.eg: When did you join the army?

army.eng_def: a military force that has the training and equipment to fight on land
army.chi_def: 陸上作戰部隊；陸軍部隊
army.eg: Both the armies suffered heavy losses in the battle.

army.eng_def: a large group of people who are involved in a particular activity
army.eg: She brought an army of supporters with her.

army.eng_def: the supporters of a football team, especially ones who travel to games in different towns, cities, or countries
army.chi_def: （尤指隨球隊前往客場觀戰的）球迷的隊伍
army.eg: Scotland's 1 - 0 victory over France gave the Tartan Army something to celebrate.

around.eng_def: in a position or direction surrounding, or in a direction going along the edge of or from one part to another (of)
around.chi_def: 四處，周圍；圍繞，（環）繞；掉轉

around.eng_def: positioned or moving in or near a place, often without a clear direction, purpose, or order
around.chi_def: （在…）附近，在（…）近處；到處，四處；隨便
around.eg: He always leaves his clothes lying around (on the floor).

arouse.eng_def: to cause someone to have a particular feeling
arouse.eg: It's a subject that has aroused a lot of interest.

arouse.eng_def: to cause someone to feel sexual excitement

arrange.eng_def: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
arrange.eg: I'm trying to arrange my work so that I can have a couple of days off next week.

arrange.eng_def: to put a group of objects in a particular order
arrange.chi_def: 整理，使有條理；排列；佈置
arrange.eg: She arranged her birthday cards along the shelf.

arrange.eng_def: to make changes to a piece of music so that it can be played in a different way, for example by a particular instrument
arrange.eg: Beethoven's fifth symphony has been arranged for the piano.

arrangement.eng_def: a plan for how something will happen
arrangement.eg: They'd made all the arrangements for the party.

arrangement.eng_def: an agreement between two people or groups about how something happens or will happen
arrangement.eg: We had an arrangement that he would clean the house and I would cook.

arrangement.eng_def: a group of objects that have been put in a particular order or position
arrangement.eg: There was a striking arrangement of dried flowers on the table.

arrangement.eng_def: a piece of music that has had changes made to it so that it can be played in a different way, especially by different instruments
arrangement.eg: This new arrangement of the piece is for saxophone and piano.

arrest.eng_def: If the police arrest someone, they take them away to ask them about a crime that they might have committed.
arrest.eg: He was arrested when customs officers found drugs in his bag.

arrest.eng_def: to stop or interrupt the development of something
arrest.eg: The treatment has so far done little to arrest the spread of the cancer.

arrest.eng_def: to attract or catch someone's attention
arrest.eg: A photo of a small boy arrested my attention.
Two arrests were made, but the men were later released without charge.

arrival.eg: Hundreds gathered to await the boxer's arrival at the airport.

arrival.eng_def: a baby that has recently been born
arrival.eg: Their new arrival was keeping them busy.

arrive.eng_def: to reach a place, especially at the end of a journey
arrive.chi_def: 到達，抵達（尤指到達旅途的終點）；到來；來臨
arrive.eg: What time will your train arrive?

arrive.eng_def: to happen or start to exist
arrive.eg: The leaves starting to turn brown is a sign that autumn has arrived.

arrive.eng_def: If a baby arrives, it is born.
arrive.eg: Their baby Olivia arrived on the date she was expected.

arrogant.eng_def: unpleasantly proud and behaving as if you are more important than, or know more than, other people
arrogant.chi_def: 傲慢的；狂妄自大的；趾高氣揚的
arrogant.eg: I found him arrogant and rude.

arrow.eng_def: a weapon that is like a long, thin stick with a sharp point at one end and often feathers at the other, shot from a bow (= a long, thin piece of wood bent into a curve by a piece of string)
arrow.eg: Robin Hood asked to be buried where his arrow landed.

arrow.eng_def: a sign consisting of a straight line with an upside down V shape at one end of it that points in a particular direction, used to show where something is
arrow.eg: I followed the arrows to the car park.

art.eng_def: the making of objects, images, music, etc. that are beautiful or that express feelings
art.chi_def: （包括雕塑、繪畫、音樂等的） 藝術
art.eg: Can television and pop music really be considered art?

art.eng_def: the activity of painting, drawing, and making sculpture
art.chi_def: 美術（指繪畫、素描、雕塑等）
art.eg: Art and English were my best subjects at school.
The gallery has an excellent collection of modern art.

art.eng_def: an activity through which people express particular ideas
art.eg: Drama is an art that is traditionally performed in a theatre.

art.eng_def: the making or showing or performance of painting, acting, dancing, and music
art.chi_def: （繪畫、表演、舞蹈、音樂等的總稱）藝術
art.eg: More government money is needed for the arts.

art.eng_def: subjects, such as history, languages, and literature, that are not scientific subjects
art.eg: At school I was quite good at arts, but hopeless at science.

art.eng_def: in the past, the second person singular of the present tense of "be"
art.chi_def: （在舊式英語中）be的現在時態單數第二人稱

artery.eng_def: one of the thick tubes that carry blood from the heart to other parts of the body
artery.eg: Hardening of the coronary arteries can lead to a heart attack.

artery.eng_def: an important road or railway line
artery.eg: the main arteries leading into London

article.eng_def: a piece of writing on a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine, or on the internet
article.chi_def: （報紙或雜誌上的）文章，報導；論文
article.eg: There was an interesting article on vegetarianism in the paper yesterday.

article.eng_def: any of the English words "a", "an", and "the", or words in other languages that do the same job as these
a particular thing, especially one that is one of several things of a similar type or in the same place
article.chi_def: （尤指同一類的或在一起的數個中的一件）物品，物件；物品的一件
article.eg: Guests are advised not to leave any articles of value in their hotel rooms.

article.eng_def: a separate part in a written document such as a legal agreement
article.eg: East and West Germany united under article 23 of the Bonn constitution.

article.eng_def: to be working in a law office while training to be a lawyer
article.chi_def: 在律師事務所當見習生，當見習律師

articulate.eng_def: able to express thoughts and feelings easily and clearly, or showing this quality
articulate.chi_def: 能表達清楚的，善於表達的；口齒伶俐的，有口才的
articulate.eg: an intelligent and highly articulate young woman
I found myself unable to articulate my feelings.

articulate.chi_def: 清晰地吐字；清晰地發音
articulate.eg: When children first learn to talk, there are some sounds that they find difficult to articulate.

articulate.eng_def: to connect two bones by forming a joint

artifact.eng_def: US spelling of  artefact mainly UK

artificial.eng_def: made by people, often as a copy of something natural

artificial.chi_def: 虛假的，不真誠的；矯揉造作的
artificial.eg: Their cheerfulness seemed rather strained and artificial.

artist.eng_def: someone who paints, draws, or makes sculptures
artist.chi_def: 藝術家；美術家；畫家；雕塑家
artist.eg: Monet is one of my favourite artists.

artist.eng_def: someone who creates things with great skill and imagination
artist.chi_def: 高手；大師；技藝高超的人
artist.eg: He described her as one of the greatest film artists of the 20th century.

artistic.eg: the artistic director of the theatre

artistic.eng_def: able to create or enjoy art
artistic.chi_def: 有藝術天賦的；有藝術鑒賞力的
artistic.eg: His friends are all artistic - they're painters, musicians, and writers.

artistic.chi_def: 富有藝術性的；精美的，精彩的
artistic.eg: That's a very artistic flower arrangement you have there.

as.eng_def: used in comparisons to refer to the degree of something
as.eg: She'll soon be as tall as her mother.

as.eng_def: used to describe the purpose or quality of someone or something

as.eg: As it was getting late, I decided to book into a hotel.
I saw him as I was coming into the building.
He got divorced, (just) as his parents had done years before.
Angry as he was, he couldn't help smiling.

ascend.eng_def: to move up or climb something
ascend.eg: They slowly ascended the steep path up the mountain.

ascend.eng_def: to rise to a position of higher rank
ascend.chi_def: 登上高的職位；升級，晉升
ascend.eg: He eventually ascended to the position of chief executive.

ash.eng_def: the soft grey or black powder that is left after a substance, especially tobacco, coal, or wood, has burned
ash.chi_def: （尤指煙草、煤、木頭燃燒後的）灰，灰燼

ash.eng_def: what is left of something after it has been destroyed by fire, especially what is left of a human body after it has been burned
ash.chi_def: 灰燼，廢墟；（尤指人火化後的）骨灰
ash.eg: Her ashes were scattered at sea.

ash.eng_def: a forest tree that has a smooth, grey bark (= outer covering), small greenish flowers, and seeds shaped like wings
the wood from an ash tree
abbreviation for Action on Smoking and Health: an organization in Australia, the UK, and the US that tries to stop the sale and use of tobacco products
ash.chi_def: （澳大利亞、英國、美國的）禁煙與保健行動組織（Action on Smoking and Health的縮寫）

ashamed.eng_def: feeling guilty or embarrassed about something you have done or about a quality in your character
ashamed.chi_def: 羞恥的，羞愧的；不好意思的，難為情的
ashamed.eg: You've got nothing to be ashamed of.

aside.eg: Stand aside, please, and let these people pass.

aside.eng_def: If you put/set aside money, you save it for a particular purpose.
aside.eg: Every week I put aside some money for a new TV.

aside.eng_def: If you leave or put a problem or request aside, you ignore it until you are able to solve it.
aside.eg: Let's leave that matter aside for now and talk about the more urgent problem facing us.
Money continues to be a problem but aside from that we're all well.

aside.eng_def: a remark that someone makes in a quiet voice because they do not want everyone to hear it
a remark or story in a speech or text that is not part of the main subject
aside.eg: The informative asides about rural life make this wine guide rather special.

ask.eng_def: to put a question to someone, or to request an answer from someone

ask.eg: She needs to ask herself why nobody seems to like her.

ask.eng_def: to speak or write to someone saying that you want them to do something, to give you something, or to allow you to do something
ask.eg: If you need any help, please don't hesitate to ask.

ask.eng_def: to request or invite someone to go somewhere with you or to come to your home
ask.eg: I've asked David to the party.
Greg's asking (= expecting to be paid) £250,000 for his house.

asleep.eg: I'm surprised to see you awake - ten minutes ago you were fast/sound (= completely) asleep.

asleep.eng_def: If your arm or leg is asleep, it cannot feel anything because it has been in the same position for so long.
asleep.chi_def: （手臂或腿長時間維持一種姿勢而）發麻的，麻木的

asleep.eg: I fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow.

aspect.eng_def: one part of a situation, problem, subject, etc.
aspect.eg: Which aspects of the job do you most enjoy?

aspect.eng_def: the direction in which a building, window, room, or sloping field faces, or the view that can be seen because of this direction
aspect.chi_def: 朝向；方位；朝著某個方向的一面
aspect.eg: The dining room has a southern aspect, which allows us to make the most of the sun.

aspect.eng_def: the appearance of a place, or the expression on a person's face
aspect.eg: The glasses and the beard lend him a rather scholarly aspect.

aspect.eng_def: the form of a verb that shows how the meaning of that verb is considered in relation to time, typically expressing if an action is complete, repeated, or continuous
a measurement of the width compared to the height of the picture on a TV or computer screen
aspect.chi_def: （電視或其他螢幕的）寬高比，縱橫比，長寬比
aspect.eg: A widescreen picture has an aspect ratio of 16:9.

aspirin.eng_def: a common drug that reduces pain, fever, and swelling
aspirin.chi_def: 阿司匹靈（尤用於治療頭痛、發燒和腫脹）
aspirin.eg: I always take a couple of aspirins when I feel a cold starting.

ass.eng_def: the part of the body that you sit on
used by men to refer to sexual activity, or to women considered only as possible sexual partners
ass.chi_def: （男性用語）性交；（視為性交對象的）女人
ass.eg: I've never seen so much gorgeous ass.
Get your ass in my office now!

ass.eng_def: to lose your balance suddenly and fall over

assassinate.eng_def: to kill someone famous or important
assassinate.eg: a plot to assassinate the president

assault.eg: He was charged with sexual assault.

assault.eng_def: a determined or serious attempt to do something difficult
assault.eg: Women's groups have demanded a nationwide assault on sexism in the workplace.

assault.eng_def: a threat to injure someone followed by a violent attack on them

assault.eg: A woman and a man have been convicted of assaulting a police officer.

assemble.eng_def: to come together in a single place or bring parts together in a single group
assemble.eg: We assembled in the meeting room after lunch.

assemble.eng_def: to make something by joining separate parts
assemble.eg: furniture that is easy to assemble

assembly.eng_def: a group of people, especially one that meets regularly for a particular purpose, such as government, or, more generally, the process of coming together, or the state of being together
assembly.chi_def: （尤指為特定目的而經常）聚集在一起的人，（所有）與會者；集合，聚集

assembly.eng_def: one of the two parts of the government that makes laws in many US States
a meeting in a school of several classes, usually at the beginning of the school day, to give information or to say prayers together
assembly.chi_def: （多個班級參加的）集體活動，集會
assembly.eg: All pupils are expected to attend school assembly.

assembly.eng_def: the process of putting together the parts of a machine or structure
the structure produced by this process
assembly.eg: The frame needs to be strong enough to support the engine assembly.

assert.eng_def: to behave in a way that expresses your confidence, importance, or power and earns you respect from others
assert.chi_def: 堅持自己的主張；表現堅定
assert.eg: I really must assert myself more in meetings.

assert.eng_def: to say that something is certainly true
assert.eg: He asserts that she stole money from him.

assert.eng_def: to do something to show that you have power
assert.eg: Throughout the Cold War, the Allies asserted their right to move freely between the two Berlins.

assess.eng_def: to judge or decide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something
assess.eg: The insurers will need to assess the flood damage.

assessment.eng_def: the act of judging or deciding the amount, value, quality, or importance of something, or the judgment or decision that is made
assessment.eg: Would you say that is a fair assessment of the situation?

asset.eng_def: a useful or valuable quality, skill, or person
asset.eg: He'll be a great asset to the team.

asset.eng_def: something valuable belonging to a person or organization that can be used for the payment of debts
asset.eg: A company's assets can consist of cash, investments, specialist knowledge, or copyright material.

assign.eng_def: to give a particular job or piece of work to someone
assign.eg: UN troops were assigned the task of rebuilding the hospital.

assign.eng_def: If you assign a time for a job or activity, you decide it will be done during that time.
assign.eg: Have you assigned a day for the interviews yet?

assign.eng_def: If you assign a characteristic or value to something, you say that it has it.
assign.eg: Each visitor to the site chooses an online alter ego, which is assigned a name.

assign.eng_def: to decide a reason for something
assign.eg: Detectives have been unable to assign a motive for the murder.

assign.eng_def: to send someone somewhere to do a job
assign.eg: She was assigned to the newspaper's Berlin office.

assign.eng_def: to put a value in a particular position in the memory of a computer
to give property, money, or rights using a legal process
assign.chi_def: 把（財產、權利等）讓與，轉讓
assign.eg: Her property was assigned to her grandchildren.

assignment.eng_def: a piece of work given to someone, typically as part of their studies or job
assignment.chi_def: （尤指學業或工作方面的）任務，功課

assignment.eng_def: a job that someone is sent somewhere to do
Someone who is on assignment is doing a particular job or piece of work, usually in a particular place where they have been sent for a period of time.
assignment.chi_def: 執行任務；（通常指被派遣到特定地點，在一段時間內從事的）工作
assignment.eg: Both journalists were killed by terrorists while on assignment in the region.

assignment.eng_def: the process of giving a particular job or piece of work to someone, or of sending someone to a chosen place to do a job

assist.eg: The army arrived to assist in the search.

assist.eng_def: If someone is assisting the police with their inquiries, it usually means they have been taken to the police station to be asked questions about a crime.
in sports, a time when a player touches the ball and this leads to another player on the same team scoring a goal or point
assist.chi_def: （籃球、足球等的）助攻；（棒球等的）助殺
assist.eg: Ozil has the most assists in the Premier League this season.

assistance.eg: The company needs more financial assistance from the government.

assistant.eng_def: someone who helps someone else to do a job
someone who works in a shop, selling goods to customers and giving advice about the goods sold in the shop

associate.eng_def: to connect someone or something in your mind with someone or something else
associate.chi_def: 將…（與…）聯繫起來，把…聯繫在一起
associate.eg: Most people associate this brand with good quality.

associate.eng_def: someone who is closely connected to another person as a companion, friend, or business partner
associate.eg: A close associate of the author denied reports that she had cancer.

associate.eng_def: someone who holds an associate's degree
used in the title of a person whose rank is slightly lower or less complete than the full official position described
associate.eg: an associate member of an organization

association.eng_def: a group of people who work together in a single organization for a particular purpose
the fact of being involved with or connected to someone or something
a feeling or thought that relates to someone or something
association.eg: The beach has positive associations for me as I used to spend my holidays there.

assume.eng_def: to accept something to be true without question or proof
assume.chi_def: 假定，假設；臆斷，想當然地認為
assume.eg: I assumed (that) you knew each other because you went to the same school.

assume.eng_def: to pretend to have a different name or be someone you are not, or to express a feeling falsely
assume.eg: Moving to a different town, he assumed a false name.

assume.eng_def: to take or begin to have responsibility or control, sometimes without the right to do so, or to begin to have a characteristic
assume.chi_def: 承擔，擔任；僭取，奪取；呈現，具有
assume.eg: The new president assumes office at midnight tonight.

assumption.eng_def: something that you accept as true without question or proof
assumption.eg: People tend to make assumptions about you when you have a disability.

assumption.eng_def: the act of taking a position of power, responsibility, etc.
assumption.chi_def: 奪取，獲得（權力等）；承擔（責任等）
assumption.eg: The revolutionaries' assumption of power took the army by surprise.

assurance.eg: She gave me her assurance (that) she would sign the contract immediately.

assurance.eng_def: a type of insurance against events that will certainly happen, such as death, not those that may happen, such as illness, fire, or having your property stolen

assure.eng_def: to tell someone confidently that something is true, especially so that they do not worry
assure.chi_def: （尤指為消除其憂慮而）確定地對…說，向…保證，使確信；讓…放心
assure.eg: The unions assured the new owners of the workers' loyalty to the company.

assure.eng_def: to cause something to be certain
assure.eg: The play's popularity has been assured by the critics' rave reviews.

assure.eng_def: (of an organization) to promise to pay an amount of money to a person or their family if that person becomes ill, gets injured, or dies, in return for small regular payments

asthma.eng_def: a medical condition that makes breathing difficult by causing the air passages to become narrow or blocked

astonish.eg: I was astonished by how much she'd grown.

astonishment.eg: To the astonishment of her colleagues, she resigned.

astray.eng_def: away from the correct path or correct way of doing something
astray.chi_def: 偏離正軌地；迷路地；離開正道地；誤入歧途地
astray.eg: The letter must have gone astray in the post.

astronaut.eng_def: a person who has been trained for travelling in space

astronomy.eng_def: the scientific study of the universe and of objects that exist naturally in space, such as the moon, the sun, planets, and stars

asylum.eng_def: protection or safety, especially that given by a government to people who have been forced to leave their own countries for their safety or because of war
a hospital for people with mental illnesses

at.eng_def: used to show an exact position or particular place
at.chi_def: （表示地點或位置）在…裡；在…上；在…旁
at.eg: We'll meet you at the entrance.

at.eng_def: used to show an exact or a particular time
at.chi_def: （表示確切或某一時間）在…時刻；在…期間；在…歲時
at.eg: There's a meeting at 2.30 this afternoon.

at.eng_def: used to show the cause of something, especially a feeling
at.chi_def: （尤指感覺是）由於，因為，作為對…的反應
at.eg: We were surprised at the news.

at.eng_def: used to show the activity in which someone's ability is being judged
at.eg: I was never very good at sports.

at.eng_def: the @ symbol that joins the name of a person or a department in an organization to a domain name to make an email address
at.eg: "What's your email address?" "It's dictionary at cambridge dot org."

at.eng_def: used to show a price, temperature, rate, speed, etc.
at.chi_def: （表示價格、溫度、比率、速度等）以，達
at.eg: I'm not going to buy those shoes at $150!

at.eng_def: used in financial records to show the price, rate, etc. of a particular thing or of each of a number of things on a list
at.chi_def: （用於財務紀錄中表示某一項目的價格、比率等的）符號@

at.eng_def: used to show a state, condition, or continuous activity
at.chi_def: （表示狀態、狀況或連續的活動）處於；從事於；忙於

athlete.eng_def: a person who is very good at sports or physical exercise, especially one who competes in organized events
athlete.chi_def: （尤指參加有組織的賽事的）運動員；健兒，擅長運動的人
athlete.eg: He became a professional athlete at the age of 16.

athletic.eng_def: strong, healthy, and good at sports

athletic.eg: This college has a long tradition of athletic excellence.

atmosphere.eng_def: the mixture of gases around the earth
atmosphere.chi_def: （包圍地球的）大氣，大氣層，大氣圈
atmosphere.eg: These factories are releasing toxic gases into the atmosphere.

atmosphere.eng_def: a mixture of gases that surrounds any planet
atmosphere.eg: the search for planets with a breathable atmosphere

atmosphere.eng_def: the air that you breathe in a place
atmosphere.eg: The atmosphere in the room was so stuffy I could hardly breathe.

atmosphere.eng_def: the character, feeling, or mood of a place or situation
atmosphere.eg: There's a very relaxed atmosphere in our office.

atmosphere.eng_def: a feeling that a place has of being pleasant and interesting or exciting
atmosphere.eg: You want a restaurant that serves good food but has a little atmosphere too.

atom.eng_def: the smallest unit of any chemical element, consisting of a positive nucleus surrounded by negative electrons. Atoms can combine to form a molecule
atom.eg: A molecule of carbon dioxide (CO2) has one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms.

atomic.eng_def: using the energy that is created when an atom is divided
atomic.chi_def: 原子能的；利用原子能的

attach.eng_def: to fasten, join, or connect something
attach.chi_def: 繫，綁；連接；使附著；附上；固定
attach.eg: I attached a photo to my application form.

attach.eng_def: to join a file such as a document, picture, or computer program, to an email
attach.chi_def: 把…作為電子郵件的附件

attach.eng_def: to officially take someone's money or the things that they own, or to arrest someone, usually because that person has failed to pay money that is owed
attach.chi_def: （通常因為債務人不能償還債務而）扣押（債務人或其財產）

attachment.eng_def: an extra piece of equipment that can be added to a machine
attachment.eg: This food processor has a special attachment for grinding coffee.

attachment.eng_def: a computer file that is sent together with an email message
attachment.eg: I'll email my report to you as an attachment.

attachment.eng_def: a feeling of love or strong connection to someone or something
attachment.eg: At university I formed a strong attachment to one of my tutors.

attachment.eng_def: a feeling of love and need for another person, for example for a mother by her child
attachment.eg: Secure attachment is believed to be important for healthy development.

attachment.eng_def: the act of arresting a person for failing to obey the order of a court, or of officially taking their property because they have failed to pay money that they owe

attack.eng_def: to try to hurt or defeat using violence
attack.eg: He was attacked and seriously injured by a gang of youths.
She wrote an article attacking the judges and their conduct of the trial.

attack.eng_def: If something, such as a disease or a chemical, attacks something, it damages it.
attack.chi_def: （疾病、化學品等）侵襲；侵害；侵蝕
attack.eg: AIDS attacks the body's immune system.

attack.eng_def: If players in a team attack, they move forward to try to score points, goals, etc.
to deal with something quickly and in an effective way
attack.chi_def: 迅速處理；高效解決；全力應付
attack.eg: We have to attack these problems now and find some solutions.

attack.eng_def: a violent act intended to hurt or damage someone or something
a strong criticism of someone or something
attack.eg: a scathing attack on the president

attack.eng_def: a sudden and short period of illness
the part of a team in some sports that tries to score points
attack.eg: The team has a strong attack, but its defence is weak.

attack.eng_def: determination in the way you play a sport, trying hard to score points
attack.eg: The team needs to put some more attack into its game.

attain.eng_def: to reach or succeed in getting something
attain.eg: He has attained the highest grade in his music exams.

attainment.eng_def: Someone's attainments are the things they have done and the skills they have learned.

attempt.eng_def: to try to do something, especially something difficult
attempt.chi_def: （尤指為完成難事而進行）努力，嘗試
attempt.eg: He attempted to escape through a window.

attempt.eng_def: the act of trying to do something, especially something difficult
attempt.chi_def: （尤指為完成難事而進行的）努力，嘗試
attempt.eg: She made a few half-hearted attempts to join in their conversation.

attempt.eng_def: an act of trying to kill someone
attempt.eg: This is the third attempt on the President's life.

attempt.eng_def: an act of trying to score a goal in a game of football
attempt.eg: Chelsea had several attempts on goal in the first 15 minutes.

attend.eng_def: to go to an event, place, etc.
attend.eg: Over two hundred people attended the funeral.

attend.eng_def: to go officially and usually regularly to a place
attend.eg: Which school do your children attend?

attend.eng_def: to give attention to what someone is saying
attend.eg: I'm afraid I wasn't attending to what was being said.

attend.eng_def: to provide a service to someone, especially as part of your job
attend.chi_def: （尤指作為工作）服侍；陪同；看護，照顧
attend.eg: The queen was attended by her ladies-in-waiting.

attend.eng_def: to happen as a result of, and at the same time as
attend.chi_def: 伴隨…而至；（作為結果）伴隨
attend.eg: the publicity that attends a career in television

attendance.eng_def: the fact of going somewhere such as a church, school, etc. regularly
attendance.chi_def: （有規律地）出席，參加；到場（如去教堂，學校等）

attendance.eng_def: the number of people who go to an event, meeting, etc.
attendance.chi_def: 出席（活動、會議等）的人數

attendance.eng_def: present with someone and helping or taking care of them
attendance.eg: He never goes out without his security men in attendance.

attendant.eng_def: someone whose job is to be in a place and help visitors or customers
someone whose job is to travel or live with an important person and help him or her
attendant.eg: The Prince was followed by his attendants.

attendant.eng_def: coming with a stated thing or resulting from it
present with someone to help them, or present at an event, place, etc.

attention.eg: Ladies and gentlemen, could I have your attention, please?
I knocked on the window to get her attention.

attention.eng_def: to watch, listen to, or think about something or someone carefully or with interest
attention.eg: If you don't pay attention now, you'll get it all wrong later.

attention.eng_def: the thing or person that a lot of people notice
attention.eg: He likes telling jokes and being the centre of attention at parties.

attention.eng_def: to start to think about or consider a particular thing or person
attention.eg: Many countries are starting to turn their attention to new forms of energy.
The paintwork will need a little attention.

attention.eng_def: (especially in the armed forces) a way of standing, with the feet together, arms by your sides, head up, and shoulders back, and not moving

attic.eng_def: the space or room at the top of a building, under the roof, often used for storing things
attic.eg: I've got boxes of old clothes in the attic.

attitude.eng_def: a feeling or opinion about something or someone, or a way of behaving that is caused by this
attitude.eg: It's often very difficult to change people's attitudes.

attitude.eng_def: If you say that someone has attitude, you mean that they are very confident and want people to notice them.

attitude.eg: She lay sprawled across the sofa, in an attitude of complete abandon.

attract.eng_def: (of people, things, places, etc.) to pull or draw someone or something towards them, by the qualities they have, especially good ones
attract.chi_def: （尤因具有積極、值得讚賞的品質而）吸引；招引；引起
attract.eg: These flowers are brightly coloured in order to attract butterflies.

attract.eng_def: If you are attracted by or to someone, you like them, often finding them sexually interesting.
attract.chi_def: 吸引；誘惑；引起…的愛慕；使喜愛
attract.eg: I'm not physically/sexually attracted to him.

attract.eng_def: When something such as a magnet attracts something else, it pulls it towards it.

attraction.eng_def: something that makes people want to go to a place or do a particular thing
attraction.chi_def: 吸引（力）；有吸引力的事物
attraction.eg: Life in Los Angeles has so many attractions - nightclubs, good restaurants, and so on.

attraction.eng_def: the feeling of liking someone, especially sexually, because of the way they look or behave
attraction.chi_def: （尤指兩性間的）誘惑；迷戀；喜愛
attraction.eg: She felt an immediate physical attraction to him.

attraction.eng_def: a force by which things are pulled towards each other
attraction.chi_def: （萬有）引力；（萬有）引力作用；重力；重力作用

attractive.eng_def: very pleasing in appearance or sound
attractive.chi_def: 漂亮的；悅耳的；有魅力的；誘人的
漂亮的；悅耳的；有魅力的；誘人的
attractive.eg: Spending twelve hours on a plane isn't a very attractive (= pleasant) prospect.

auction.eng_def: a usually public sale of goods or property, where people make higher and higher bids (= offers of money) for each thing, until the thing is sold to the person who will pay most
to sell something in a public auction
auction.eg: The stamps will be auctioned tomorrow.

audience.eng_def: the group of people together in one place to watch or listen to a play, film, someone speaking, etc.
audience.eg: She lectures to audiences all over the world.

audience.eng_def: the (number of) people watching or listening to a particular television or radio programme, reading a particular book, or visiting a particular website
audience.chi_def: 觀眾人數；聽眾人數；讀者人數
audience.eg: The television company has lost a large part of its audience since it changed its programming.

audience.eng_def: a formal meeting that you have with an important person
audience.eg: She had a private audience with the king.

audio.eng_def: connected with sound and the recording and broadcasting of sound
audio.chi_def: 聲音的；錄音的；播音的；音頻的

auditorium.eng_def: the part of a theatre, or similar building, where the people who are watching and listening sit
a large public building where meetings, concerts, etc. are held

aunt.eng_def: the sister of someone's father or mother, or the wife of someone's uncle or aunt
aunt.chi_def: 姑母；姨母；嬸嬸；伯母；舅母
aunt.eg: I have an aunt in Australia.

auntie.chi_def: 姑母；姨母；嬸嬸；伯母；舅母（同 aunt）
auntie.eg: My auntie and uncle are coming to visit.

auntie.eng_def: any female adult that you know who is older than you
auntie.chi_def: 阿姨（對女性長輩的通稱）

aunty.eng_def: the sister of someone's father or mother, or the wife of someone's uncle or aunt
aunty.chi_def: 姑母；姨母；嬸嬸；伯母；舅母
aunty.eg: I have an aunt in Australia.

authentic.eng_def: If something is authentic, it is real, true, or what people say it is.
authentic.chi_def: 真的；真正的；可靠的；可信的

author.eng_def: the writer of a book, article, play, etc.
author.eg: He is the author of two books on French history.

author.eng_def: a person who begins or creates something
author.eg: She's the author of the company's recent success/of all our troubles.

author.eng_def: to write a book, article, etc.
author.eg: He has authored more than 30 books.
The deal is being authored by a Greek diplomat.

authority.eng_def: the moral or legal right or ability to control
authority.eg: The United Nations has used/exerted/exercised its authority to restore peace in the area.

authority.eng_def: a group of people with official responsibility for a particular area of activity
the group of people with official legal power to make decisions or make people obey the laws in a particular area, such as the police or a local government department
authority.eg: I'm going to report these potholes to the authorities.
She's a world authority on 19th-century Irish history.

authorize.eng_def: to give official permission for something to happen, or to give someone official permission to do something

auto.eng_def: of or by yourself, or operating independently and without needing help
auto.chi_def: 自己的；本身的；自己做的；自動的

autobiography.eng_def: a book about a person's life, written by that person
autobiography.eg: Tony Blair's autobiography was a bestseller.

autobiography.eng_def: the area of literature relating to such books
autobiography.eg: His life story is recounted in two fascinating volumes of autobiography.
Biographers tend to be more accurate and objective than autobiographers.

autograph.eng_def: a signature (= your name written by yourself), especially of a famous person
to write your signature (= your name written by yourself) on something for someone else to keep
autograph.eg: I got her to autograph my T-shirt.

automatic.eng_def: An automatic machine or device is able to operate independently of human control.

automatic.chi_def: 無意識的，不自覺的；不假思索的，機械的
automatic.eg: Over time, driving just becomes automatic.

automatic.eng_def: certain to happen as part of the normal process or system
automatic.chi_def: 必然隨之發生的；自然而然的
automatic.eg: Citizenship is automatic for children born in this country.

automatic.eng_def: a vehicle in which you do not have to change the gears
automatic.chi_def: 自動變速汽車，自動換檔汽車

autonomy.eng_def: the right of an organization, country, or region to be independent and govern itself
autonomy.eg: Demonstrators demanded immediate autonomy for their region.

autonomy.eng_def: the ability to make your own decisions without being controlled by anyone else

autumn.eng_def: the season of the year between summer and winter, lasting from September to November north of the equator and from March to May south of the equator, when fruits and crops become ready to eat and are picked, and leaves fall
autumn.eg: We like to travel in (the) autumn when there are fewer tourists.

auxiliary.eng_def: giving help or support, especially to a more important person or thing
a person whose job is to give help or support to other workers
a soldier of one country who fights for another country
auxiliary.chi_def: 外國援軍士兵，盟國援軍士兵；僱傭兵

auxiliary.eng_def: a verb that gives grammatical information not given by the main verb of a sentence
auxiliary.eg: In the sentence "she has finished her book", "has" is an auxiliary.

available.eng_def: able to be bought or used
available.eg: Is this dress available in a larger size?

available.eng_def: If someone is available, they are not busy and therefore able to do something.
available.eg: I'm afraid I'm not available to help with the show on the 19th.

avenue.eng_def: a wide road with trees or tall buildings on both sides, or a wide country path or road with trees on both sides
avenue.chi_def: （兩邊有樹或高樓的）大街；（鄉間寬闊的）林蔭大道

avenue.eng_def: a road that leads to a large house
a method or way of doing something
avenue.eg: We should explore/pursue every avenue in the search for an answer to this problem.

average.eng_def: the result you get by adding two or more amounts together and dividing the total by the number of amounts
average.eg: The average of the three numbers 7, 12, and 20 is 13, because the total of 7, 12, and 20 is 39, and 39 divided by 3 is 13.

average.eng_def: a standard or level that is considered to be typical or usual
average.chi_def: 一般水準；一般水準；平均水準
average.eg: The audience figures were lower than average for this sort of film.

average.eng_def: to reach a particular amount as an average
average.eg: Enquiries to our office average 1,000 calls a month.

average.eng_def: An average number is the number you get by adding two or more amounts together and dividing the total by the number of amounts.

average.chi_def: 普通的；平常的；中等的；一般的
average.eg: The average person on the street is a lot better off than they were 40 years ago.

aviation.eng_def: the activity of flying aircraft, or of designing, producing, and keeping them in good condition
aviation.chi_def: 航空（學）；飛行（術）；航空工業

avoid.eng_def: to stay away from someone or something
avoid.eg: I try to avoid supermarkets on Saturdays - they're always so busy.

avoid.eng_def: to prevent something from happening or to not allow yourself to do something
avoid.eg: I try to avoid going shopping on Saturdays.

await.eng_def: to wait for or be waiting for something
await.eg: He's anxiously awaiting his test results.

awake.eg: "Is Oliver awake yet?" "Yes, he's wide (= completely) awake and running around his bedroom."

awake.eng_def: If you are awake to something, you know about it.
awake.eg: Businesses need to be awake to the advantages of European integration.

awake.eng_def: to stop sleeping or to make someone stop sleeping
to start to understand or feel something or to make someone start to understand or feel something
awake.chi_def: （使）領悟；（使）醒悟；（使）意識到；（被）喚起
awake.eg: The chance meeting awoke the old passion between them.

awaken.eng_def: to stop sleeping or to make someone stop sleeping
awaken.eg: They were awakened by the sound of gunfire.

award.eng_def: to give money or a prize following an official decision
award.eg: Carlos was awarded first prize in the essay competition.

award.eng_def: a prize or an amount of money that is given to someone following an official decision
award.eg: They have authorized awards of £900 to each of the victims.

aware.eng_def: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing
aware.chi_def: 意識到的；明白的；知道的
aware.eg: I wasn't even aware that he was ill.

aware.eng_def: having special interest in or experience of something and so knowing what is happening in that subject at the present time
aware.chi_def: 有…意識的；有…覺悟的；有…知識的

away.eng_def: somewhere else, or to or in a different place, position, or situation
away.chi_def: 去（或在）別處；向另一方向；向一邊
away.eg: Ms Watson is away on holiday until the end of the week.

away.eng_def: at a distance (of or from here)
away.eg: How far away is the station?

away.eng_def: in or into the usual or a suitable place, especially one that can be closed
away.chi_def: 在老地方；在適當的地方；放到，放進（尤指封閉的空間）
away.eg: Would you put the ice cream away in the freezer?

away.eng_def: gradually until mostly or completely gone
away.eg: All the snow had melted away.
My English exam's only a week away and I haven't even started to prepare.

away.eng_def: continuously or repeatedly, or in a busy way
away.chi_def: 連續不斷地；一直；幹勁十足地
away.eg: I was still writing away when the exam finished.

away.eng_def: An away match or game is played at an opposing team's sports ground.
away.chi_def: （比賽）客場的，在對方場地舉行的
away.eg: We lost the away game but won both home games.

awe.eng_def: a feeling of great respect sometimes mixed with fear or surprise
awe.eg: I've always held musicians in awe.

awe.eng_def: to cause someone to feel awe
awe.eg: I was awed but not frightened by the huge gorilla.

awesome.eng_def: causing feelings of great admiration, respect, or fear
awesome.chi_def: 令人敬畏的；令人驚嘆的；令人驚懼的
awesome.eg: An awesome challenge/task lies ahead of them.
You look totally awesome in that dress.

awful.chi_def: 極壞的；惡劣的；糟糕的；令人極不愉快的
awful.eg: He suffered awful injuries in the crash.
I don't know an awful lot (= very much) about art, but I'm learning.

awkward.eng_def: difficult to use, do, or deal with
awkward.chi_def: 難用的；棘手的；難處理的，難對付的
awkward.eg: It's an awkward corner, so take it slowly.

awkward.chi_def: 令人尷尬的；使人難堪的
尷尬的；局促不安的；為難的
awkward.eg: I always feel awkward when I'm with Chris - he's so difficult to talk to.

awkward.chi_def: 難相處的；不合作的；故意為難的
awkward.eg: Just stop being so awkward and help me push the car, will you!

awkward.eng_def: moving in a way that is not natural, relaxed, or attractive
awkward.chi_def: 笨拙的；不靈活的；難看的
