awkward.eg: His movements were slow and awkward.

ax.eng_def: a tool that has a heavy iron or steel blade at the end of a long wooden handle, used for cutting wood
ax.eg: Julian used an axe to chop down the old apple tree.

ax.eng_def: the situation in which someone loses their job
ax.eg: Over 500 staff are facing the axe.

ax.eng_def: When a service, plan, etc. gets the axe, it is stopped or prevented from happening.
ax.chi_def: （業務、計劃等）被取消，被撤銷，被砍掉
ax.eg: Religious programmes will be the first to get the axe if she's put in charge of the station.

ax.eng_def: to reduce services, jobs, payments, etc. a lot or completely without warning or in a single action
ax.eg: Because of the recession the company is to axe 350 jobs.

axe.eng_def: a tool that has a heavy iron or steel blade at the end of a long wooden handle, used for cutting wood
axe.eg: Julian used an axe to chop down the old apple tree.

axe.eng_def: the situation in which someone loses their job
axe.eg: Over 500 staff are facing the axe.

axe.eng_def: When a service, plan, etc. gets the axe, it is stopped or prevented from happening.
axe.chi_def: （業務、計劃等）被取消，被撤銷，被砍掉
axe.eg: Religious programmes will be the first to get the axe if she's put in charge of the station.

axe.eng_def: to reduce services, jobs, payments, etc. a lot or completely without warning or in a single action
axe.eg: Because of the recession the company is to axe 350 jobs.

baby.eng_def: a very young child, especially one that has not yet begun to walk or talk
baby.chi_def: （尤指尚未學會走路或說話的）嬰兒，嬰孩

baby.eng_def: an adult or especially an older child who is crying or behaving like a child
baby.eg: It didn't hurt that much - don't be such a baby!

baby.eng_def: a word you can use when you are talking to someone you love such as your wife, husband, partner, etc.
baby.chi_def: 寶貝（對妻子、丈夫、情人等的稱呼）

baby.eng_def: a type of vegetable that is specially grown to stay small
Someone's baby is something that they have a special interest in and responsibility for.
baby.chi_def: （某人特別的或專門的）任務，差事；責任
baby.eg: I don't know much about the project - it's Philip's baby.

baby.eng_def: to treat an older child as if he or she were a much younger child
baby.chi_def: 把…當嬰兒般對待；對…嬌生慣養
baby.eg: The boys were now ten and twelve and didn't want their mother to baby them.

bachelor.eng_def: a man who has never married
bachelor.eg: He remained a bachelor until he was well into his 40s.

back.eng_def: in, into, or towards a previous place or condition, or an earlier time
back.chi_def: 在原處；回到原處；恢復原狀；返回；回到以前
back.eg: When you take the scissors, remember to put them back.
If he hits me, I'll hit him back.
I'm busy at the moment - can I call you back?
If we push the table back against the wall, we'll have more room.

back.eng_def: the inside or outside part of an object, vehicle, building, etc. that is furthest from the front
back.eg: He jotted her name down on the back of an envelope.

back.eng_def: close together and facing in opposite directions
back.eg: The office was full of computers, and we had to sit back to back in long rows.

back.eng_def: happening one after another, without interruption
back.eg: Coming up after the break, three Rolling Stones classics back to back.

back.eng_def: with the back part of something where the front should be
back.eg: You've put your jumper on back to front.

back.eng_def: the side of your hand that has hair growing on it
the part of your body that is opposite to the front, from your shoulders to your bottom
(in some sports, such as football) one of the players in a team who try to stop players from the other team from scoring goals, rather than trying to score goals himself or herself
to give support to someone or something with money or words
back.eg: The management has refused to back our proposals.

back.eng_def: to risk money by saying that you think a horse, team, etc. will win a race, game, or competition in order to win more money if they do
back.eg: The horse I backed came in last.
Ann gave up driving when she backed the car into the garage door.

back.eng_def: to cover the back of something with a material, often to make it stronger or thicker
back.chi_def: 為某物加背襯使其更加堅固或厚實
back.eg: The material is backed with a heavy lining.

back.eng_def: at or near the back of something
back.eg: She left the house by the back door.

back.eng_def: paid after the end of a period of time when it should have been paid
back.eg: They owe the staff several thousand in back pay.

backbone.eng_def: the line of bones down the centre of the back that provides support for the body
backbone.eg: She stood with her backbone rigid.

backbone.eng_def: the most important part of something, providing support for everything else
backbone.eg: Farming is the backbone of the country's economy.
Will he have the backbone to tell them what he thinks?

background.eng_def: the things that can be seen behind the main things or people in a picture
background.eg: The artist himself did not paint the backgrounds to his pictures - they were done by his pupils.

background.eng_def: sounds that can be heard behind other sounds that are louder
background.eg: If you listen carefully to this piece of music, you can hear a flute in the background.

background.eng_def: the conditions that existed before a particular event happened, and that help to explain why it happened
background.eg: These decisions have had to be made against a background of high unemployment.

background.eng_def: If someone or something is in the background, they are not the main point of attention.
background.chi_def: 幕後；不引人注目的地方
background.eg: Her worries about her job have faded into the background since she learned about her father's illness.

background.eng_def: your family and your experience of education, living conditions, money, etc.
background.eg: The school has students from many different ethnic/cultural/religious backgrounds.

background.eng_def: used to refer to something that is done before, and in preparation for, something else
background.eg: Students are expected to do some background reading before the course starts.

backpack.eng_def: a large bag used to carry things on your back, used especially by people who go camping or walking
backpack.chi_def: （尤指徒步旅行或登山時背的）旅行包，背包
backpack.eg: It's a frame backpack with a belt and padded shoulder straps.

backpack.eng_def: to travel or go camping while carrying your clothes and other things that you need in a backpack

backward.eg: When he was a child, his teachers thought he was backward (= unable to learn as much as most children).

backward.eng_def: towards the direction that is the opposite to the one in which you are facing
backward.chi_def: 向後的；與面對方向相反的
backward.eg: She left without a backward glance.

backwards.eng_def: towards the direction that is opposite to the one in which you are facing or opposite to the usual direction
backwards.eg: I walked backwards towards the door.

backwards.eng_def: returning to older and less effective ways
backwards.eg: The breakdown in negotiations will be seen as a step backwards.

backwards.eng_def: first in one direction and then in the opposite one
backwards.eg: Paul paced anxiously backwards and forwards.

bacon.eng_def: meat from the back or sides of a pig, often eaten fried in thin slices

bad.eng_def: unpleasant and causing difficulties or harm
bad.chi_def: 壞的，不好的；令人不悅的
bad.eg: Our holiday was spoiled by bad weather.
He was best in his age group - not bad, eh?

bad.chi_def: 感到羞愧；感到抱歉；感到難過
bad.eg: Knowing that I hurt her makes me feel really bad.

bad.eng_def: If a situation goes from bad to worse, it was difficult and unpleasant, and is becoming even more so.
bad.eg: Things have gone from bad to worse.

bad.eng_def: of low quality, or not acceptable
bad.chi_def: 劣質的，很差的；不可接受的
bad.eg: The plumber did a bad job on the repairs.

bad.eng_def: (of people or actions) evil or morally unacceptable
bad.eg: There are a lot of bad people in the world.
She can't walk up all those steps, not with her bad leg!

bad.eng_def: harmful to eat because of being decayed
bad.eg: We'd better eat this chicken before it goes bad.

bad.eng_def: the quality of being evil or morally unacceptable
bad.chi_def: 邪惡的本性；道德敗壞的本性
bad.eg: There is goodness and badness in everyone.
He needs the money real bad.

bad.eng_def: things or events that are not good or that are morally wrong
bad.eg: She only ever sees the bad in people.

badge.eng_def: a small piece of metal, plastic, cloth, etc., with words or a picture on it, that you carry with you or that is fastened or sewn to your clothing, often to show your support for a political organization or belief, or to show who you are, your rank, or that you are a member of a group, etc.
badge.eg: Everyone at the conference wore a badge with their name on.

badly.eng_def: in a severe and harmful way
badly.eg: She was badly affected by the events in her childhood.

badly.eng_def: in a way that is not acceptable or of good quality
badly.chi_def: 壞，差；不可接受的；拙劣地
badly.eg: The event was really badly organized.
He needs the money really badly.

badminton.eng_def: a sport in which two or four people hit a shuttlecock (= a light object with feathers) over a high net

bag.eng_def: a soft container made out of paper or thin plastic, or a stronger container made of leather, plastic, or other material, usually with a handle, in which you carry personal things or clothes or other things that you need for travelling
dark, loose, or swollen skin under your eyes because of tiredness or old age
a rude and insulting name for a woman, especially an older one
bag.chi_def: （侮辱性語言）（尤指年紀大的）醜婦

bag.eng_def: trousers with a wide and loose style
to put something in a bag
bag.eg: Shall I bag (up) those tomatoes for you?

bag.eng_def: to get something before other people have a chance to take it
bag.eg: Bag us some decent seats/Bag some decent seats for us if you get there first, won't you?

bag.eng_def: to win sth, especially a prize
bag.eg: He's the bookies' favourite to bag an Oscar.

bag.eng_def: to hunt and kill an animal or bird
to reach the top of a mountain
bag.eg: We bagged three summits in one day.

bag.eng_def: to hang loosely like a bag
bag.eg: I hate these trousers - they bag (out) at the back.

bag.eng_def: to not use something that you have, and use something else instead
bag.eg: Bag that old gray sweater, and wear something more colorful.

bag.eng_def: to criticize or laugh at someone or something in an unkind way
bag.eg: Stop bagging her (out) - she's doing her best.

baggage.eng_def: all the suitcases and bags that you take with you when you travel
baggage.eg: How many pieces of baggage do you have?

baggage.eng_def: the beliefs and feelings that influence how you think and behave
baggage.eg: We all carry a lot of emotional baggage around with us.

bait.eng_def: a small amount of food on a hook (= curved piece of wire) or in a special device used to attract and catch a fish or animal
bait.eg: They were digging up worms to use for bait.

bait.eng_def: something that is said or offered to people in order to make them react in a particular way
bait.eg: Free holidays were offered as (a) bait to customers.

bait.eng_def: to intentionally make a person angry by saying or doing things to annoy them
bait.eg: Ignore him - he's just baiting you.

bait.eng_def: to make dogs attack an animal for cruel entertainment
bait.eg: In the past, bear-baiting was a common form of entertainment in the UK .

bait.eng_def: to put food on a hook (= curved piece of wire) or in a special device to attract and catch a fish or animal
bait.eg: Do you have any stale cheese that I can bait the mousetrap with?

bake.eng_def: to cook inside an oven, without using added liquid or fat
bake.eg: I made the icing while the cake was baking.

bake.eng_def: to make something such as earth or clay hard by heating it, usually in order to make bricks
to be or become very hot

bakery.eng_def: a place where bread and cakes are made and sometimes sold

balance.eng_def: a state where things are of equal weight or force
balance.eg: The toddler wobbled and lost his balance (= started to fall sideways).

balance.eng_def: The balance on a piece of electronic equipment for playing music is the particular mixture of different sounds, or the device that controls this.
balance.chi_def: （樂音的）平衡，安排與調整；（樂器）平衡器

balance.eng_def: after thinking about all the different facts or opinions
balance.eg: I would say that, on balance, it hasn't been a bad year.

balance.eng_def: a device used for weighing things, consisting of two dishes hanging on a bar that shows when the contents of both dishes weigh the same
the amount of money you have in a bank account, or the amount of something that you have left after you have spent or used up the rest
balance.eg: Once we know how much money we'll need, let's spend the balance (= the amount left).

balance.eng_def: the money that is returned to someone who has paid for something that costs less than the amount that they gave
to be in a position where you will stand without falling to either side, or to put something in this position
balance.eg: The flamingos balanced gracefully on one leg.

balance.eng_def: to give several things equal amounts of importance, time, or money so that a situation is successful
balance.eg: I struggle to balance work and family commitments.

balance.eng_def: to arrange a system that relates to money so that the amount of money spent is not more than the amount received
balance.eg: Stringent measures were introduced so that the government could balance its budget/the economy.

balance.eng_def: to make certain that the amount of money spent is not more than the amount of money received
balance.eg: If the business loses any more money, we won't be able to balance the books this year.

balcony.eng_def: an area with a wall or bars around it that is joined to the outside wall of a building on an upper level
balcony.eg: We had a drink on the hotel balcony.

balcony.eng_def: an area of seats at an upper level in a theatre
balcony.eg: Our seats are in row F of the balcony.

bald.eng_def: with little or no hair on the head
bald.eg: At 20 he was already going bald.
When he took off his hat, we saw that he was as bald as a coot!

bald.eng_def: basic and with no unnecessary words or detail
bald.chi_def: 簡單的；不加贅述的；不加詳述的
bald.eg: There was just this bald statement of resignation - no explanation or anything.

bald.eng_def: a bald tyre is one that has worn away to become very smooth and is therefore dangerous

ball.eng_def: any object in the shape of a sphere, especially one used as a toy by children or in various sports such as tennis and football
a long piece of thread that has been rolled into a ball
the rounded part of your foot or thumb where the toes join the foot and the thumb joins the hand
in football, a pass from one player to another
ball.eg: Long picked up a great ball from Campbell and rounded the keeper to score.

ball.eng_def: in baseball, a ball that is thrown to the batter but that the batter does not try to hit because it is outside the hitting area
any game that involves throwing and catching a ball
ball.eg: The kids were outside playing ball.

ball.eng_def: a large formal occasion where people dance
ball.eg: Did you go to the Summer Ball last year?

ball.eng_def: to make something form a closed round shape
ball.eg: She balled her fists so her nails dug deep into her palms.

ball.eng_def: (of a man) to have sex with someone

ballet.eng_def: a type of dancing where carefully organized movements tell a story or express an idea, or a theatre work that uses this type of dancing

balloon.eng_def: a small, very thin rubber bag that you blow air into or fill with a light gas until it is round in shape, used for decoration at parties or as a children's toy
balloon.eg: We tied balloons and streamers to the ceiling ready for the party.

balloon.eng_def: a very large balloon that is filled with hot air or gas and can carry people in a basket (= open container ) hanging under it
balloon.eg: People first flew in a balloon in 1783.
I ballooned when I was pregnant with my second baby.

balloon.eng_def: to quickly increase in size, weight, or importance
balloon.chi_def: （在大小、重量或重要性上）激增
balloon.eg: The rumours soon ballooned into a full-blown scandal.

ballot.eng_def: a system or occasion of secret voting
a piece of paper on which you write your vote
to vote secretly on a particular matter
ballot.eg: OK, this seems to be an area of disagreement, so let's put it to the ballot.

ballot.eng_def: to organize a secret vote by a group of people in order to find out their views
ballot.eg: The union decided to ballot its members on the issue.

bamboo.eng_def: a tall tropical grass with hard, hollow stems, or the stems of this plant
bamboo.eg: Use bamboo canes to support tomato plants.

ban.eng_def: to forbid (= refuse to allow) something, especially officially
ban.eg: The film was banned (= the government prevented it from being shown) in several countries.

ban.eng_def: an official order that prevents something from happening
ban.eg: There should be a ban on talking loudly in cinemas.

banana.eng_def: a long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside

band.eng_def: a group of musicians who play modern music together
a group of young men or women who perform popular songs together and dance as a group
band.eg: He made his name in the 90s boy band Boyzone, before going on to a highly successful solo career.

band.eng_def: a thin, flat piece of cloth, elastic, metal, or other material put around something, or a long, narrow piece of colour, light, etc. that is different from what surrounds it
a particular range of values, numbers, etc.
band.eg: The scheme is devised for young people in the 15–20 age band.

band.eng_def: a group of people who share the same interests or beliefs, or who have joined together for a special purpose
band.eg: The former president still has a small band of supporters.

band.eng_def: to put a band on something, especially an animal
band.chi_def: （尤指在動物身上）套環，戴上環套
band.eg: We banded the birds (= put bands around their legs) so that we could identify them later.

bandage.eng_def: a long, narrow piece of cloth that is tied around an injury or a part of someone's body that has been hurt

bandage.chi_def: 邦迪牌創可貼；OK 繃（同 Band-Aid）

bandage.eng_def: to tie a bandage around an injury or part of someone's body, or put bandages on someone or something
bandage.chi_def: 用繃帶包紮（傷口或身體部位）
bandage.eg: You ought to bandage (up) that cut.

bandit.eng_def: a thief with a weapon, especially one belonging to a group that attacks people travelling through the countryside

bang.eng_def: to (cause something to) make a sudden very loud noise or noises
bang.chi_def: 砰砰猛擊，重擊；（使）發出巨響
bang.eg: She banged her fist angrily on the table.

bang.eng_def: to hit a part of the body against something by accident
bang.eg: I banged my head against/on the shelf as I stood up.
The window slammed shut with a loud bang.

bang.eng_def: an act of hitting someone or something
bang.eg: I think she must have got a bang on the head.

bang.eng_def: used to suggest the sound of a sudden loud noise, such as a gunshot or an explosion
bang.eg: "Bang! Bang! You're dead!" said the child, pointing a plastic gun at me.

bang.eng_def: to make a sudden loud noise
bang.eg: The balloon went bang when it landed on the bush.
The car came to a halt bang in the middle of the road.

bank.eng_def: an organization where people and businesses can invest or borrow money, change it to foreign money, etc., or a building where these services are offered
bank.eg: The big banks have been accused of exploiting small firms.

bank.eng_def: In gambling, the bank is money that belongs to the owner and can be won by the players.
sloping raised land, especially along the sides of a river
bank.eg: By the time we reached the opposite bank, the boat was sinking fast.

bank.eng_def: a pile or mass of earth, clouds, etc.
bank.eg: A dark bank of cloud loomed on the horizon.

bank.eng_def: a row of similar things, especially machines or parts of machines
bank.chi_def: 一排，一列，一組（尤指機器或機器零件）

bank.eng_def: A bank of something, such as blood or human organs for medical use, is a place that stores these things for later use.
to keep your money in a particular bank, or to put money into a bank
bank.chi_def: 把錢存入銀行，在某銀行存款
bank.eg: I used to bank with Lloyd's.

bank.eng_def: to win or earn a particular amount of money
bank.chi_def: 贏得或賺取一定金額的錢
bank.eg: She banked £500 in tips that day!

bank.eng_def: (of an aircraft) to fly with one wing higher than the other when turning
bank.eg: We felt the plane bank steeply as it changed direction.

bank.eng_def: to collect in or form into a mass, or to make something do this
bank.eg: The snow had banked up in the corner of the garden.

banker.eng_def: someone with an important position in a bank
banker.eg: She was a successful banker by the time she was 40.

banker.eng_def: the person in games who is responsible for dealing with the money

bankrupt.eng_def: unable to pay what you owe, and having had control of your financial matters given, by a law court, to a person who sells your property to pay your debts
bankrupt.eg: He went bankrupt after only a year in business.
I'll go bankrupt if you kids keep asking me for money!
He believes that modern society is morally bankrupt.

bankrupt.eng_def: a person who is officially bankrupt
bankrupt.eg: He was declared a bankrupt in 2011.

bankrupt.eng_def: to cause someone to become bankrupt
bankrupt.eg: They feared that the loss would bankrupt them.

banner.eng_def: a long piece of cloth with words written on it, sometimes stretched between two poles and carried by people taking part in a march
banner.chi_def: （遊行隊伍等用的）橫額，橫布條
banner.eg: The demonstrators walked along the street, carrying banners and shouting angrily.

banner.chi_def: （網際網路或報紙上的）橫幅廣告，廣告條（同 banner advertisement）

banner.eng_def: an idea, principle, or belief that is strongly supported by someone
banner.eg: They won the election under the banner of lower taxes.

banquet.eng_def: a large formal meal for many people, often followed by speeches in honour of someone
banquet.eg: Medieval banquets are held in the castle once a month.

bar.eng_def: a place where drinks, especially alcoholic drinks, are sold and drunk, or the area in such a place where the person serving the drinks stands
bar.eg: They noticed him going into the hotel bar.

bar.eng_def: a long, thin, straight piece of metal or wood
bar.eg: The gorilla rattled the bars of its cage.

bar.eng_def: a substance that has been made into a solid rectangular shape
The bar of an electric heater is a long, thin wire in the shape of a spring that is wrapped tightly around a tube. When electricity passes through it, it produces heat and red light.
one of the small equal parts into which a piece of music is divided, containing a fixed number of beats
bar.eg: Waltzes have three beats in/to the bar (= in each bar).

bar.eng_def: a vertical line that divides one bar from another in a written piece of music
something that prevents a particular event or development from happening
bar.chi_def: 阻礙某事發生或發展的東西
bar.eg: A lack of formal education is no bar to becoming rich.

bar.eng_def: to prevent something or someone from doing something or going somewhere, or to not allow something
bar.eg: The centre of the town was barred to football supporters.

bar.eng_def: to put bars across something, especially to keep it closed
bar.eg: We barred the door to stop anyone getting into the room.
Everyone is leaving the village, bar the very old and ill.

bar.eng_def: lawyers who are allowed to argue a case in a higher court
all lawyers thought of as a group
to gain a qualification as a lawyer who can argue a case in a higher court
bar.chi_def: 取得（出席高級法庭的）大律師資格，成為（出席高級法庭的）大律師

bar.eng_def: to gain a qualification as a lawyer
bar.chi_def: 取得律師資格，成為律師

barbarian.eng_def: a member of a group of people from a very different country or culture that is considered to be less socially advanced and more violent than your own
barbarian.eg: The walled city was attacked by barbarian hordes.

barbarian.eng_def: a person with little education who has no interest in art and culture
barbarian.eg: How can you call those barbarians your friends?

barbecue.eng_def: a metal frame on which meat, fish, or vegetables are cooked outdoors over a fire
barbecue.eg: Make sure you light the barbecue in plenty of time.

barbecue.eng_def: a meal that is prepared and eaten outdoors using such a frame, often during a party
barbecue.eg: He made some salads to have with the barbecue.

barbecue.eng_def: a party held outdoors, during which food is cooked on a barbecue
barbecue.eg: We're having a barbecue on Saturday - I hope you can come.

barbecue.eng_def: to cook food on a barbecue
barbecue.eg: Their traditional sausages are delicious grilled or barbecued.

barber.eng_def: a man whose job is cutting men's hair

barbershop.eng_def: a shop where a barber works
a type of singing in which four, usually male, voices in close combination perform popular romantic songs, especially from the 1920s and 1930s
barbershop.chi_def: （尤指20世紀20至30年代的）理髮店（男聲）四重唱

bare.eng_def: without any clothes or not covered by anything
bare.chi_def: 赤裸的；裸體的；無遮蔽的；空的
bare.eg: Don't walk around outside in your bare feet.

bare.eng_def: only the most basic or important
bare.eg: I just packed the bare essentials (= the most basic and necessary things).
She eats only the bare minimum to stay alive.

bare.eng_def: If a cupboard or room is bare, there is nothing in it.
to take away the thing that is covering something so that it can be seen
bare.chi_def: 使赤裸；使暴露；除去…的覆蓋物
bare.eg: The men bared their heads (= took their hats off as a sign of respect) as they entered the church.

barefoot.eng_def: not wearing any shoes or socks
barefoot.eg: We took off our shoes and socks and walked barefoot along the beach.

barely.eg: They have barely enough (= no more than what is needed) to pay the rent this month.

bargain.eng_def: something on sale at a lower price than its true value
bargain.eg: This coat was half-price - a real bargain.

bargain.eng_def: an agreement between two people or groups in which each promises to do something in exchange for something else
bargain.eg: "I'll clean the kitchen if you clean the car." "OK, it's a bargain."

bargain.eng_def: to try to make someone agree to give you something that is better for you, such as a better price or better working conditions
bargain.chi_def: 討價還價（如價格、工資或工作條件等）
bargain.eg: Unions bargain with employers for better rates of pay each year.

bark.eng_def: the hard outer covering of a tree
the loud, rough noise that a dog and some other animals make
(of a dog) to make a loud, rough noise
bark.eg: They heard a dog barking outside.

bark.eng_def: to shout at someone in a forceful manner
bark.eg: The sergeant barked (out) a succession of orders to the new recruits.

barn.eng_def: a large building on a farm in which animals or hay (= dried grass) and grain are kept

barometer.eng_def: a device that measures air pressure and shows when the weather is likely to change
something that can show how a particular situation is developing, or how people's opinions on a particular matter are changing
barometer.chi_def: （顥示特定形勢或人們對某一問題態度變化的）晴雨錶，標誌
barometer.eg: This survey is considered to be a reliable barometer of public opinion.

barrel.eng_def: a large container, made of wood, metal, or plastic, with a flat top and bottom and curved sides that make it fatter in the middle
barrel.eg: They drank a whole barrel of beer (= the contents of a barrel) at the party.

barrel.eng_def: In the oil industry, a barrel of oil is equal to 159 litres.
the long part of a gun that is shaped like a tube

barrel.eg: We were barrelling along the autobahn at 180 kph.

barren.eng_def: unable to produce plants or fruit
barren.eg: We drove through a barren, rocky landscape.

barren.eng_def: unable to have children or young animals
not creating or producing anything new
barren.eg: She became very depressed during the barren years when she was unable to paint.

barrier.eng_def: a long pole, fence, wall, or natural feature, such as a mountain or sea, that stops people from going somewhere
barrier.eg: Barriers have been erected all along the route the Pope will take.

barrier.eng_def: a gate in some railway stations through which you must go to get on a train
barrier.eg: Passengers are requested to show their tickets at the barrier.

barrier.eng_def: anything that prevents people from being together or understanding each other
barrier.eg: Despite the language barrier (= not speaking the same language), they soon became good friends.

base.eng_def: the bottom part of an object, on which it rests, or the lowest part of something
base.eg: a crystal glass with a heavy base

base.eng_def: the main place where a person lives and works, or a place that a company does business from
base.eg: I spend a lot of time in Brussels, but London is still my base.

base.eng_def: a place where there are military buildings and weapons and where members of the armed forces live
one of the four positions on a square that a player must reach to score a point in the game of baseball
the activity or people from which someone or something gets most of their support, money, etc.
base.eg: A strong economy depends on a healthy manufacturing base.
a cocktail with a whisky base

base.eng_def: the number on which a counting system is built
base.eg: A binary number is a number written in base 2, using the two numbers 0 and 1.

base.eng_def: a chemical that dissolves in water and combines with an acid to create a salt
not showing any honour and having no morals
base.eg: I accused him of having base motives.

base.eng_def: to have a particular town or area, etc. as the main place that you live and work in, or where you do business from
base.chi_def: 以某處（城鎮或地區等）作為生活、工作、經商的主要地點；將某地設為總部

baseball.eng_def: (the ball used in) a game played especially in North America by two teams of nine players, in which a player hits a ball with a bat (= stick) and tries to run around four bases on a large field before the other team returns the ball
baseball.eg: Jake never played baseball like the other kids.

basement.eng_def: a part of a building consisting of rooms that are partly or completely below the level of the ground
basement.eg: Our kitchenware department is in the basement.

basic.eng_def: simple and not complicated, so able to provide the base or starting point from which something can develop
basic.eg: I really need to get some basic financial advice.

basic.eng_def: what a person earns before other amounts of money, such as payments for working extra hours, are added
basic.eg: She earns a basic salary of £450K per annum.

basic.eng_def: a common language for writing computer programs in that uses instructions that are similar to English
basic.chi_def: （用於編寫電腦程式的）BASIC 語言

basics.eng_def: the simplest and most important facts, ideas, or things connected with something
basics.eg: I really must learn the basics of first aid.

basics.eng_def: If you get back to basics, you start to give your attention to the simplest and most important matters after ignoring them for a while.
basics.chi_def: 開始注意最重要的方面；回歸本始
basics.eg: This is all part of a new back-to-basics campaign to raise standards in schools.

basin.eng_def: an open, round container shaped like a bowl with sloping sides, used for holding food or liquid
the amount of something that a basin can hold

basin.eg: I've cleaned the basin and scrubbed the bath.

basin.eng_def: the area of land from which streams run into a river, lake, or sea
a sheltered area of deep water where boats are kept

basis.eng_def: the most important facts, ideas, etc. from which something is developed
basis.eg: This document will form the basis for our discussion.

basis.eng_def: a way or method of doing something
basis.eg: Most of our staff work for us on a voluntary basis (= they work without being paid).

basket.eng_def: a light container, often with a handle, that is made of thin strips of wood, metal, or plastic twisted together, used for carrying or storing things

basket.eg: We picked lots of strawberries, but we'd eaten half the basket by the time we got home.

basket.eng_def: a place on a website where you collect things you plan to buy from the website
basket.eg: There are four items in your basket.

basket.eng_def: In the game of basketball, a basket is an open net hanging from a metal ring through which the players try to throw the ball to score points for their team, or the successful throwing of the ball through the ring.

basket.eg: the value of the pound against a basket of world currencies

basketball.eng_def: (a ball used in) a game played by two teams of five players who score points by throwing a large ball through an open net hanging from a metal ring

bass.eng_def: the lowest range of musical notes, or a man with a singing voice in this range
the set of low musical sounds on a radio, music system, etc.
an electric guitar with four strings that plays very low notes
playing, singing, or producing the lowest range of musical notes
a type of fish found in rivers or the sea

bat.eng_def: a specially shaped piece of wood used for hitting the ball in some games
a small animal like a mouse with wings that flies at night
to open and close your eyes quickly several times, especially to attract attention or admiration
bat.eg: She smiled and batted her eyelashes at him.

bat.eng_def: to try to hit a ball with a bat
bat.eg: He batted the ball high into the air.

batch.eng_def: a group of things or people dealt with at the same time or considered similar in type
batch.eg: The cook brought in a fresh batch of homemade cupcakes.

batch.eng_def: a group of students who are taught together at school, college, or university

bath.eng_def: a long plastic, metal, or ceramic container that is filled with water so that you can sit or lie in it to wash your whole body
the activity of washing yourself or someone else in a bath
bath.eg: Susannah has a long hot bath every evening.

bath.eng_def: to fill a bath with water for washing
bath.eg: I'll run you a bath while you take off those wet clothes.

bath.eng_def: used to refer to a bathroom when describing a home

bath.chi_def: 公共游泳池（同 swimming bath）

bath.eng_def: a public place where people went in the past to have a hot bath
to wash in a bath or to wash someone in a bath

bathe.eng_def: to swim, especially in the sea, a river, or a lake
bathe.eg: Children suffering from the illness had bathed in sea water contaminated by sewage.

bathe.eng_def: to cover something with a liquid, especially in order to make part of the body feel better
bathe.eg: I bathed my feet in salt water.

bathe.eng_def: to cover something in a way that causes a pleasant feeling or appearance
bathe.eg: In the afternoon the sun bathes the city in shades of pink and gold.

bathe.eng_def: to wash in a bath or to wash someone in a bath
an occasion when you swim or spend time in water
bathe.eg: I went for a bathe every evening.

bathroom.eng_def: a room with a bath and/or shower and often a toilet
bathroom.eg: The house has four bedrooms and two bathrooms.

bathroom.eng_def: a room with a toilet in it

batter.eng_def: to hit and behave violently towards a person, especially a woman or child, repeatedly over a long period of time, or to hit something with force many times
batter.chi_def: 接連猛打（尤指婦女、兒童）
batter.eg: He was battered to death with a rifle butt.

batter.eng_def: a mixture of flour, eggs, and milk, used to make pancakes or to cover food before frying it
batter.chi_def: （用麵粉、雞蛋和牛奶混成的）麵糊

batter.eng_def: the person in baseball or rounders who hits the ball

battery.eng_def: a device that produces electricity to provide power for radios, cars, etc.
a number of things of a similar type
battery.chi_def: 一組，一套，一連串（同類事物）
battery.eg: In the kitchen an impressive battery of stainless steel utensils hangs on the wall.

battery.eng_def: a number of large guns and similar weapons operating together in the same place
using a system of producing a large number of eggs cheaply by keeping a lot of chickens in rows of small cages (= boxes made of wire)

battle.eng_def: an argument between two groups or against a situation that a group wants to change
battle.eg: The aid agency continues the battle against ignorance and superstition.

battle.eng_def: a determined effort to achieve something in a difficult situation or to change a bad situation

battle.eg: Police battled with residents in this part of the city for three days.

battle.eng_def: to try hard to achieve something in a difficult situation
battle.eg: He had to battle against prejudice to get a job.

bay.eng_def: a part of the coast where the land curves in so that the sea is surrounded by land on three sides
bay.eg: We sailed into a beautiful, secluded bay.

bay.eng_def: a partly surrounded or marked space
bay.eg: A truck pulled into the loading bay.

bay.eng_def: a small evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) that has leaves that are used to add flavour to food
(of dogs and wolves) to make a long, deep cry repeatedly

bazaar.eng_def: an area of small shops and people selling things, especially in West and South Asia, or any group of small shops or people selling goods of the same type
bazaar.chi_def: （尤指中東和南亞的）市場，市集

bazaar.eng_def: an event where people sell things to raise money, especially for an organization that helps other people

be.eng_def: used to say something about a person, thing, or state, to show a permanent or temporary quality, state, job, etc.
be.chi_def: （用來說明人、事物或狀態，表示性質、狀態、工作等）

be.eng_def: used to show the position of a person or thing in space or time
be.eg: The food was already on the table.

be.eng_def: used to show what something is made of
used to say that someone should or must do something
be.eg: You're to sit in the corner and keep quiet.

be.eng_def: used to show that something will happen in the future
be.eg: We are to (= we are going to) visit Australia in the spring.

be.eng_def: used in conditional sentences to say what might happen
be.chi_def: （用於條件句中，表示可能）萬一，假如
be.eg: If I were to refuse they'd be very annoyed.

be.eng_def: used to say what can happen
be.eg: The exhibition of modern prints is currently to be seen at the City Gallery.
Such terrible suffering should never be.

be.eng_def: used with the present participle of other verbs to describe actions that are or were still continuing
be.chi_def: （與動詞的現在分詞連用，表示動作正在進行）正在，在

be.eng_def: used with the past participle of other verbs to form the passive
be.chi_def: （與動詞的過去分詞連用，表示被動）被
be.eg: I'd like to go but I haven't been asked.

beach.eng_def: an area of sand or small stones near the sea or another area of water such as a lake
beach.eg: We spent the day on the beach.

beach.eng_def: to pull or force a boat, etc. out of the water onto the land
beach.eg: The boat had been beached near the rocks.

bead.eng_def: a small, coloured, often round piece of plastic, wood, glass, etc. with a hole through it. It is usually put on a string with a lot of others to make jewellery
bead.eg: She wore a necklace of brightly coloured wooden beads.

bead.eng_def: a very small amount of liquid
bead.eg: Beads of sweat stood out on his forehead.

beak.eng_def: the hard, pointed part of a bird's mouth
beak.eg: Birds use their beaks to pick up food.
He'd be handsome if it wasn't for that huge beak of his.

beam.eng_def: a line of light that shines from a bright object
beam.eg: We could just pick out the trail in the weak beam of the flashlight.

beam.eng_def: a line of radiation or particles flowing in one direction
a long, thick piece of wood, metal, or concrete, especially used to support weight in a building or other structure
beam.chi_def: （尤指支撐建築物或其他結構的）樑，桁架，棟樑
beam.eg: The sitting room had exposed wooden beams.

beam.eng_def: in the sport of women's gymnastics, a wooden bar on which the competitors balance and perform movements

beam.eg: She beamed with delight/pleasure at his remarks.

beam.eng_def: to send out a beam of light, an electrical or radio signal, etc.
beam.chi_def: 輻射；發光；閃光；發射電波；播送
beam.eg: The sun beamed (= shone brightly) down on the boat as it drifted along.

bean.eng_def: a seed, or the pod containing seeds, of various climbing plants, eaten as a vegetable

bear.eng_def: to accept, tolerate, or endure something, especially something unpleasant
bear.eg: The strain must have been enormous but she bore it well.

bear.eng_def: to be too unpleasant or frightening to think about
bear.eg: "What if she'd been driving faster?" "It doesn't bear thinking about."

bear.eng_def: to have or continue to have something
bear.eg: Their baby bears a strong resemblance to its grandfather.
The chair, too fragile to bear her weight, collapsed.

bear.eng_def: to give birth to young, or (of a tree or plant) to give or produce fruit or flowers
bear.eg: She had borne six children by the time she was 30.

bear.eng_def: to carry and move something to a place
bear.eg: At Christmas the family all arrive at the house bearing gifts.

bear.eng_def: to change direction slightly so that you are going in a particular direction
bear.eg: The path followed the coastline for several miles, then bore inland.

bear.eng_def: to say you know from your own experience that something happened or is true
bear.eg: She bore witness to his patience and diligence.

bear.eng_def: If something bears testimony to a fact, it proves that it is true.
bear.eg: The iron bridge bears testimony to the skills developed in that era.

bear.eng_def: a large, strong wild mammal with a thick fur coat that lives especially in colder parts of Europe, Asia, and North America
an older gay man who is large and has a lot of hair on his body
bear.chi_def: （年齡較大、身材魁梧且多毛的）同性戀男人

bear.eng_def: a person who sells shares when prices are expected to fall, in order to make a profit by buying them back again at a lower price
bear.chi_def: （股市中）做空頭者；（對行情）看跌的人

beard.eng_def: the hair that some men allow to grow on the lower part of their face
the long hair that grows under a goat's mouth
to face, meet, or deal with an unpleasant or frightening person in a brave or determined way
beard.chi_def: 勇敢面對（某人），公然反抗（某人）
beard.eg: With a nervous swallow he bearded the formidable-looking librarian behind the desk.

beast.eng_def: an animal, especially a large or wild one
beast.chi_def: （尤指大型或野生的）動物；野獸

beast.eng_def: an unpleasant, annoying, or cruel person
beast.eg: He was a beast to her throughout their marriage.

beat.eng_def: to defeat or do better than
beat.eg: Simon always beats me at tennis.

beat.eng_def: to be better or more enjoyable than another activity or experience
beat.eg: Taking the bus sure beats walking.

beat.eng_def: To beat something that is going to happen is to take action before the thing happens.
beat.eg: Let's try to beat the traffic by leaving early in the morning.

beat.eng_def: to do something before someone else does it
beat.eg: I was just going to clean the kitchen, but you beat me to it.
They saw him beating his dog with a stick.

beat.eng_def: to form a path in an area where long grass or bushes grow closely together, by hitting the plants with your hands or an object, or by stepping on them
beat.chi_def: 在…中開出一條路；在…中開辟道路
beat.eg: We beat a path through the undergrowth.

beat.eng_def: to mix something repeatedly using a utensil such as a spoon or whisk
beat.chi_def: （用如調羹或攪拌器等器具）攪打，攪拌
beat.eg: To make an omelette you first beat the eggs.

beat.eng_def: to (cause to) make a regular movement or sound
beat.eg: The doctor could feel no pulse beating.

beat.eng_def: to make a regular sound or movement to music

beat.eg: I'm beat - I'm going to bed.

beat.eng_def: a regular movement or sound, especially that made by your heart
beat.eg: I put my head on his chest but I could feel no heartbeat.

beat.eng_def: in music, a regular emphasis, or a place in the music where such an emphasis is expected
beat.eg: The guitar comes in on the third beat.

beat.eng_def: an area for which someone, such as a police officer, has responsibility as part of their job
beat.eg: Bob has worked as an officer on this particular beat for 20 years.

beat.eng_def: A police officer who is on/walking the beat is on duty, walking around rather than driving in a police car.

beautiful.eg: You did a beautiful thing in helping those poor children.

beautify.eng_def: to improve the appearance of someone or something
beautify.chi_def: 給…做美容；美化；修飾，裝飾
beautify.eg: Money has been raised to beautify the area.

beauty.eng_def: the quality of being pleasing, especially to look at, or someone or something that gives great pleasure, especially when you look at it
beauty.eg: This is an area of outstanding natural beauty.

beauty.eng_def: something that is an excellent example of its type
beauty.eg: She showed me her car - it's a beauty.

beauty.eng_def: a quality that makes something especially good or attractive
beauty.eg: The beauty of this plan (= what makes it good) is that it won't cost too much.

because.eg: "Why did you do it?" "Because Carlos told me to".

beckon.eng_def: to move your hand or head in a way that tells someone to come nearer
beckon.eg: The customs official beckoned the woman to his counter.

beckon.eng_def: If something beckons, it attracts people.
beckon.eg: For many young people, the bright lights of the city beckon, though a lot of them end up sleeping on the streets.

beckon.eng_def: If an event or achievement beckons, it is likely to happen.
beckon.eg: She's an excellent student, for whom a wonderful future beckons.

become.eg: I was becoming increasingly suspicious of his motives.

become.eng_def: to cause someone to look attractive, or to be suitable for someone

bed.eng_def: a large, rectangular piece of furniture, often with four legs, used for sleeping on
bed.eg: He lived in a room with only two chairs, a bed, and a table.

bed.eng_def: to make a bed neat after you have slept in it
the bottom of something, or something that serves as a base
bed.eg: Many strange plants and fish live on the sea bed.

bed.eng_def: a pile of one type of food on which other food is arranged as a meal
bed.eg: roasted vegetables on a bed of rice

bed.eng_def: a piece of ground used for growing plants outside
bed.eg: They have some beautiful flower beds in their garden.

bed.eng_def: to put something firmly into a substance or into the ground
bed.chi_def: 把…安置在基礎上；嵌；埋置
bed.eg: The posts should be firmly bedded in concrete.

bed.eng_def: abbreviation for Bachelor of Education: a degree taken by some teachers, or a person who has this degree
bed.chi_def: 教育學士（Bachelor of Education的縮寫）

bedroom.eng_def: a room used for sleeping in

bedroom.chi_def: 有關性愛的；男女性愛的
bedroom.eg: My dad was embarrassed by the bedroom scenes in the play.

bee.eng_def: a yellow and black flying insect that makes honey and can sting you
bee.eg: A swarm of bees flew into the garden.

bee.eng_def: a group of people who come together in order to take part in a particular activity
bee.chi_def: （為從事某一活動而聚在一起的）一小組人

beef.eng_def: the flesh of cattle (= cows), eaten as food
beef.eg: The spaghetti sauce is made with minced (US ground) beef.
My main beef about the job is that I have to work on Saturdays.
He said that the newly published government report didn't have much beef in it.
He was beefing about having to do the shopping.

beep.eng_def: (to cause) to make a short, loud sound
beep.eg: The cab driver beeped (his horn) impatiently at the cyclist.

beep.eng_def: to call someone, for example a doctor, by sending a signal to a beeper that they carry

beep.eg: The voice on the answering machine said "Please leave a message after the beep".

beer.eng_def: an alcoholic drink made from grain and hops (= a type of plant)
beer.eg: He asked for a pint of beer.

beer.eng_def: a glass or container of this drink
beer.eg: After a hard day's work I enjoy a beer or two.

beetle.eng_def: an insect with a hard shell-like back

beetle.eg: Hoping to miss the traffic jams, she beetled off home at four o'clock.

beetle.eng_def: a brand name for a small car with a rounded front, top, and back, made by the company Volkswagen
beetle.chi_def: （福斯汽車公司生產的）金龜車

before.eng_def: at or during a time earlier than (the thing mentioned)
before.eg: You should always wash your hands before meals.
It was an hour before the police arrived.
He said he had never seen her before.
The letter K comes before L in the English alphabet.

before.eng_def: If a place is before another place, you will arrive at it first when you are travelling towards the second place.
before.eg: The bus stop is just before the school.

before.eng_def: If something is before someone or before a group of people, it will be formally considered or examined by that person or group.
before.eg: The proposal before the committee is that we try and reduce our spending by ten percent.

beforehand.eg: I knew she was coming that afternoon because she had phoned beforehand to say so.

beg.eng_def: to make a very strong and urgent request
to ask for food or money because you are poor
beg.eg: There are more and more homeless people begging on the streets these days.

beg.eng_def: If a dog begs, it sits with its front legs in the air as if to ask for something.
beg.eg: They have trained their dog to sit up and beg.

beg.eng_def: a polite way of saying "I am sorry" or "Could you repeat what you just said?"
beg.chi_def: （未聽清時，禮貌的說法）對不起，能否再說一遍？

beg.eng_def: a way of showing that you are angry about something that someone has just said.
beg.chi_def: （表示生氣，感覺受到冒犯）你說什麼？再說一遍！
beg.eg: I beg your pardon? I hope you're not implying that I lied!

beggar.eng_def: a poor person who lives by asking others for money or food
a person, especially when you are expressing an opinion about something that they have done, or that has happened to them
beggar.eg: You've won again, you lucky beggar.

beggar.eng_def: to make a person or organization, etc. extremely poor
beggar.chi_def: 使（人或組織等）極度貧窮

begin.eng_def: to start to happen or exist
begin.eg: What time does the concert begin?
I began the book six months ago, but I can't seem to finish it.
"Well," he began. "I don't quite know how to tell you this."

begin.eng_def: to have something as the first part
begin.eg: The word "cat" begins with the letter "c".

beginner.eng_def: a person who is starting to do something or learn something for the first time
beginner.eg: This judo class is for beginners only.

behalf.eg: On behalf of the entire company, I would like to thank you for all your work.

behalf.eng_def: for the good of or because of
behalf.eg: Please don't leave on my behalf.

behave.eng_def: to act in a particular way
behave.eg: She always behaves well/badly when her aunts come to visit.

behave.eng_def: to show particular behaviour in a particular situation or under particular conditions
behave.chi_def: （在某种環境或條件下）做出特定行為
behave.eg: They learn how particles behave in solids, liquids, and gases.

behave.eng_def: to be good by acting in a way that has society's approval

behavior.eng_def: the way that a person, an animal, a substance, etc. behaves in a particular situation or under particular conditions
behavior.chi_def: （在某种環境或條件下的）特定行為
behavior.eg: His research involved the study of instinctive behaviour in birds.

behind.eng_def: in the place where someone or something was before
behind.eg: I was annoyed to discover that I'd left my bag behind.

behind.eng_def: slower or later than someone else, or than you should be
behind.eg: The old woman was behind with (= late paying) the rent.

behind.eng_def: responsible for or the cause of
behind.eg: He wondered what was behind his neighbour's sudden friendliness.

behind.eng_def: the part of the body on which a person sits
behind.eg: He tripped and fell on his behind.

being.eng_def: a person or thing that exists
being.eg: A nuclear war would kill millions of living beings.
We do not know exactly how life first came into being (= began to exist.)

belief.eng_def: the feeling of being certain that something exists or is true
belief.eg: His belief in God gave him hope during difficult times.
All religious and political beliefs should be respected equally.

belief.eng_def: too bad, good, difficult, etc. to be imagined
belief.chi_def: （太壞、太好、太艱難等）令人難以置信
belief.eg: The brutality of the murders was beyond belief.

believable.eng_def: If something is believable, it seems possible, real, or true.
believable.eg: I didn't find any of the characters in the film believable.

believe.eng_def: to think that something is true, correct, or real
believe.eg: Strangely, no one believed us when we told them we'd been visited by a creature from Mars.

believe.eng_def: to not believe that something is true
believe.eg: He told me she was just a friend, but I don't believe a word of it!

believe.eng_def: said when telling someone about something that is true, although it seems unlikely
believe.eg: He's upstairs doing his homework, believe it or not.

believe.eng_def: said when emphasizing that something is true
something that you say to emphasize that something is obviously not true
believe.chi_def: （用於強調）根本不可能是真的
believe.eg: He said the car in front backed into him, and if you believe that, you'll believe anything!

bell.eng_def: an electrical device that makes a ringing sound when you press a button
bell.eg: I stood at the front door and rang the bell several times.

bell.eng_def: a hollow metal object shaped like a cup that makes a ringing sound when hit by something hard, especially a clapper
bell.eg: The church bells rang out to welcome in the New Year.

belly.eng_def: the stomach or the front part of the body between your chest and your legs
belly.eg: He fell asleep with a full belly and a happy heart.

belly.eng_def: the rounded or curved part of an object
belly.eg: The belly of the aircraft was painted red.

belong.eng_def: to be in the right place or a suitable place
belong.eg: This table belongs in the sitting room.

belong.eng_def: to feel happy or comfortable in a situation
belong.eg: After three years in Cambridge, I finally feel as if I belong here.

belongings.eng_def: the things that a person owns, especially those that can be carried
belongings.eg: I put a few personal belongings in a bag and left the house for the last time.

beloved.eg: Her beloved husband died last year.

beloved.eng_def: someone that you love and who you have a romantic relationship with
beloved.eg: He's sending some flowers to his beloved.

below.chi_def: 在較低處；在某平面之下；（位置）低於
below.eg: From the top of the skyscraper the cars below us looked like insects.

below.eng_def: less than a particular amount or level
below.eg: They have three children below the age of (= younger than) four.

belt.eng_def: a strip of leather or material worn around the waist to support clothes or for decoration
belt.eg: She fastened her belt tightly around her waist.

belt.eng_def: a flat strip of material in a machine that moves along continuously to keep another part turning, or to keep objects on it moving along

an area, usually just outside a city, where a particular group of people live, such as the commuter belt and the stockbroker belt, or an area that is known for a particular characteristic, such as the cotton belt (= an area where cotton is grown)
(especially of a vehicle) to travel with great speed
belt.eg: The car was belting along/down the road.

belt.eng_def: to hit someone or something hard, especially with violence
belt.eg: He belted him in the face.

belt.eng_def: to tie something with a belt

bench.eng_def: a long, usually hard seat for two or more people, often found in public places
bench.eg: a park bench (= a seat in a public garden)

bench.eng_def: a long table for working on, for example when you are making something
bench.eg: Most of the work constructing these objects is done at a bench.

bench.eng_def: a long table that you lie on to do exercises (= physical activity), for example in a gym
a seat or area of seats where players sit during a game when they are not playing
bench.chi_def: 運動員休息區；後備隊員席
bench.eg: He was injured, and spent the last few weeks of the season on the bench.

bench.eng_def: the judge or magistrate in a law court, or the place where he or she sits
bench.eg: Please address your remarks to the bench, Mr Smith.

bench.eng_def: to work as a judge or magistrate
If a judge takes the bench, he or she begins a formal meeting of a law court.
in the UK parliament building, the seats used by the members
bench.eg: There was jeering from the Labour benches.

bench.eng_def: to not allow someone to take part in a sports game or playground activity, as a punishment or because they are injured
bench.chi_def: 把（場上隊員）換下；罰（場上隊員）下場；不讓（隊員）上場
bench.eg: The coach benched his star pitcher for skipping practice.
He looks like he could bench 400 pounds.

bend.eg: The road bends to the left after the traffic lights.

bend.eng_def: to move your body or part of your body so that it is not straight
bend.eg: I bent down and picked up the coins lying on the road.

bend.eng_def: in a position in which the knee of one leg is touching the floor
bend.eg: He went down on bended knee to ask her to marry him.
There's a bend in the pipe so you can't see from one end to the other.

bend.eng_def: in football, the curve in which a ball moves when it has been kicked in a particular way
bend.chi_def: （足球比賽中的）弧線球，香蕉球
bend.eg: Good players can put bend on the ball.

bend.eng_def: a serious medical condition that divers (= people who swim underwater) get when they come up to the surface of the water too quickly

beneath.eng_def: in or to a lower position than someone or something, under someone or something
beneath.chi_def: 在（或往）…下面；在（或往）…下方
beneath.eg: Jaime hid the letter beneath a pile of papers.

beneath.eng_def: to not be good enough for someone
beneath.eg: Office work of any description he felt was beneath him.
She looked out of the window at the children playing beneath.

beneficial.eg: The improvement in sales figures had a beneficial effect/influence on the company as a whole.

benefit.eng_def: a helpful or good effect, or something intended to help
benefit.eg: The discovery of oil brought many benefits to the town.

benefit.eng_def: an advantage such as medical insurance, life insurance, and sick pay, that employees receive from their employer in addition to money
benefit.chi_def: （僱主為員工提供的）福利政策（如醫療保險、人壽保險、病假補助方案等）
benefit.eg: In addition to my salary, I get a pension and medical benefits.

benefit.eng_def: the money given by the government to people who need financial help, for example because they cannot find a job
something such as a pension or health insurance that an employee receives in addition to their salary (= money)
benefit.chi_def: （員工得到的）補助，額外收入（如退休金、健康保險金等）
benefit.eg: Management is trying to cut employee pay and benefits.

benefit.eng_def: an event such as a concert, performance, etc. that is organized in order to raise money for people in need
to be helped by something or to help someone
benefit.chi_def: 得益，受惠；使受益；對…有幫助
benefit.eg: I feel that I have benefited greatly from her wisdom.

berry.eng_def: a small, round fruit on particular plants and trees

beside.eng_def: at the side of, next to
beside.eg: Come and sit here beside me.

beside.eng_def: compared to another person or thing
beside.eg: Those books seem very dull beside this one.

beside.eng_def: to be in no way connected to the subject that is being discussed
beside.chi_def: 離題，與討論的問題無關
beside.eg: Let's stick to discussing whether the road should be built at all. The exact cost is beside the point.

besides.eg: She won't mind if you're late - besides, it's hardly your fault.

besiege.eng_def: to surround a place, especially with an army, to prevent people or supplies getting in or out
besiege.eg: The town had been besieged for two months but still resisted the aggressors.

besiege.eng_def: When someone is besieged, a lot of people surround them.
besiege.eg: When the pop star tried to leave her hotel, she was besieged by waiting journalists and fans.

besiege.eng_def: to make many requests or complaints about something
besiege.eg: After showing the controversial documentary, the channel was besieged with phone calls from angry viewers.

best.eng_def: of the highest quality, or being the most suitable, pleasing, or effective type of thing or person
best.chi_def: 最好的；最出色的；最優秀的
best.eg: This is the best meal I've ever had.

best.eng_def: in the most suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory way, or to the greatest degree
best.eg: Which evening would suit you best for the party?

best.eng_def: to the greatest degree when used as the superlative of adjectives beginning with "good" or "well"
best.chi_def: （以 good 或 well 開頭的最高級形容詞）
best.eg: They were the best-dressed couple at the party.
It is a difficult passage, but just translate it as best you can.

best.eng_def: the most excellent in a group of things or people
best.eg: My tastes are simple - I only like the best.

best.eng_def: used to say goodbye, or to end a letter to someone you know well, or to send good wishes to someone
best.chi_def: （用於告別或信末祝福）祝一切順利！
best.eg: All the best to your parents!

best.eng_def: even when considered in the most positive way
best.eg: The food was bland at best, and at worst completely inedible.

best.eng_def: at the highest standard that can be achieved
best.eg: The documentary was an example of investigative journalism at its best.

best.eng_def: to be as active or intelligent as you can be
best.eg: I'm not at my best in the morning.

best.eng_def: this is the most pleasing thing
best.eg: There was wonderful food, good company, and, best of all, a jazz band.

best.eng_def: used to wish someone success before a test, etc. or a difficult activity
best.eg: Best of luck on your finals!

best.eng_def: In a sport such as tennis, if you play the best of a particular number of games, you play that number of games and the winner is the player who wins the greatest number of those games.
best.eg: Shall we play the best of five?

best.eng_def: to make the greatest effort possible
best.eg: It doesn't matter if you fail, just do your best.

best.eng_def: If you have had the best of something, you have enjoyed the most pleasant part of it, and everything that is left is worse.
best.eg: I think we've already had the best of the hot weather this summer.
Just do the job to the best of your ability.

best.eng_def: from what I know and understand from the information that I have
best.eg: To the best of my knowledge, the chemicals which were found are not dangerous.

best.eng_def: If an action is for the best, it is done to improve a situation or produce a good result, although it might seem unpleasant at the time.
best.eg: Ending a relationship is always hard but in this case it's for the best.

best.eng_def: to make an unsatisfactory situation as pleasant as possible
best.chi_def: 盡可能善用（不令人滿意的處境）
best.eg: We'll have to spend the night here, so we might as well make the best of it.

best.eng_def: to defeat someone in a fight or competition
best.eg: He bested his opponent in just two rounds.

bet.eng_def: to risk money on the result of an event or a competition, such as a horse race, in the hope of winning more money
bet.eg: He regularly goes to the races and bets heavily.

bet.eng_def: If you say you bet (someone) that something is true or will happen, you mean you are certain that it is true or will happen.
bet.eg: I bet you (that) she's missed the bus.

bet.eng_def: an amount of money that you risk on the result of an event or a competition, such as a horse race
bet.eg: She had a bet on the race.
My bet is (that) their baby will be a girl.

betray.eng_def: to not be loyal to your country or a person, often by doing something harmful such as helping their enemies
betray.eg: He was accused of betraying his country during the war.

betray.eng_def: If someone betrays something such as a promise, they do not do what they promised.
betray.eg: The president has been accused of betraying his election promises.

betray.eng_def: to show feelings, thoughts, or a particular characteristic without intending to
betray.eg: If he is nervous on stage, he does not betray it.

better.eng_def: comparative of  good : of a higher standard, or more suitable, pleasing, or effective than other things or people
better.eg: He stood near the front to get a better view.

better.eng_def: If you are or get better after an illness or injury, you are healthy again.
better.eg: I hope you get better soon.
After the ceasefire, the situation in the capital got better.

better.eng_def: in a more suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory way, or to a greater degree
better.eg: The next time he took the test, he was better prepared.

better.eng_def: to a greater degree, when used as the comparative of adjectives beginning with "good" or "well"
better.chi_def: （表示以 good 或 well 開頭的形容詞比較級）更，更大程度地
better.eg: She is better-looking (= more attractive) than her brother.

better.eng_def: used to say that a particular choice would be more satisfactory
better.eg: Why don't you give her a call or, better still, go and see her?

better.eng_def: used to give advice or to make a threat
better.eg: You'd better (= you should) go home now before the rain starts.
You would do better to bring the plants inside when the weather gets colder.

better.eng_def: something that is of a higher standard than something else
better.eg: He ran the 100 metres in 9.91 seconds, and I have not seen better (= a faster result) this year.

better.eng_def: behaviour, work, or treatment that is more suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory
better.chi_def: 更合適的舉止；較令人滿意的工作；更好的待遇
better.eg: You shouldn't be so mean to your mother - she deserves better.

better.eng_def: people of a higher rank or social position than you
better.eg: As children, we were taught not to argue with our elders and betters.
The organization was established to better conditions for the disabled.

better.eng_def: to improve your social position, often by getting a better job or education
better.chi_def: 提高自身的水準；改善自身的社會地位
better.eg: He tried to better himself by taking evening classes.

between.eng_def: in or into the space that separates two places, people, or objects
between.eg: The town lies halfway between Rome and Florence.

between.eng_def: If something is between two amounts, it is greater than the first amount but smaller than the second.
in the period of time that separates two different times or events
among two or more people or things
between.chi_def: 在（兩個或兩個以上的人或事）之間
between.eg: The money was divided equally between several worthy causes.

between.eng_def: A discussion, argument, or game between two or more people or groups of people involves both people or groups.
between.chi_def: （討論、爭論或比賽）發生在…之間
between.eg: The negotiations between the union and management have broken down.

between.eng_def: If you choose between two things, you choose one thing or the other.
between.eg: You'll have to choose between a holiday or a new washing machine.

between.eng_def: connecting two or more places, things, or people
between.eg: There is a regular train service between Glasgow and Edinburgh.
He commutes daily between Baltimore and Washington, D.C.
The wall between East and West Berlin came down in 1989.

beverage.eg: Hot beverages include tea, coffee, and hot chocolate.

beware.eng_def: used to warn someone to be very careful about something or someone
beware.eg: Beware salespeople who promise offers that seem too good to be true.

beware.eng_def: used on signs to warn people of something dangerous

beyond.eng_def: further away in the distance (than something)
beyond.eg: In the distance, beyond the river, was a small town.
Few people live beyond the age of a hundred.

beyond.eng_def: too great or bad for anyone to believe, repair, recognize, etc.
beyond.chi_def: 太…而難以置信（無法修復，難以辨認等）

beyond.eng_def: If a legal case or a person's guilt is proved beyond reasonable doubt, there is enough proof for the person accused of a crime to be judged guilty.
beyond.chi_def: （案件或罪行）證據確鑿的，確實的
beyond.eg: Her guilt was established beyond reasonable doubt.

beyond.eng_def: If something is beyond you, you are unable to understand it.

bias.eng_def: the action of supporting or opposing a particular person or thing in an unfair way, because of allowing personal opinions to influence your judgment
bias.eg: The senator has accused the media of bias.

bias.eng_def: the fact of preferring a particular subject or thing
bias.eg: She showed a scientific bias at an early age.

bias.eng_def: a direction at an angle across the threads of woven material
bias.eg: The dresses in his new winter collection are all cut on the bias (= in a diagonal direction across the cloth).

bias.eng_def: to cause someone or something to have a bias
bias.eg: The judge ruled that the information should be withheld on the grounds that it would bias the jury against the accused.

bicycle.eng_def: a two-wheeled vehicle that you sit on and move by turning the two pedals (= flat parts you press with your feet)
bicycle.eg: I go to work by bicycle.

bid.eng_def: to offer a particular amount of money for something that is for sale and compete against other people to buy it, especially at a public sale of goods or property
bid.chi_def: （尤指在拍賣中）出價，喊價競買
bid.eg: She knew she couldn't afford it, so she didn't bid.

bid.eng_def: If two or more people bid for a job, they compete with each other to do the work by offering to do it for a particular amount of money.
bid.eg: The department is trying to ensure fairer competition among firms bidding for city contracts.

bid.eng_def: If someone bids to do something, they compete with other people to do it.
bid.eg: Paris is bidding to host the next Olympics.

bid.eng_def: (in some card games) to say, before play starts, how many points you expect to win in a particular game
bid.eg: Before you decide how to bid, you need to evaluate how strong the hand of cards you are holding is.

bid.eng_def: to give a greeting to someone, or to ask someone to do something
an offer of a particular amount of money for something that is for sale
bid.eg: I made a bid of $150 for the painting.

bid.eng_def: an offer to do something when you are competing with other people to do it
bid.eg: Sydney made a successful bid to host the Olympic Games.

bid.eng_def: (in some card games) a statement, made before play starts, of how many points a player thinks he or she will get in a particular game
bid.eg: The declarer must make as many tricks as his bid has promised.

bid.eng_def: an attempt to achieve or get something
bid.eg: Her bid for re-election was unsuccessful.

big.eng_def: older or more like an adult
big.eg: Her big (= older) sister/brother told her to go away.

big.eng_def: important, because of being powerful, or having a lot of influence or a serious effect
big.chi_def: 重要的；影響大的；嚴重的
big.eg: He had a big decision to make.

big.eng_def: to be important or famous in a particular place or type of work
big.eg: They're big in Japan, but no one's heard of them here.

big.eng_def: If a product or activity is big, it is extremely popular.

bike.eg: It would be better for the environment if more people used bikes rather than cars.
Do you want to bike to the park, or walk?

bike.eng_def: to use a motorcycle to take something to someone
bike.eg: We biked a copy over to Greg at the BBC.

bill.eng_def: a request for payment of money owed, or the piece of paper on which it is written
a formal statement of a planned new law that is discussed before being voted on
a paper sign giving information about something, especially an event or performance
to be performing in a show
bill.eg: There were lots of big names (= famous people) on the bill.

bill.eng_def: to be the most important actor in a show
to give or send someone a bill asking for money that they owe for a product or service
bill.eg: Please bill me for any expenses you incur.

bill.eng_def: to advertise something with a particular description; to describe someone in a particular way in order to advertise them or make them known
bill.eg: The movie was billed as a romantic comedy.

bill.eng_def: to list a person or performance on a programme of events
bill.eg: She was billed to perform every night for a period of two weeks.

billion.eg: The population of China is over a/one billion.
There were billions of flies everywhere.

bind.eng_def: to tie something tightly or to fasten something
bind.eg: They bound the packages with brightly coloured ribbon.
The things that bind them together are greater than their differences.

bind.eng_def: To bind a part of the body, especially a part that is damaged, is to tie something around it.
bind.eg: He had already bound the child's arm when I arrived.

bind.eng_def: to sew or stick material along the edges of something such as a jacket, in order to make it stronger or to decorate it
to make separate pieces of paper into a book
bind.eg: There are several different ways to bind a book, for example you can stitch or stick the pages together.

bind.eng_def: When an egg or water is used, especially in cooking, to bind something, it provides a way of making everything stick together in a solid mass.
a difficult or annoying situation in which you are prevented from acting as you might like
bind.eg: Having to visit her every week is a terrible bind.

bingo.eng_def: a game in which prizes can be won by matching numbers on a card with those chosen by chance
bingo.chi_def: 賓果遊戲（一種賭博遊戲）

bingo.eng_def: an expression of surprise and, usually, pleasure, for example when something happens successfully
bingo.eg: I was just about to borrow some money when bingo! - the cheque arrived.

binoculars.eng_def: a pair of tubes with glass lenses at either end that you look through to see things far away more clearly

biochemistry.eng_def: the scientific study of the chemistry of living things

biography.eng_def: the life story of a person written by someone else
biography.eg: He wrote a biography of Winston Churchill.

biological.eng_def: connected with the natural processes of living things
biological.chi_def: 生物的；與生命過程有關的

biological.eg: She decided to search for her biological mother after her adoptive parents died.

biological.eng_def: used to describe a substance used for cleaning that uses enzymes to remove dirt
biological.chi_def: 生物（洗滌）的；加（生化）酶的

biological.eng_def: using living matter, such as bacteria, to seriously harm and kill people and animals, and to damage crops

biology.eng_def: the scientific study of the natural processes of living things

bird.eng_def: a creature with feathers and wings, usually able to fly

birth.eng_def: the time when a baby or young animal comes out of its mother's body

birth.eg: The percentage of live births (= children who are born alive and continue to live) continues to increase.

birth.eng_def: the position of the family into which you are born, especially its social position
birth.chi_def: （尤指標誌社會地位的）血統，出身
birth.eg: He had received all the advantages of birth (= having been born into a family of a high social class) and an expensive education.

birth.eng_def: born in a particular place or having parents of a particular nationality
birth.eg: Oscar Wilde was Irish by birth.
These asteroids were formed at the birth of the solar system.

biscuit.eng_def: a small, flat cake that is dry and usually sweet
a type of bread usually baked in small, round pieces

bit.eng_def: a small piece or amount of something
bit.eg: Would you like a bit of chocolate?

bit.eng_def: a short distance or period of time
bit.chi_def: 一小段距離；一小段時間
bit.eg: I'm just going out for a bit. See you later.

bit.eng_def: a slight but not serious amount or type of something
bit.eg: Maria's put on a bit of weight, hasn't she?
The dress is a bit too big for me.
I saved up the money bit by bit.
She wasn't a bit worried about the test.
They have quite a bit of money.
The car was blown to bits.
I love my son to bits.

bit.eng_def: a piece of metal put in a horse's mouth to allow the person riding it to control its movements
a unit of information in a computer that must be either 0 or 1
bit.chi_def: 比特，二進制位，位元（電腦訊息單位）
bit.eg: a 32-bit computer (= a computer that processes 32 bits of information at a time)

bit.eng_def: a coin representing a small amount of money
an amount of money that is equal to 12 1/2 cents, usually used in the expression "two bits," or 25 cents
bit.chi_def: 一角兩分半，12.5美分（常用來說25美分，即「two bits」）

bit.eng_def: the part of a tool used for cutting or drilling (= making holes)

bite.eng_def: to use your teeth to cut into something or someone
When a fish bites, it swallows the food on the hook (= curved piece of wire) at the end of a fishing line.
If an insect or snake bites you, it injures you by making a small hole in your skin.
bite.eg: An insect bit me on the arm.

bite.eng_def: to have a bad or unpleasant effect
bite.chi_def: 產生不良影響；起不良作用
bite.eg: Higher mortgage rates are beginning to bite.

bite.eng_def: to show interest in buying something
bite.eg: The new service is now available but clients don't seem to be biting.
He took a bite (= bit a piece) out of the apple.

bite.eng_def: a sore place or injury where a person, an animal, or an insect has bitten you
the act of a fish biting the hook (= curved piece of wire) on the end of a fishing line so that it is caught
to eat a small amount of food or a small meal
If food has bite, it has a sharp or strong taste.
bite.chi_def: 強烈的味道，辛辣的味道

bitter.eng_def: Someone who is bitter is angry and unhappy because they cannot forget bad things that happened in the past.
bitter.chi_def: 極為不滿的；怨恨的；無法釋懷的
bitter.eg: I feel very bitter about my childhood and all that I went through.

bitter.eng_def: A bitter experience causes deep pain or anger.
bitter.chi_def: 使人痛苦的；令人憤怒的
bitter.eg: Failing the final exams was a bitter disappointment for me.

bitter.eng_def: expressing a lot of hate and anger
bitter.chi_def: 充滿仇恨的；憤怒的；激烈的

bitter.eng_def: Bitter weather is extremely cold, especially in a way that causes physical pain.
a type of dark brown beer with a bitter taste
a strong, bitter alcoholic drink made from spices and plant products that is mixed with other alcoholic drinks

bizarre.chi_def: 怪誕的；罕見的；異乎尋常的

black.eng_def: having the darkest colour there is, like the colour of coal or of a very dark night
relating or belonging to people with black or dark brown skin, especially people who live in Africa or whose family originally came from Africa
without any milk or cream added
black.eg: a cup of strong black coffee

black.eng_def: the colour of coal or of the sky on a very dark night
black.eg: She often dresses in black (= in black clothes).

black.eng_def: Black and white photography has no colours except black, white, and grey.
black.eg: The old newsreels were filmed in black and white.

black.eng_def: to put a black substance on something or to make something black
black.eg: The soldiers used to black their faces.

black.eng_def: If a trade union or other organization blacks goods or people, it refuses to handle or work with them.
black.chi_def: （工會）抵制（貨物或人）；拒絕（與某人工作）

blackboard.eng_def: a dark surface on a wall or frame that a teacher writes on with chalk (= white substance)

blacksmith.eng_def: a person who makes and repairs iron objects and horseshoes

blade.eng_def: the flat part on a knife or similar tool or weapon, with a very thin edge used for cutting
blade.eg: a sword with a steel blade

blade.eng_def: a wide, flat part on a tool or machine, used to push back water or air
blade.chi_def: （機器上推動水或空氣的）槳葉，槳身

blade.eng_def: used in the names of other objects that are flat, thin, and sometimes long, like a blade
blade.chi_def: （用於扁平細長的刀片形物體名稱中）

blade.eng_def: a long, narrow leaf of grass or a similar plant
the metal part on the bottom of an ice skate
